afr: 11 feb 2010agbare speaker.
eng: 11 feb 2010honorouble speaker.

afr: hierdie poste is in areas soos konstruksie, tuis- en gemeenskapsgebaseerde sorg en omgewingsprojekte.
eng: this includes local infrastructure and tertiary projects and literacy projects, home-based care, school maintenance and early childhood development initiatives.

afr: 13 feb 2014agbare speaker van die nasionale vergadering,voorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies.
eng: honourable speaker of the national assembly,chairperson of the national council of provinces.

afr: adjunkspeaker van die nasionale vergadering en adjunkvoorsitter van die nrp.
eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop.

afr: adjunkpresident van die republiek, agbare kgalema motlanthe.
eng: deputy president of the republic, honourable kgalema motlanthe.

afr: voormalige adjunkpresident baleka mbethe,agbare hoofregter van die republiek, en alle agbare lede van die regbank.
eng: former deputy president baleka mbethe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary.

afr: agbare ministers en adjunkministers,agbare premiers en speakers van ons provinsies.
eng: honourable ministers and deputy ministers,distinguished premiers and speakers of our provinces.

afr: voorsitter van salga, en leierskap van die plaaslike regering.
eng: chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership.

afr: voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers.
eng: chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders.

afr: hoofde van hoofstuk 9-instellings.
eng: heads of chapter 9 institutions.

afr: die goewerneur van die reserwebank,leiers van die sake-, sport-, tradisionele, en godsdienssektor, en alle ander sektore,lede van die diplomatieke korps, spesiale en eerbare gaste,agbare lede,mede-suid-afrikaners,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.
eng: the governor of the reserve bank,leaders from business, sports, traditional, religious and all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps, special and distinguished guests,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.

afr: ek bedankl graag die voorsittende beamptes vir die geleentheid om met hierdie laaste staatsrede van die vierde demokratiese administrasie, die mense van suid-afrika toe te spreek.
eng: i wish to thank the presiding officers for this opportunity to speak to the people of south africa, on this occasion of the last state of the nation address, of the fourth democratic administration.

afr: ek betuig my innige medelye met die afsterwe van die agbare mnr ben skhosana, een van die langs-dienende en mees senior lede van dié vooraanstaande huis en ons voormalige minister van korrektiewe dienste.
eng: i would like to extend our deepest condolences on the passing of the late honourable mr ben skhosana, one of the longest serving and most senior members of this august house and our former minister of correctional services.

afr: ons is opreg jammer oor sy skielike afsterwe.
eng: we are truly saddened by his sudden passing.

afr: ons betuig ons innige meegevoel met sy familie asook met die leier van die ifp, shenge, en al die lede van die ifp.
eng: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.

afr: agbare speaker,agbare voorsitter van die nrp,dit is die eerste staatsrede wat in die afwesigheid van ons eerste president, sy eksellensie nelson rolihlahla mandela gelewer word.
eng: )honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,this is the first state of the nation address to take place in the absence of our founding president, his excellency nelson rolihlahla mandela.

afr: sy afsterwe op die vooraand van die 20ste jaar van vryheid en demokrasie was vir suid-afrikaners, asook mense buite ons grense, besonder pynlik.
eng: his passing, on the eve of the 20th year of our freedom and democracy,caused untold pain to our people and beyond our borders.

afr: ons vind troos in die wete dat madiba vir ewig in ons harte sal voortleef en dat ons 'n plig het om sy nalatenskap voort te sit.
eng: we find solace in the knowledge that madiba will live forever be in our hearts, and that we have a duty to take his legacy forward.

afr: agbare lede,ons land het mans en vroue van aansien voortgebring, wat in moeilike tye leierskap gebied het.
eng: honourable members,our country has produced men and women of distinction, who have provided leadership during trying times.

afr: een so 'n leier was mnr moses kotane, voormalige tesourier-generaal van die anc en die voormalige algemene sekretaris van die sakp.
eng: one such leader was mr moses kotane, former treasurer-general of the anc and former sacp general secretary.

afr: dit is vir ons ’n eer om sy geliefde vrou, mama rebecca kotane, vanaand as ’n spesiale gas hier te verwelkom.
eng: we are honouredto have his dear wife, mama rebecca kotane, as our special guest this evening.

afr: mama kotane het gister 102 jaar oud geword, en ons wens haar alles van die beste toe.
eng: mama kotane turned 102 years old yesterday, and we wish her all the best.

afr: ons bring ook hulde aan die voormalige anc president mnr oliver tambo, wat die vlam van vryheid gedurende die donkerste dae van ons stryd plaaslik sowel as in die buiteland laat aanhou brand het.
eng: we also pay tribute to the former anc president mr oliver tambo, who kept the torch of freedom alive both at home and abroad during the most difficult times of our struggle.

afr: sy seun dali en skoondogter rachel deel ook vanaand hierdie besondere geleentheid met ons.
eng: his son, dali and his wife rachel are sharing this occasion with us this evening.

afr: ons salueer solomon mahlangu, 'n dapper jongman wat in 1979 op die ouderdom van 23 met trots aan die galg gesterf het.
eng: we salute solomon mahlangu, a brave young man who went defiantly to the gallows in 1979 where he was executed at the age of 23. he said: “my blood will nourish the tree that will bear the fruits of freedom.

afr: sê vir my mense ek is lief vir hulle.
eng: tell my people that i love them.

afr: hulle moet die stryd voortsit.’’ons het die eer om sy moeder, mama martha mahlangu, en haar agterkleindogter bathabile hier te verwelkom.
eng: we are honoured to host his mother, mama martha mahlangu and her grand-daughter bathabile.

afr: die jaar 2014 is ook die 40ste herdenking van die lafhartige moord in 1974 op die studenteleier abram onkgopotse tiro met 'n pakketbom in botswana.
eng: the year 2014 also marks the 40th anniversary of the cowardly murder through a parcel bomb, of student leader, abram onkgopotse tiro in 1974 in botswana.

afr: ons verwelkom sy broer, mogomotsi tiro, by hierdie geleentheid.
eng: we welcome his brother, mogomotsi tiro to this occasion.

afr: ons betuig graag ons dank vir sy broer se onbaatsugtige opoffering.
eng: we express the gratitude of the people, for his brother’s selfless sacrifice.

afr: ons onthou diegene wat in die 1980's en 1990's in die geweld wat deur die destydse regering in ons townships en dorpies aangehits is gesterf het.
eng: we remember those who died in state-sponsored violence of the 1980s and 1990s in our townships and villages.

afr: me jabu ndlovu, 'n voormalige vakbondverteenwoordiger van die nasionale unie van mynwerkers van suid-afrika (numsa) is in 1988 in pietermaritzburg saam met haar man jabulani en hulle seun doodgeskiet.
eng: ms jabu ndlovu, a former shopsteward of the national union of metalworkers of south africa (numsa), was gunned down in 1988 in pietermaritzburg together with her husband jabulani and their son.

afr: ons verwelkom haar dogter, luhle, en seun, sanele, en bring hulde aan alle families regoor die politieke spektrum wat geliefdes aan die dood afgestaan het.
eng: we welcome her daughter luhle and son, sanele, and pay tribute to all families who lost their loved ones, across the political spectrum.

afr: agbare speaker,agbare voorsitter van die nrp,ons het daarin geslaag om die pyn van die verlede te oorwin en 'n nuwe samelewing te bou.
eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,we were able to overcome all that pain of the past and build a new society.

afr: ons het sterk instellings van demokrasie gebou.
eng: we have built strong institutions of democracy.

afr: ons het die ondemokratiese, nie-verteenwoordigende, onderdrukkende en korrupte staat wat 'n minderheid gedien het, begrawe.
eng: we buried the undemocratic, unrepresentative, oppressive and corrupt state that was serving a minority.

afr: ons het 'n verenigde, nie-rassige, nie-seksistiese demokratiese staat gevestig, wat verantwoordbaar is teenoor en verteenwoordigend is van alle suid-afrikaners.
eng: we formed a unitary, non-racial, non-sexist democratic state, answerable to and representative of all south africans.

afr: ons het 'n florerende grondwetlike demokrasie geskep, met goed-funksionerende afdelings van die staat – die wetgewende, die uitvoerende en die regsprekende gesag.
eng: we created a thriving constitutional democracy, with well-functioning arms of the state –the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.

afr: ons het hoofstuk 9-instellings gevestig wat demokrasie ondersteun en die regte van alle burgers beskerm.
eng: we have chapter 9 institutions which support democracy and protect the rights of citizens.¬liberation and democracy have also created space for an active civil society and a free media.

afr: vryheid en demokrasie het ook geleenthede geskep vir 'n aktiewe burgerlike samelewing en 'n vrye pers.
eng: liberation also brought for the first time, the promise of gender equality.

afr: die verteenwoordiging van vroue in openbare instellings het sedert die begin van demokrasie aansienlik toegeneem, terwyl die uitbreiding van basiese dienste ook tot voordeel van vroue strek.
eng: the representation of women in public institutions has increased considerably since the dawn of freedom, and the extension of basic services also benefits women.

afr: al hierdie kenmerke maak van suid-afrika 'n veel beter plek om in te leef as ooit vantevore.
eng: all these attributes have made south africa a much better place to live in now than it has ever been.

afr: ons land worstel egter steeds daagliks met die drievoudige uitdaging van armoede, ongelykheid en werkloosheid.
eng: however, our country still faces the triple challenge of poverty, inequality and unemployment, which we continue to grapple with.

afr: die hantering van hierdie uitdagings het die sentrale fokus van alle demokratiese instellings geword.
eng: dealing with these challenges has become a central focus of all democratic administrations.

afr: ons het gekies om op vyf prioriteite te fokus, naamlik onderwys, gesondheid, die stryd teen misdaad en korrupsie, landelike ontwikkeling en grondhervorming asook die skep van behoorlike werk.
eng: we elected to focus on five priorities, education, health, the fight against crime and corruption, rural development and land reform as well as creating decent work.

afr: ons het die staat geherorganiseer om ons prestasie te verbeter.
eng: we also reorganised the state to improve performance.

afr: om dit te bereik het ons het twee sleutelfunksies geskep, naamlik langtermynbeplanning en monitering en evaluering.
eng: we created two key functions, long term planning as well as monitoring and evaluation.

afr: ons het die nasionale beplanningskommissie tot stand gebring, wat die landmerk nasionale ontwikkelingsplan ontwikkel het: die land se sosio-ekonomiese bloudruk en een van die belangrikste prestasies van die vierde administrasie.
eng: we established the national planning commission which produced the landmark national development plan, the country’s socio-economic blueprint and one of the major achievements of this fourth administration.

afr: dié plan bied 'n uiteensetting van wat ons behoort te doen om armoede teen 2030 uit te wis, meer werksgeleenthedete skep en ongelykheid te verminder.
eng: the plan outlines what we should do to eradicate poverty, increase employment and reduce inequality by 2030. our monitoring and evaluation indicates that many services continue to improve.

afr: ons monitering en evaluering dui daarop dat talle dienste steeds aan die verbeter is.
eng: for example, social grants and identity documents now take a shorter time to be processed.

afr: daar is egter op ander terreine nog baie werk te doen.
eng: but many others still require further work.

afr: ek doen vervolgens verslag oor die vyf prioriteite, en begin met die ekonomie.
eng: i will report back on the five priorities, starting with the economy.

afr: die ekonomie het van 1994 tot 2012 met gemiddeld 3,2 persent per jaar gegroei, ondanks die wêreldwye resessie wat 'n miljoen werksgeleenthede gekos het.
eng: on average, the economy has grown at 3,2 percent a year from 1994 to 2012 despite the global recession which claimed a million jobs.

afr: danksy samewerking deur die regering, die sakesektor, arbeid en die gemeenskap, het ons die ekonomie op die herstelpad geplaas.
eng: working together as government, business, labour and the community sector, we nursed the economy to a recovery.

afr: die nasionale welvaart, gemeet in bbp, het tot meer as 3,5 triljoen rand gegroei.
eng: the national wealth, measured in terms of gdp, has grown to more than 3.5 trillion rand.

afr: daar is tans 15 miljoen mense in die land wat werk het , die meeste ooit in ons geskiedenis, en volgens statssa is meer as 650 000werksgeleenthede verlede jaar geskep.
eng: there are now 15 million people with jobs in the country, the highest ever in our history, and over 650 thousand jobs were created last year, according to stats sa.

afr: maar dit is steeds nie goed genoeg nie.
eng: this is still not good enough.

afr: die werkloosheidsyfer bly hoog.
eng: the unemployment rate still remains high.

afr: werkloosheid onder suid-afrika se jeug bly ’n bron van kommer, net soos elders ter wêreld.
eng: youth unemployment in south africa continues to be of concern, as it is throughout the world.

afr: ons skep 'n paar belangrike maatreëls om die situasie te verbeter, soos die wet op die aansporing van indiensneming, wat werkgewers aanmoedig om jonger werkers in diens te neem.
eng: we are taking a number of measures, including the employment tax incentive act which encourages employers to hire younger workers.

afr: regulasies is ook in plek om te verseker dat dit nie ongesubsidieerde of ouer werkers negatief raak nie.
eng: regulations will be passed to ensure that this does not affect unsubsidized or older workers adversely.

afr: verdere maatreëls is vervat in die nasionale jeugakkoord, wat verlede april in soweto onderteken is.
eng: further measures are contained in the national youth accord that was signed in soweto last april.

afr: die uitgebreide openbarewerke-program en die gemeenskapswerk-program bly steeds 'n effektiewe buffer vir behoeftige mense en die jeug.
eng: the expanded public works programme and the community work programme continue to be an effective cushion for the poor and the youth.

afr: ons het die afgelope vyf jaar 3,7 miljoen werksgeleenthede geskep.
eng: we have created 3,7 million work opportunities over the past five years.

afr: mense verdien 'n inkomste en leer nuwe vaardighede deur middel van die openbarewerke-program, wat hulle dan help om formele werksgeleenthede te soek.
eng: our people obtain an income and skills from the public works programme, which they use to seek formal employment.

afr: die kabinet het 'n doelwit van 6 miljoen werksgeleenthede van 2014 tot 2019 gestel, wat spesifiek op die jeug gemik is.
eng: cabinet has set a target of 6 million work opportunities from this year to 2019, targeting the youth.

afr: ons maatskaplike bystandsprogram, wat nou ongeveer 16 miljoen mense bereik, voorsien ‘n sekuriteitsnet aan miljoene mense, veral kwesbare kinders.
eng: our social assistance programme which now reaches about 16 million people, provides a safety for millions, especially vulnerable children.

afr: talle huishoudings trek voordeel uit regeringstoelaes, waaronder kindertoelae, pensioene en ongeskiktheidstoelae.
eng: (many households are benefiting from government grants which are child support grants, pension as well as disability grants.

afr: die regering sal voortgaan om hierdie toelae te voorsien, omdat talle huishoudings daarvan afhanklik is gegewe die tekort aan werksgeleenthede in hierdie moeilike ekonomiese afswaaifase.
eng: )lezizibonelelo zizoqhubeka njalo ngoba imizi eminingi ithola ukusizakala ngoba amathuba emisebenzi ayivelakancane ngalesisikhathi somnotho ontengantengayo.

afr: deur hierdie geleentheid, wat deur die regering moontlik gemaak word, kan ons met trots sê dat ons tans in 'n land leef wat veel beter is as die een waarin ons vóór 1994 geleef het.
eng: (these opportunities, which are made available by government, are enabling us to proudly say that we are currently living in a country that is far better compared to the one we lived in before 1994.

afr: landgenote,ons staan steeds midde-in 'n moeilike tydperk.
eng: )compatriots,we are still going through a difficult period.

afr: ontwikkelings in die ekonomie van die verenigde state het tot 'n snelle waardevermindering in die geldeenhede van opkomende markte, insluitende die rand, gelei.
eng: developments in the united states economy have led to a rapid depreciation in the emerging market currencies, including the rand.

afr: met verloop van 2013 het die waarde van die rand met 17,6 persent teen die amerikaanse dollar verminder.
eng: during the course of 2013, the rand depreciated by 17.6 per cent against the us dollar.

afr: die swakker wisselkoers hou 'n beduidende risiko vir inflasie in en sal ons infrastruktuurprogram ook duurder maak.
eng: the weaker exchange rate poses a significant risk to inflation and will also make our infrastructure programme more expensive.

afr: uitvoermaatskappye, veral in die vervaardigingsektor, behoort egter voordeel uit die swakker rand en die sterker wêreldwye herstel te trek.
eng: however, export companies, particularly in the manufacturing sector, should take advantage of the weaker rand and the stronger global recovery.

afr: selfs te midde van bogenoemde probleme weet ons dat ons ook hierdie onbestendige tydperk kan oorleef.
eng: while we have these difficulties, we know that we can cope with this period of turbulence.

afr: ons het dit immers reeds voorheen, gedurende die afgelope vyf jaar, gedoen.
eng: we have done so before in the past five years.

afr: trouens, ons sal sterker uit hierdie stryd tree, mits ons die regte dinge doen.
eng: we will, in fact, emerge stronger if we do the right things.

afr: ons as die regering-, sake- en arbeidsektor moet saamwerk om ons ekonomie te laat groei teen koerse hoër as 5 persent sodat ons die nodige werksgeleenthede te kan skep.
eng: we have to work together as government, business and labour to grow our economy at rates that are above 5 per cent to be able to create the jobs we need.

afr: gelukkig is hierdie samewerking reeds 'n werklikheid.
eng: fortunately this collaboration is already taking place.

afr: dit vind plaas by nedlac, wat een van die sleutelinstellings in ons demokrasie is vir samewerking tussen die regering-, die sake-, arbeid- en gemeenskapsektor.
eng: it is taking place at nedlac which is one of the key institutions of cooperation in our democracy, between government, business, labour and the community sector.

afr: dit het ook plaasgevind tydens gesprekke wat ons met die sakegemeenskap gehad het.
eng: it has taken place as well in engagements that we have been having with the business community.

afr: ek het verlede jaar begin om met die sakesektor oorleg te pleeg oor spesifieke stappe wat die regering kan doen om dit makliker te maak om in ons land sake te doen.
eng: last year i started engaging business on specific steps that government can take to make it easier to do business in our country.

afr: voortspruitend uit daardie proses het ons nou die regulerende en lisensiëringsgoedkeurings vir omgewingsimpak-assesserings, waterlisensies en mynboulisensies vaartbelyn.
eng: arising out of that process, we have now streamlined regulatory and licensing approvals for environmental impact assessments, water licenses and mining licenses.

afr: die parlement finaliseer tans wysigings aan die wet om hierdie uiters positiewe ontwikkeling te bewerkstellig, wat die tyd wat dit neem om 'n myn te open vanaf die datum van aansoek tot die finale goedkeuring, tot minder as 300 dae sal verkort.
eng: parliament is finalizing amendments to the law to give effect to this very positive development, which will cut to under 300 days, the time it takes to start a mine, from application to final approvals.

afr: die adjunkpresident van die republiek gaan voort om gesprekke tussen die regering, mynmaatskappye en die arbeidsektor te fasiliteer.
eng: the deputy president of the republic continues to facilitate discussions between government, mining companies and labour.

afr: die doel van hierdie oorlegplegings is om arbeidsverhoudinge in hierdie baie belangrike sektor van ons ekonomie te stabiliseer.
eng: the purpose is to stabilise industrial relations in this very important sector of our economy.

afr: die proses het reeds positiewe gevolge.
eng: the process is yielding results.

afr: stakings in die sektor was minder en korter as verlede jaar.
eng: strikes in the sector were fewer and shorter last year.

afr: en – belangriker nog – arbeidsverhoudinge word in ooreenstemming met die wet beoefen.
eng: and more importantly, industrial relations processes are taking place in a manner consistent with the law.

afr: ons het tussenbeide getree in die mynbousektor omdat dit een van ons sleuteldryfkragte vir werkskepping is.
eng: we have intervened in mining because it is one of our key job drivers.

afr: mynwese bied werksgeleenthede aan meer as 'n halfmiljoen mense.
eng: mining employs over half a million people.

afr: dit is die grootste verdiener van buitelandse valuta in ons land en dra ook regstreeks ongeveer 20 biljoen rand tot die belastinginkomste by.
eng: it is the biggest earner of foreign exchange in our country.

afr: as 'n koper van goedere en dienste, en 'n verskaffer van insette, lewer mynbou 'n veel groter bydrae aan ander sektore van ons ekonomie, asook aan ander ekonomieë regoor die wêreld.
eng: mining also makes a far larger contribution as a buyer of goods and services, and a supplier of inputs to other sectors of our economy and other economies around the globe.

afr: ons ondersoek vennootskappe met belanghebbers om die vraagstuk van behuising in myndorpe te help oplos.
eng: we are exploring partnerships with stakeholders to address the issue of housing in mining towns.

afr: ek herinner ook graag mynmaatskappye daaraan dat 2014 die sperdatum is om mynwerkers se behuising en lewensomstandighede te verbeter en om sekere teikens te bereik.
eng: let me also remind mining companies that 2014 is the deadline for them to improve housing and living conditions of mineworkers and to achieve a number of targets.

afr: die regering monitor steeds maatskappye se maatskaplike en arbeidsplanne, asook die teikens van die mynwese-handves en dwing nakoming van hierdie planne en teikens af.
eng: government continues to monitor and enforce compliance on both the company’s social and labour plans and mining charter targets.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,agbare lede,buiten mynbou, het ons in 2009 vyf ander dryfkragte vir werkskepping geïdentifiseer.
eng: fellow south africans,honourable members,other than mining, we had identified five other job drivers in 2009. these are tourism, agriculture, the green economy, infrastructure development and manufacturing.

afr: die toerismebedryf het dramaties gegroei.
eng: the tourism industry has grown dramatically.

afr: in 1993 het suid-afrika 'n skamele 3 miljoen buitelandse besoekers ontvang.
eng: in 1993, south africa received a mere 3 million foreign visitors.

afr: teen 2012 het die aantal besoekers tot 13 miljoen gestyg.
eng: by 2012, the figure had grown to 13 million visitors.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om hierdie bedryf te ontwikkel, gegewe die potensiaal daarvan vir werkskepping.
eng: we will continue to grow this industry, given its potential for job creation.

afr: in 2012 het ons die nasionale infrastruktuurplan deur die presidensiële infrastruktuur-koördineringskommissie onder leiding van die president bekendgestel.
eng: in 2012 we unveiled the national infrastructure plan, led by the president through the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission.

afr: ons het sedertdien een triljoen rand in openbare infrastruktuur oor die afgelope vyf jaar belê.
eng: we have subsequently invested one trillion rand in public infrastructure over the past five years.

afr: baie van die projekte is reeds voltooi of nader voltooiing.
eng: many of the projects are completed or are nearing completion.

afr: ek noem net 'n paar.
eng: i will mention just a few.

afr: die rea vaya-stelsel in johannesburg word nou deur meer as 100 000 inwoners gebruik.
eng: the rea vaya system in joburg is now used by more than 100 000 gauteng residents.

afr: soortgelyke stelsels word in kaapstad, tshwane, nelson mandelabaai, buffalo city, ethekwini en rustenburg gebou.
eng: similar systems are being built in cape town, tshwane, nelson mandela bay, buffalo city, ethekwini and rustenburg.

afr: ons het 'n brandstofpyplyn van 700 kilometer vanaf durban na gauteng gebou om 4 biljoen kubieke liter petrol, diesel en straler-brandstof per jaar te vervoer.
eng: we have built a 700 kilometre fuel pipeline from durban to gauteng to transport 4 billion cubic litres of petrol, diesel and jet fuel a year.

afr: bykans 1 500 kilometer se nuwe paaie of bane is gebou.
eng: close to 1 500 kilometres of new roads or lanes have been built.

afr: hierdie vordering ten opsigte van paaie herinner ons aan diegene wat voorheen in hierdie regering gedien het en wat die beste vir ons land wou hê, soos ons voormalige minister van vervoer, mnr dullah omar.
eng: this progress in respect of roads reminds us of those who have served in this government before who wanted the best for the country, such as our former transport minister mr dullar omar.

afr: sy geliefde eggenoot farieda is vanaand een van ons gaste.
eng: his dear wife farieda is one of our guests this evening.

afr: daar is begin met die konstruksie van nuwe spoorlyne in mpumalanga om die druk op die paaie te verlig.
eng: the construction of new rail lines has started in mpumalanga, to ease the pressure off the roads.

afr: die gautrein-projek is nou in volle gang en vervoer meer as 1,2 miljoen passasiers per maand.
eng: the gautrain project is now fully functional and carries over 1,2 million passengers a month.

afr: die passasierspoor-agentskap van suid-afrika gaan oor die volgende 10 jaar meer as 120 biljoen rand uitgee om nuwe treine te koop.
eng: the passenger rail agency of south africa will spend over 120 billion rand over the next 10 years to buy new trains.

afr: transnet stel tans sy massiewe 300 biljoen rand markvraagstrategie in werking, waardeur broodnodige vervoerinfrastruktuur gebou word.
eng: transnet is implementing its massive 300 billion rand market demand strategy, building much needed transport infrastructure.

afr: om die ekonomiese potensiaal van die wes-kaap en die weskus te ontgin, het ons die saldanha-nywerheidsontwikkelingsone geloods en twee nuwe fabrieke in atlantis geopen.
eng: to realise the economic potential of the western cape and the west coast, we launched the saldanha industrial development zone and opened two new factories in atlantis.

afr: om watervoorsiening te verbeter is twee groot nuwe damme voltooi, naamlik de hoop in limpopo en spring grove in kwazulu-natal, terwyl fase twee van die lesotho hoogland waterskema binnekort van stapel gestuur sal word.
eng: to improve the water supply, two large new dams were completed, de hoop in limpopo and spring grove in kwazulu-natal, while phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project is to be launched soon.

afr: konstruksie gaan voort by die nuwe kragstasies, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga en ingula naby ladysmith, wat werk aan meer as 30 000 mense verskaf.
eng: construction is continuing at the new power stations, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga and ingula near ladysmith, employing more than 30 000 workers.

afr: ons ondersoek deurentyd alternatiewe bronne van energie ooreenkomstig die geïntegreerde hulpbronplan vir energie.
eng: we continue to explore other sources of energy, in line with the integrated resource plan for energy.

afr: die ontwikkeling van petroleum, veral skaliegas, sal die karoo en die suid-afrikaanse ekonomie vir altyd verander.
eng: the development of petroleum, especially shale gas will be a game-changer for the karoo region and the south african economy.

afr: nadat al die risiko's en geleenthede oorweeg is, sal die finale regulasies binnekort bekendgestel word, gevolg deur die verwerking en toestaan van lisensies.
eng: having evaluated the risks and opportunities, the final regulations will be released soon and will be followed by the processing and granting of licenses.

afr: ons verwag om deur hierdie proses 9 600 megawatt se kernkrag te verkry.
eng: we expect to conclude the procurement of nine thousand six hundred megawatts of nuclear energy.

afr: biobrandstofvervaardigers is gekies en het reeds in produksie.
eng: biofuels manufacturers have been selected and have started work.

afr: agbare ledeons land is inderdaad 'n land aan die werk en is 'n veel beter plek om in te woon.
eng: honourable membersours is indeed a country at work and is a much better place to live in.

afr: ons moet die momentum behou.
eng: we must keep the momentum.

afr: agbare lede,al meer van ons welvaart word deur die internet of telekommunikasie geskep.37 000 kilometer se vesel-optiese kabels is die afgelope vyf jaar deur die privaat- en openbare sektor gelê.
eng: honourable members,more of our wealth is created through the internet or telecommunication.

afr: dit sal oor die volgende paar jaar aansienlik uitgebrei word.
eng: this will be significantly expanded in the years ahead.

afr: ons is trots op ons suksesse in wetenskap en tegnologie.
eng: we are proud of our successes in science and technology.

afr: die oprigting van die eerste teleskoop van die 64-skottel-voorloper van die vierkante kilometer reeks (ska), die meerkat, sal in die eerste kwartaal van 2014 voltooi word.
eng: the construction of the first telescope of the 64-dish forerunner to the square kilometre array, the meerkat, will be completed in the first quarter of 2014. honourable members,our incentives to boost manufacturing have yielded returns.

afr: die outomobiel beleggingskema wat in 2009 van stapel gestuur is, het altesaam 3,8 biljoen rand se aansporingsmaatreëls vir ongeveer 160 beleggingsprojekte goedgekeur.
eng: the automotive investment scheme that was launched in 2009 has approved a total 3.8 billion rand worth of incentives for about 160 investment projects.

afr: dit verskaf meer as 50 000 werksgeleenthede.
eng: these sustain more than 50 thousand jobs.

afr: die maatskappye sal sedanmotors, minibus-taxi's en busse vervaardig.
eng: the companies will be developing sedan cars, minibus taxis and buses.

afr: ons het die klere-, tekstiel-, leer- en skoeiselsektor gestabiliseer, wat voorheen heelwat werksgeleenthede verloor het.
eng: we have stabilised the clothing, textile, leather and footwear sector, which had been shedding jobs.

afr: verskeie nywerhede is vir plaaslike inhoud geoormerk.
eng: several industries have been designated for local content.

afr: dit sluit busse, ingemaakte groente, klere, tekstiel, leer en skoeisel, asook ander goedere in.
eng: these include buses, canned vegetables, clothing, textiles, leather and footwear and other goods.

afr: ons het konkrete voorbeelde van die sukses van die lokaliseringsprogram.
eng: we have concrete examples of the success of the localisation programme.

afr: in die afgelope twee jaar alleen is meer as 20 000 minibus-taxi's en 330 busse plaaslik gemonteer, wat belegging en ontwikkeling na ons stede lok.
eng: in the past two years alone, more than 20 000 minibus taxis and 330 buses were assembled locally, drawing investment and development to our cities.

afr: oor die volgende vyf jaar sal die staat minstens 75 persent van sy goedere en dienste van suid-afrikaanse produsente verkry.
eng: in the next five years, the state will procure at least 75% of its goods and services from south african producers.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,ons moet meer intensief werk om opkomende of swart nyweraars te ontwikkel.
eng: fellow south africans,we have to work more intensively to develop emerging or black industrialists.

afr: baie van die aspirant swart nyweraars kla oor die probleme wat hulle ervaar om toegang tot nywerheidsfinansiering, verskaffer- en kleinhandelmarkte en tegniese produksie-ondersteuning te verkry.
eng: many of the aspirant black industrialists complain about the difficulties they experience in obtaining industrial finance, supplier and retail markets, and technical production support.

afr: die nasionale bemagtigingsfonds, die nywerheidsontwikkelingskorporasie en die kleinsake-finansieringsagentskap sal voortgaan om finansiering aan lewensvatbare sakeondernemings in swart besit te voorsien om industrialisering te bevorder.
eng: the national empowerment fund, the industrial development corporation and the small enterprise finance agency will continue to provide finance to viable black-owned businesses to promote industrialisation.

afr: daarbenewens moedig ons gevestigde sakeondernemings aan om die ontwikkeling van swart nywerheidsondernemings te ondersteun.
eng: in addition, we encourage established businesses to support the development of black industrial businesses.

afr: landbou is 'n sleutelwerkgewer en bied talle geleenthede vir entrepreneurskap.
eng: agriculture is a key job driver and a provider of opportunities for entrepreneurship.

afr: ons landbou-ondersteuningsprogram, fetsa tlala, lewer reeds splinternuwe uitvoerders op.
eng: our agricultural support programme, fetsa tlala, is producing brand new exporters.

afr: die eerste 88 kleinhoewe-boere in hierdie program het 268 ton mielies en boontjies aan die verenigde nasies se wêreldvoedselprogram verskaf wat verlede maand na lesotho gestuur is.
eng: the first 88 smallholder farmers in this programme supplied the united nations world food programme with 268 tons of maize and beans to send to lesotho last month.

afr: ons verwag dat hierdie getal sal styg.
eng: we expect this number to increase.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om ook ons visserye-sektor te bevorder, wat 'n geraamde 6 biljoen rand tot die ekonomie bydra en 27 000 werksgeleenthede skep.
eng: we will continue to promote our fisheries sector as well, which contributes an estimated 6billion rand to the economy and provides 27 000 jobs.

afr: agbare lede,ons maak goeie vordering met die grondhervormingsprogram.
eng: honourable members,we have made good progress in the land reform programme.

afr: sowat 5 000 plase, wat 4,2 miljoen hektaar beslaan, is sedert 1994 aan swart mense oorgedra, en meer as 200 000 families het hierby gebaat.
eng: since 1994, nearly 5,000 farms, comprising 4.2 million hectares, have been transferred to black people, benefiting over 200,000 families.

afr: nagenoeg 80 000 grondeise, wat 3,4 miljoen hektaar beslaan, is geskik en 1,8 miljoen mense het hieruit voordeel getrek.
eng: nearly 80,000 land claims, totaling 3.4 million hectares, have been settled and 1.8 million people have benefited.

afr: die volgende administrasie sal 'n hele aantal beleids-, wetgewende en praktiese ingrypings moet voortsit om die vervreemding van ons mense van hul grond reg te stel.
eng: the next administration will need to take forward a number of policy, legislative and practical interventions, to further redress the dispossession of our people of their land.

afr: dit sluit in kwessies rakende die instelling van die kantoor van die waardeerder-generaal om die grondeise-proses te heropen.
eng: these include matters relating to the establishment of the office of the valuer-general and thereby opening of the lodgement of claims.

afr: agbare ledesuid-afrika is inderdaad 'n veel beter plek om te woon.
eng: honourable memberssouth africa is indeed a much better place to live in.

afr: laat my toe om nou verslag te doen oor ons maatskaplike-transformasieprogram.
eng: let me now report on our social transformation programme.

afr: onderwys is vir miljoene mense ’n manier om uit armoede te ontsnap.
eng: education is a ladder out of poverty for millions of our people.

afr: ons is derhalwe dankbaar dat skoolinskrywings beduidend toeneem, van voorskools tot op tersiêre vlak.
eng: we are happy therefore that there is a huge increase in the enrolment of children in school, from pre-primary to tertiary level.

afr: die aantal kinders wat graad r bywoon, het tussen 2003 en 2011 meer as verdubbel, van ongeveer 300 000 tot meer as 700 000.
eng: the number of children attending grade r has more than doubled, moving from about 300 thousand to more than 700 thousand between 2003 and 2011. a draft policy framework towards universal access to grade r has been gazetted for public comment, with a view to making grade r compulsory.

afr: landgenote,agt miljoen leerders woon gratis skole by, terwyl nege miljoen voedsame etes by die skool ontvang kry wat deur die regering voorsien word om te verseker dat hulle nie honger ly nie en goed kan presteer.
eng: (eight million learners are attending no-fee schools, whereas nine million learners are getting nutritious meals at school, which are provided by government to ensure that they do not suffer from starvation and that enables them to perform well.

afr: die matriek-slaagsyfer het gestyg van 61 persent in 2009, tot 78 persent verlede jaar, terwyl die baccalaureus-slaagsyfer elke jaar verbeter.
eng: )the matric pass rate has gone up from around 61 percent in 2009 to 78 percent last year and the bachelor passes improve each year.

afr: deur middel van die jaarlikse nasionale assesserings bly ons op die hoogte van verbeterings en enige ingrypings wat nodig is, veral in wiskunde en wetenskap.
eng: through the annual national assessments, we keep track of improvements and interventions needed, especially, in maths and science.

afr: om inklusiwiteit en diversiteit te bevorder, sal die suid-afrikaanse gebaretaalkurrikulum van 2015 af in skole aangebied word.
eng: to promote inclusivity and diversity, the south african sign language curriculum will be offered in schools from next year, 2015. we have increased our numbers of literate adults through the kha ri gude programme from 2,2 million in 2008 to 3 million people.

afr: ons het ook in onderwysersopleiding belê en heropen verskeie onderwyseropleidingskolleges om in die vraag te voorsien.
eng: we have also been investing in teacher training and are re-opening teacher training colleges to meet the demand.

afr: in ons strewe om 'n behoorlike leeromgewing te voorsien, het ons 370 nuwe skole beskikbaar gestel om modderskole en ander ondoelmatige strukture regoor die land te vervang.
eng: to produce a decent learning environment, we have delivered 370 new schools replacing mud schools and other unsuitable structures around the country.

afr: die program duur voort.
eng: the programme continues.

afr: landgenoteons het ook goeie nuus oor hoër onderwys.
eng: compatriotswe have a good story to tell in higher education as well.

afr: studente-inskrywings aan universiteite het met 12 persent gestyg, terwyl inskrywings aan verdere onderwys-en-opleidingskolleges (voo) met 90 persent toegeneem het.
eng: student enrolments at universities increased by 12% while further education and training college enrolments have increased by 90%.

afr: ons het die begrotings van die nasionale studente finansiële hulpskema tot 9 biljoen rand verhoog om in die toenemende vraag te voorsien.
eng: we have increased the budgets of the national student financial aid scheme to 9 billion rand to meet the rising demand.

afr: nog 'n belangrike prestasie wat in hierdie termyn behaal is, is die vestiging van twee splinternuwe universiteite, die sol plaatje universiteit in die noord-kaap en die universiteit van mpumalanga.
eng: another major achievement of this term has been the establishment of two brand new universities, sol plaatje in the northern cape and the university of mpumalanga.

afr: ons gaan ook 12 nuwe voo-kolleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal en die oos-kaap bou.
eng: we will also build 12 new fet colleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal and eastern cape.

afr: landgenote,die bekendstelling van die nasionale raamwerk vir onderwyssamewerking verlede jaar was 'n belangrike ontwikkeling vir die land.
eng: compatriots,the launch of the national education collaboration framework last year was an important development for the country.

afr: ons wens die span alles van die beste toe in die uitvoering van hul nasionale pligte.
eng: we wish the team well in their national duty.

afr: landgenote,ons het ook goeie nuus oor die verbetering van gesondheidsorg in die land.
eng: compatriots,we have a good story to tell in the improvement of health care too.

afr: die afgelope vyf jaar is 300 nuwe gesondheidsorgfasiliteite gebou, wat 160 nuwe klinieke insluit.
eng: over the past five years, 300 new health facilities have been built, including 160 new clinics.

afr: tien nuwe hospitale is onderskeidelik in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg distrik, swartruggens, khayelitsha en mitchell’s plain gebou of opgeknap.
eng: ten new hospitals have been builtor refurbished in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg district, swartruggens, khayelitsha and mitchell’s plain.

afr: agbare speakeragbare voorsitter van die nrpdie miv- en vigs-ommekeer is een van hierdie administrasie se grootste prestasies en ons word deur die verenigde nasies se vigs-program (unaids) as 'n model-land voorgehou.
eng: honourable speakerhonourable chairperson of the ncopthe hiv and aids turnaround is one of the biggest achievements of this administration and we are used as a model country by the united nations aids programmes, (unaids).

afr: moeder-na-kind-oordrag van miv het skerp afgeneem en die aantal mense wat anti-retrovirale behandeling ontvang het van een miljoen tot 2,4 miljoen in 2013 gedaal.
eng: mother to child transmission of hiv has declined sharply and we have doubled the number of people who are receiving anti-retroviral treatment, from one million to 2.4 million people in 2013. more than 20 million south africans have taken the hiv test since the launch of the campaign in 2011 which indicates confidence in the health system.

afr: suid-afrikaners leef nou langer.
eng: south africans are now living longer.

afr: die teiken vir die volgende administrasie is om te verseker dat minstens 4,6 miljoen mense by die anti-retrovirale program ingeskryf word.
eng: the target for the next administration is to ensure that at least 4.6 million people are enrolled in the anti-retroviral programme.

afr: in dié verband erken ons die bydrae en harde werk van die suid-afrikaanse nasionale vigs-raad .
eng: we acknowledge the contribution of the south african national aids council for the hard work.

afr: hoewel ons ons suksesse moet vier, moet ons nie selftevrede op ons louere rus nie.
eng: while celebrating our success, we must not be complacent.

afr: voorkomingswerk moet steeds voortgaan sodat ons die mikpunt van geen miv-infeksies vinniger kan bereik.
eng: the prevention work must still continue so that we can reach that goal of zero hiv infections sooner.

afr: op 'n breër vlak sal ons 'n nuwe fase in die implementering van die nasionale gesondheidsprogram betree, wat gehalte-gesondheidsorg na die armes sal uitbrei.
eng: at a broader level, we will enter a new phase in the implementation of the national health insurance programme which will extend quality healthcare to the poor.

afr: agbare voorsitter van die nrp,agbare speakerdie algehele misdaadsyfer het sedert 2002 met 21 persent gedaal en pogings om gemeenskappe veiliger te maak duur voort.
eng: honourable chairperson of the ncop,honourable speakerthe overall crime rate has decreased by 21 percent since 2002 and work is ongoing to make communities safer.

afr: een van die sleutelfokusareas is om geweld teen vroue en kinders die hoof te bied.
eng: one of the key focus areas is to eradicate violence against women and children.

afr: ons het verskeie maatreëls ingestel om hierdie uitdaging aan te pak.
eng: we have introduced a number of measures to respond to this challenge.

afr: dit sluit die heropening van die eenheid vir gesinsgeweld, kinderbeskerming en seksuele oortredings, asook die howe vir seksuele oortredings in.
eng: these include the reopening of the family violence, child protection and sexual offences units as well as the sexual offences courts.

afr: ons bedank die talle nro's wat vroue en kinders se regte bevorder, en wat 'n positiewe bydrae tot hierdie belangrike saak lewer.
eng: we thank the many ngos that promote the rights of women and children who contribute positively to this important work.

afr: ons land bly die teiken van renosterstropers.
eng: our country continues to be the target of rhino poachers.

afr: ons wetstoepassingsagentskappe werk hard om hierdie wrede misdaad te stuit.
eng: our law enforcement agencies are working hard to arrest this scourge.

afr: ons het in dié verband samewerkingsooreenkomste met sjina, viëtnam en kenia gesluit, asook met mosambiek en ander saog-lande om te help om dit die hoof te bied.
eng: we have also reached agreements with china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique and other sadc countries to work together to stop this crime.

afr: ons bedank die sakegemeenskap en alle suid-afrikaners wat aan die veldtog om renosters te red, deelneem.
eng: we thank the business community and all south africans who participate in the campaign to save the rhino.

afr: landgenote,die onafhanklikheid van die regbank is verder versterk deur die vestiging van die kantoor van die hoofregter as 'n afsonderlike instelling van die departement van justisie en grondwetlike ontwikkeling.
eng: compatriotsthe independence of the judiciary has been further enhanced by the establishment of the office of the chief justice as a separate institution from the department of justice and constitutional development.

afr: ons het verskeie wetgewing aanvaar om dié nuwe rol van die kantoor van die hoofregter te ondersteun.
eng: we have passed several pieces of legislation to support this new role of the office of the chief justice.

afr: vordering word gemaak met die transformasie van die regbank om die land se rasse- en geslagsdemografie te weerspieël.
eng: progress is being made in the transformation of the judiciary to reflect the race and gender demographics of the country.

afr: die hoofregter van die republiek neem die leiding as kampvegter vir hierdie transformasie.
eng: the chief justice of the republic continues to champion and lead this transformation.

afr: swart regters (afrikane, indiërs en bruin mense) maak nou 61 persent van alle regters uit.
eng: black judges (african, indian and coloured) now constitute 61% of all judges.

afr: die akute onderverteenwoordiging van vroue op die regbank bly egter rede tot kommer.
eng: however, the acute under-representation of women on the bench remains of concern.

afr: uit die totaal van 239 regters, is slegs 76 vroue.
eng: of the judicial establishment of 239 judges, only 76 are women.

afr: die uitdaging is om die regsberoep op 'n breë front te hervorm om die poel waaruit vroulike regters aangestel kan word, te voed.
eng: the challenge is to transform the legal profession broadly in order to nourish the pool from which female judges can be appointed.

afr: die finalisering van die wetsontwerp op die regspraktyk sal help om die poel waaruit potensiële regterlike amptenare gekies kan word, uit te brei.
eng: the finalisation of the legal practice bill will assist to broaden the pool from which potential judicial officers could be selected.

afr: agbare speaker en voorsitter,suid-afrikaners is verenig in hul strewe na 'n korrupsievrye samelewing.
eng: honourable speaker and chairperson,south africans are united in wanting a corruption free society.

afr: die bestryding van korrupsie in die staatsdiens werp reeds vrugte af.
eng: fighting corruption within the public service is yielding results.

afr: sedert die bekendstelling van die nasionale anti-korrupsie blitslyn deur die staatsdienskommissie is meer as 13 000 gevalle van korrupsie en wanadministrasie na staatsdepartemente verwys vir verdere hantering en ondersoek.
eng: since the launch of the national anti-corruption hotline by the public service commission, over 13 000 cases of corruption and maladministration have been referred to government departments for further handling and investigation.

afr: die regering het deur die nasionale anti-korrupsie blitslyn meer as 320 miljoen rand van oortreders verhaal.
eng: government has recovered more than 320-million rand from perpetrators through the national anti-corruption hotline.

afr: sake wat suksesvol deur die nasionale anti-korrupsie blitslyn hanteer is, sluit die volgende in:in 'n poging om korrupsie in die voorsieningskettingstelsel te voorkom, het die regering besluit om 'n sentrale tenderraad te vestig om tenders in alle regeringsfere te beoordeel.
eng: some of the successes of the national anti-corruption hotline include the following:to prevent corruption in the supply chain system, government has decided to establish a central tender board to adjudicate tenders in all spheres of government.

afr: hierdie liggaam sal met die hoofverkrygingsbeampte saamwerk, wie se vernaamste funksie sal wees om prysing, nakoming van prosedures asook regverdigheid te kontroleer.
eng: this body will work with the chief procurement officer whose main function will be to check on pricing and adherence to procedures as well as fairness.

afr: die spesiale ondersoekeenheid ondersoek tans wanadministrasie of beweerde korrupsie in verskeie staatsdepartemente en staatsentiteite deur middel van 40 proklamasies wat gedurende hierdie administrasie deur die president geteken is.
eng: the special investigating unit is investigating maladministration or alleged corruption in a number of government departments and state entities, through 40 proclamations signed by the president during this administration.

afr: ons sal die publiek op die hoogte hou van die uitslag van die ondersoeke.
eng: we will keep the public informed of the outcome of the investigations.

afr: in die eerste ses maande van verlede jaar het die batebeslagleggingseenheid altesaam 149 miljoen rand in die rekening vir verhaling van kriminele bates en aan die slagoffers van misdaad oorbetaal.
eng: in the first six months of last year, the asset forfeiture unit paid a total of 149 million rand into the criminal assets recovery account and to the victims of crime.

afr: dit is 170 persent meer as die mikpunt van 55 miljoen rand en is hoër as wat dit ooit vantevore in 'n volle jaar was.
eng: this is 170% above its target of 55 million rand and is higher than it has ever achieved in a full year.

afr: verlede jaar het die mededingingsowerhede grootskaalse prysvasstelling in die konstruksiebedryf ondersoek, en skuldige maatskappye is boetes van 1,4 biljoen rand opgelê.
eng: last year, the competition authorities investigated large-scale price fixing in the construction industry and fined guilty companies 1.4 billion rand.

afr: verdere stappe teen die betrokkenes word tans gedoen.
eng: further steps against those involved are now underway.

afr: landgenote,ek wil nou graag kortliks verwys na die voorsiening van basiese dienste aan ons mense.
eng: compatriots,i would now like to touch briefly on the provision of basic services to our people.

afr: die afgelope 20 jaar is goeie vordering gemaak met die lewering van dienste soos water, sanitasie en elektrisiteit.
eng: over the past 20 years, remarkable achievements have been made in increasing access to services such as water, sanitation and electricity.

afr: die regering het met 'n intensiewe program begin om die emmerstelsel uit te skakel as deel van die herstel van ons mense se waardigheid.
eng: government has begun an intensive programme to eliminate the bucket system as part of restoring the dignity of our people.

afr: fase een van die program sal die gebruik van emmers in geformaliseerde townships in die vrystaat, die oos-kaap en die noord-kaap beëindig.
eng: phase one of the programme will eradicate buckets in formalized townships of the free state, eastern cape and northern cape.

afr: tydens fase twee sal emmertoilette in informele nedersettings in alle provinsies uitgeskakel word.
eng: phase two will eradicate buckets in informal settlements in all provinces.

afr: wat behuising betref, is sowat 3 miljoen behuisingseenhede en meer as 855 000 gedienste terreine sedert 1994 gelewer.
eng: in housing, about 3 million housing units and more than 855 thousand serviced sites were delivered since 1994. nearly 500 informal settlements have been replaced with quality housing and basic services over the past five years.

afr: die volgende administrasie sal gemengde-inkomste-behuisingsprojekte wat beter geleë is, bevorder.
eng: the next administration will promote better located mixed income housing projects.

afr: landgenote,sommige gemeenskappe beskik steeds nie oor hierdie dienste nie, veral in informele nedersettings en landelike gebiede.
eng: compatriots,some communities still do not have these services especially in informal settlements and rural areas.

afr: ons werk dus nóú saam met alle regeringsfere om die voorsiening van hierdie dienste te verseker, veral in die 23 munisipaliteite met die grootste agterstande.
eng: we are therefore working with all spheres of government to ensure the provision of these services, especially in the 23 municipalities with the greatest number of backlogs.

afr: landgenotein verlede jaar se staatsrede het ek my kommer uitgespreek oor die voorkoms van geweld in sommige van die protesoptredes wat in ons land plaasvind.
eng: compatriotsin last year’s state of the nation address, i raised my concern with the manifestation of violence in some of the protests taking place in our country.

afr: daar was die afgelope paar weke weer gewelddadige betogings in die land.
eng: violent protests have taken place again around the country in the past few weeks.

afr: dit is ook kommerwekkend dat die geweld skynbaar met voorbedagte rade plaasvind, aangesien petrolbomme en ander wapens tydens betogings gebruik word.
eng: also worrying is what appears to be premeditated violence, as is the case with the use of petrol bombs and other weapons during protests.

afr: die demokratiese regering steun alle burgers se reg om hulself uit te druk.
eng: the democratic government supports the right of citizens to express themselves.

afr: die reg om vreedsaam en ongewapen te betoog is in die grondwet verskans.
eng: the right to protest, peacefully and unarmed, is enshrined in the constitution.

afr: wanneer hierdie betogings egter lewens bedreig en eiendom en waardevolle infrastruktuur beskadig, ondermyn dit die einste demokrasie wat hierdie reg moet verseker.
eng: however, when protests threaten lives and property and destroy valuable infrastructure intended to serve the community, they undermine the very democracy that upholds the right to protest.

afr: protesoptrede in suid-afrika word grootliks aan die beweerde mislukkings van die regering toegeskryf.
eng: the dominant narrative in the case of the protests in south africa has been to attribute them to alleged failures of government.

afr: hierdie protesoptrede is egter nie bloot die gevolg van "mislukkings" van die regering nie, maar ook van die sukses in die voorsiening van basiese dienste.
eng: however the protests are not simply the result of “failures” of government but also of the success in delivering basic services.

afr: wanneer 95 persent van huishoudings toegang tot water het, voel die 5 persent in wie se behoeftes nog voorsien moet word, dat hulle nie 'n oomblik langer kan wag nie.
eng: when 95% of households have access to water, the 5% who still need to be provided for, feel they cannot wait a moment longer.

afr: sukses is ook die teelaarde van groter verwagtings.
eng: success is also the breeding ground of rising expectations.

afr: laat ek ook byvoeg, agbare lede, dat enige lewensverlies veroorsaak deur die polisie in hul hantering van die protesoptrede nie ontsien of oorgesien kan word nie.
eng: let me also add honourable members, that any loss of life at the hands of the police in the course of dealing with the protests cannot be overlooked or condoned.

afr: lewensverlies is nie 'n onbenullige saak nie.
eng: loss of life is not a small matter.

afr: ons moet weet wat gebeur het, hoekom dit gebeur het.
eng: we need to know what happened, why it happened.

afr: daar moet streng opgetree word teen enige oortredings en regstellende stappe moet gedoen word.
eng: any wrongdoing must be dealt with and corrective action must be taken.

afr: die polisie moet te alle tye binne die bestek van die wet optree.
eng: police must act within the ambit of the law at all times.

afr: dit is egter vir ons as 'n gemeenskap ook ‘n ernstige bron van kommer dat bykans 800 polisiebeamptes tussen 2005 en 2013 vermoor is.
eng: having said this, we should also as a society be concerned that between 2005 and 2013, close to 800 police officerswere killed.

afr: die polisie is beskermers en is die buffer tussen 'n demokratiese samelewing gegrond op die oppergesag van die reg, en anargie.. terwyl ons die polisie aanspreeklik hou, moet ons ook daarop bedag wees dat ons hulle nie ont-wettig nie en sodoende anargie in ons samelewing verheerlik nie.
eng: the police are protectors and are the buffer between a democratic society based on the rule of law, and anarchy.

afr: hierdie kultuur van geweld is 'n nalatenskap van ons apartheidsverlede.
eng: the culture of violence originated from the apartheid past.

afr: ons moet introspektief daarna kyk in ons pogings om daarvan ontslae te raak.
eng: we need to conduct anintrospectionin our efforts to get rid of this scourge.

afr: ons as leiers uit alle lewensvlakke moet besin oor wat ons gedoen het of nie gedoen het nie sodat ons die geweld wat tydens die vroeë dae van ons demokrasie kop uitgesteek het, stelselmatig met wortel en tak kan uitroei.
eng: as leaders from all walks of life, we must reflect on what we did or did not do, to systematically root out the violence that surfaced in protests during the early days of our democracy.

afr: ons het 'n kollektiewe verantwoordelikheid om 'n samelewing te bou wat die oppergesag van die reg respekteer, mekaar respekteer en lewe en eiendom respekteer.
eng: we have a collective responsibility to build a society that respects the rule of law, respects one another and which respects life and property.

afr: ons moet saamwerk om ubuntu en 'n kultuur van verantwoordelikheid in ons samelewing te herbou.
eng: we should work together to rebuild ubuntu and a culture of responsibility in our society.

afr: agbare speaker,agbare voorsitter van die nrp,'n besluit is geneem om die funksionering van plaaslike regerings te verbeter.
eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,a decision has been taken to improve functioning of local government.

afr: die wysiging van die wet op munisipale stelsels is daarop gemik om munisipaliteite se vermoë om dienste te lewer, te verbeter.
eng: the amendment of the municipal systems act is intended to improve the capacity of municipalities to deliver services.

afr: gekwalifiseerde en ervare personeel moet in munisipaliteite ontplooi word.
eng: qualified and experienced personnel must be deployed in municipalities.

afr: ons moet ook bestaande forums van mense se deelname versterk en ons mense in staat stel om 'n groter rol in ontwikkeling te speel.
eng: we also need to strengthen existing forums of people’s participation and enable our people to play a greater role in development.

afr: die stryd teen korrupsie moet ook verskerp word, veral in die lig van bewerings dat bepaalde dienste onderbreek of gestaak word sodat sekere mense daardie dienste teen 'n koste aan die staat kan voorsien.
eng: the fight against corruption must be intensified as well, especially given reports that some services are interrupted or stopped, so that certain people could provide those services at cost to the state.

afr: hierdie kwessies word as prioriteite vir die volgende administrasie beskou.
eng: these matters are being prioritised for the next administration.

afr: agbare speaker en voorsitterdemokratiese suid-afrika se buitelandse beleid is baie dekades gelede gevorm tydens die verbete internasionale veldtog om die apartheidstaat te isoleer.
eng: honourable speaker and chairpersondemocratic south africa’s foreign policy was shaped many decades ago during the fierce international campaign to isolate the apartheid state.

afr: anc president oliver tambo het 'n sleutelrol in dié verband gespeel en is deur talle ander bygestaan, onder andere wyle johnny makatini, die voormalige hoof van internasionale aangeleenthede.
eng: anc president oliver tambo played a key role in that regard, assisted by among others, the late johnny makatini, former head of international affairs.

afr: sy vrou, mev valerie makatini, is vanaand een van ons geërde gaste.
eng: his wife, mrs valerie makatini is one of our honoured guests this evening.

afr: afrika bly die sentrale fokus van ons buitelandse beleid.
eng: africa has remained at the centre of our foreign policy.

afr: ons het hard gewerk om steun vir die afrika-unie, saog en alle liggame op die vasteland wat vrede en sekuriteit nastreef, te versterk.
eng: we have worked hard to strengthen support for the african union, sadc and all continental bodies whose purpose is to achieve peace and security.

afr: ons het ook voorrang verleen aan die bevordering van streeks- ekonomiese integrasie, infrastruktuurontwikkeling, intra-afrikahandel en volhoubare ontwikkeling op die vasteland.
eng: we have also prioritised the promotion of regional economic integration, infrastructure development, intra-african trade and sustainable development in the continent.

afr: ons het ook vanjaar ons derde landverslag by die au se afrika portuur-oorsigmeganisme ingedien, waar dit positief ontvang is.
eng: this year we also submitted our third country report to the au african peer review mechanism which was well received.

afr: ons ondersteun steeds vredesamesprekinge en konflikoplossing.
eng: we continue to support peacemaking and conflict resolution.

afr: vordering word gemaak met die onderhandelinge tussen soedan en suid-soedan oor uitstaande aangeleenthede ná die skeiding.
eng: progress is being made in negotiations between sudan and south sudan on outstanding issues following the secession.

afr: in reaksie op versoeke om vrede en versoening in sri lanka en suid-soedan te help bewerkstellig, is mnr cyril ramaphosa aangestel as suid-afrika se spesiale gesant na dié twee lande.
eng: following requests from sri lanka and south sudan for assistance in bringing about peace and reconciliation, mr cyril ramaphosa, has been appointed as south africa’s special envoy to the two countries.

afr: sy kundigheid op die gebied van konflikoplossing en onderhandeling asook ons land se wye ervaring op dié terrein sal die twee lande baie help om hul probleme op te los.
eng: his expertise in conflict resolution and negotiations as well as our country’s experience in this regard, will greatly assist the two countries to resolve their problems.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om bande met europa, amerika, latyns-amerika, asië en lande in die suide te versterk.
eng: we will continue to strengthen relations with europe, north america, latin america, asia and countries in the south.

afr: deelname aan internasionale multilaterale forums soos die g20 is tot groot voordeel vir suid-afrika.
eng: participation in international multilateral forums such as the g20 have been beneficial for the country.

afr: en ons aansluiting by brasilië, rusland, indië en sjina (bric-groep) in desember 2010 tel onder die vierde administrasie se grootste prestasies.
eng: and joining the brazil, russia, india and china (bric) group in december 2010 counts as among the key achievements of the fourth administration.

afr: dit was ook 'n groot eer om op 27 maart 2013 die vyfde brics-beraad in durban aan te bied, waartydens afrika-leiers ontwikkelingsamewerking met brics bespreek het.
eng: it was also a great honour to host the fifth brics summit on 27 march 2013 in durban, which saw the participation of african leaders to discuss developmental cooperation with brics.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om met ywer in die verenigde nasies te dien ter bevordering van kragtige en doelgerigte internasionale bestuur.
eng: we will continue to serve diligently in the united nations in promotion of strong international governance.

afr: ons sal ook voortgaan om die hervorming van die vn se veiligheidsraad en wêreldwye finansiële instellings te bevorder.
eng: we will also continue promoting the reform of the un security council and global financial institutions.

afr: agbare ledeas president van die cop17/cmp7 verenigde nasies beraad oor klimaatsverandering, wat in 2011 in durban aangebied is, het suid-afrika die wêreld suksesvol op 'n onomkeerbare pad geplaas deur die aanvaarding van die durban platform vir verskerpte optrede.
eng: honourable membersas president of the cop17/cmp7 united nations climate change conference which was hosted in durban in 2011, south africa successfully placed the world on an unassailable course, through the adoption of the durban platform for enhanced action.

afr: landgenote,ons was die afgelope 20 jaar gasheer vir verskeie internasionale sport- en kultuurbesoeke wat tot die bevordering van sosiale samehorigheid en eenheid bygedra het.
eng: compatriots,over the past 20 years we have hosted a number of international sporting and cultural visits, which has helped to boost social cohesion and unity.

afr: gedurende die afgelope vyf jaar het suid-afrika die uiters suksesvolle 2010 fifa sokkerwêreldbeker en ander deurslaggewende sokker-, rugby- en kriekettoernooie aangebied, wat suid-afrikaners met 'n daadwerklike gevoel van trots en eenheid gelaat het.
eng: in the past five years, south africa hosted the highly successful 2010 fifa soccer world cup and other key soccer, rugby and cricket tournament, which left a tangible feeling of pride and unity among all south africans.

afr: wanneer ons vanjaar 20 jaar van vryheid vier, doen ons dit met die wete dat ons suksesvol in ons strewe is om 'n nuwe nalatenskap vir ons land te bou.
eng: as we celebrate 20 years of freedom, we will do so having done well in building a new heritage landscape for our country.

afr: 'n aantal nuwe museums en monumente is opgerig, insluitend die standbeeld van oud-president mandela, wat nou 'n landmerk by die uniegebou is.
eng: a number of new museums and monuments were established, including the statue of former president mandela which has become a landmark in the union buildings.

afr: meer as 2 000 geografiese name is verander om onvanpaste plekname reg te stel, en ook om aan gemeenskappe die geleentheid te bied om plekname in hul omgewings te kies.
eng: more than 2000 geographical names have been changed in order to correct the ill-naming of places, as well as to give communities the right to determine the names of their areas.

afr: agbare ledevergun my die geleentheid om erkenning te verleen aan 'n paar van ons landgenote wat hul stempel in die wêreld afdruk.
eng: honourable membersallow me to acknowledge some of our compatriots who are making their mark in the world.

afr: ons wens ladysmith black mambazo geluk met die vierde grammy-toekenning wat hulle verlede maand gewen het.
eng: we congratulate ladysmith black mambazo on winning their fourth grammy award last month.

afr: ons verwelkom die groep se leier, mnr joseph shabalala, wat vanaand as een van ons gaste hier teenwoordig is.
eng: we welcome the group leader, mr joseph shabalala, one of our guests this evening.

afr: ons gee ook erkenning aan me yvonne chaka chaka, wat ook vanaand een van ons gaste is.
eng: we also acknowledge ms yvonne chaka chaka who is one of our guests this evening.

afr: sy doen baie goeie werk as die welwillendheidsambassadeur van die verenigde nasies se kinderfonds vir malaria in afrika en ook die verenigde nasies se millennium ontwikkelingsdoelwitte spesiale gesant vir afrika.
eng: she is doing a lot of good work as the united nations children’s fund goodwill ambassador for malaria in africa and also the united nations millennium development goals special envoy for africa.

afr: me chaka chaka is ook deur die wêreld ekonomiese forum in davos met die kristaltoekenning vir haar humanitêre werk vereer.
eng: ms chaka chaka was also honoured with the crystal award by the world economic forum in davos for her humanitarian work.

afr: ons erken ook, in haar afwesigheid, ons oscar-wenner hollywoodster, me charlize theron.
eng: we also recognise, in her absence, our oscar award-winning hollywood star, ms charlize theron.

afr: me theron is ook die vn-boodskapper vir vrede.
eng: ms theron is also the un messenger for peace.

afr: sy is ook 'n kampvegter vir die stryd teen vigs, veral onder die jeug en jong vroue.
eng: she also champions the fight against aids especially amongst the youth and young women.

afr: hierbenewens is sy ook deur die wêreld ekonomiese forum met 'n kristaltoekenning vereer.
eng: she was also honoured by the world economic forum with a crystal award.

afr: landgenoteu sou opgemerk het dat ons in hierdie staatsrede verslag gedoen het oor die afgelope vyf jaar spesifiek, en die vorige 20 jaar in die algemeen.
eng: compatriotsyou would have noticed that in this sona we have given a report of the past five yearsin particular and over the past 20 years in general.

afr: dit is nie 'n geleentheid om die program van aksie vir hierdie finansiële jaar bekend te maak nie.
eng: this is not an occasion to present the programme of action for this financial year.

afr: dié program sal deur die nuwe regering na afloop van die verkiesing voorgelê word.
eng: that programme will be presented by the new government after the elections.

afr: ter voorbereiding vir die eerste staatsrede deur die inkomende administrasie later vanjaar, werk ons die afgelope jaar aan 'n mediumtermyn strategiese raamwerk.
eng: to prepare for that first state of the nation address by the incoming administration later in the year, we have over the past year, been working on a medium term strategic framework.

afr: die raamwerk is ontwerp as die bousteen vir die eerste vyf jaar van die nasionale ontwikkelingsplan, van 2014 tot 2019. dit sluit ook sleuteldoelwitte vir die industriële beleidsaksieplan, die nuwe groeipad en die infrastruktuurplan in.
eng: the framework has been designed as the first five year building block of the national development plan, from 2014 to 2019. it also incorporates key targets of the industrial policy action plan, the new growth path and infrastructure plan.

afr: die bedoeling is om die nuwe konsepraamwerk ná die verkiesing by die eerste kabinet lekgotla ter tafel te lê.
eng: the intention is to table the draft framework to the first cabinet lekgotla after the elections.

afr: dit sal deur die nuwe administrasie in ooreenstemming met die verkiesingsmandaat verfyn word, sodat werk so gou moontlik ná die vorming van 'n nuwe regering kan begin.
eng: it will be refined by the new administration in line with its electoral mandate, so that work can start as soon as possible after the formation of a new government.

afr: dit was vir my en my administrasie 'n eer om voort te bou op die grondslag wat deur die eerste drie demokratiese administrasies gelê is, om die mense van suid-afrika te dien.
eng: it has been an honour for my administration and i to build on the foundation laid by the first three democratic administrations, to serve the people of south africa.

afr: as 'n land het ons op verskeie gebiede sukses behaal.
eng: as a country we have scored many successes.

afr: suid-afrika is vandag 'n veel beter plek om in te woon as vóór 1994. ons staar steeds uitdagings in die gesig.
eng: south africa is a much better place to live in now than it was before 1994. we continue to face challenges.

afr: maar ons lewens sal aanhou verbeter.
eng: but life will also continue to change for the better.

afr: 17 jun 2014die speaker van die nasionale vergadering (nv),die voorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies (nrp),adjunk-speaker van die nv en adjunkvoorsitter van die nrp,adjunkpresident van die republiek, agbare cyril ramaphosa,voormalige adjunkpresident kgalema motlanthe,agbare hoofregter van die republiek en al die gewaardeerde lede van die regbank, agbare ministers en adjunkministers,premiers en speakers van provinsiale wetgewers,voorsitter van salga, en die leierskap van die plaaslike regering,voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers,die hoofde van die hoofstuk 9-instellings,leiers van alle sektore,lede van die diplomatieke korps,agbare lede,vooraanstaande gastemede-suid-afrikaners,goeienaand, sanibonani, molweni, riperile, dumelang, ndi madekwana.
eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president of the republic, honourable cyril ramaphosa,former deputy president kgalema motlanthe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary,honourable ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,leaders from all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps,honourable members,distinguished guestsfellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, riperile, dumelang, ndi madekwana.

afr: dit is vir my ’n groot eer om u toe te spreek tydens hierdie eerste staatsrede van die vyfde demokratiese administrasie.
eng: it is a great pleasure to address you on this first state of the nation address of the fifth democratic administration.

afr: laat ek begin deur ons innige meegevoel oor die heengaan van die sekretaris van die parlement, mnr michael coetzee, uit te dra.
eng: let me begin by extending our deepest condolences on the sad passing of the secretary of parliament, mr michael coetzee.

afr: sy bydrae tot die stryd om vryheid en demokrasie sal nooit vergeet word nie.
eng: his contribution to the struggle for freedom and democracy will never be forgotten.

afr: ons het verlede week ook ons moeder, mama epainette mbeki, verloor.
eng: last week we also lost our mother, mama epainette mbeki.

afr: haar leiding en wysheid sal terdeë gemis word.
eng: her guidance and wisdom will be sorely missed.

afr: ons betuig ons innige meegevoel aan die mbeki-familie.
eng: we extend our heartfelt condolences to the mbeki family.

afr: ons harte gaan uit na die families van die sanw-lede wat vandag gesterf het in ’n tragiese helikopterongeluk in mpumalanga tydens ’n oefenkamp.
eng: our hearts go out to the families of sandf members who died in a tragic helicopter crash in mpumalanga today during a training camp.

afr: ons wens die beseerdes ’n spoedige herstel toe.
eng: we wish the injured a speedy recovery.

afr: landgenote,ons het onlangs op 7 mei ’n suksesvolle nasionale algemene verkiesing gehou.
eng: compatriots,we have recently emerged from a successful national general election held on the 7th of may.

afr: ons sien daarna uit om met al die partye in die parlement saam te werk in die proses om suid-afrika vorentoe te neem.
eng: we look forward to working with all the parties in parliament as we move south africa forward.

afr: tydens die staatsrede in februarie het ek oor die goeie vordering van 20 jaar van vryheid en demokrasie uitgewei.
eng: in the february state of the nation address, i related the good story of 20 years of freedom and democracy.

afr: ons het gesê dat suid-afrika ’n veel beter plek is om te woon as wat dit in 1994 was, en dat die lewens van miljoene van ons mense verbeter het.
eng: we stated that south africa is a much better place to live in than it was in 1994, and that the lives of millions of our people have improved.

afr: maar, soos blyk uit die nasionale ontwikkelingsplan (ndp) en die presidensiële oorsig oor 20 jaar, raak die drie uitdagings van armoede, ongelykheid en werkloosheid nog steeds die lewens van baie mense.
eng: however, as the national development plan and the presidency twenty year review highlight, the triple challenges of poverty, inequality and unemployment continue to affect the lives of many people.

afr: namate ons die tweede fase van ons oorgang van apartheid na ’n nasionale demokratiese samelewing betree, moet ons radikale sosio-ekonomiese transformasie teweeg bring om die drie uitdagings die hoof te bied.
eng: as we enter the second phase of our transition from apartheid to a national democratic society, we have to embark on radical socio-economic transformation to push back the triple challenges.

afr: verandering sal nie sonder ’n verreikende ingrypings plaasvind nie.
eng: change will not come about without some far-reaching interventions.

afr: ons het in ’n program van aksie gegrond op die anc-manifes en die nop in werking gestel.
eng: we have put in place a programme of action based on the anc manifesto and the national development plan.

afr: hiervolgens is die ekonomie ons hoofprioriteit.
eng: the economy takes centre stage in this programme.

afr: ons is daarvan oortuig dat dit die doeltreffendste wapen in die stryd teen armoede die skepping van behoorlike werk is en dat werkskepping vinniger ekonomiese groei vereis.
eng: it remains our strong belief that the most effective weapon in the campaign against poverty, is the creation of decent work, and that creating work requires faster economic growth.

afr: ons het ’n groeikoers van 5% teen 2019 as mikpunt gestel.
eng: we have set a growth target of 5 per cent by 2019. to achieve this, we will embark on various measures and interventions to jump-start the economy.

afr: ons het hierdie teiken in ’n moeilike tyd gestel.
eng: we have set this target during a difficult period.

afr: die ekonomie presteer die afgelope drie jaar onder sy potensiaal en verskeie huishoudings gaan onder moeilike finansiële omstandighede gebuk.
eng: the economy has grown below its potential over the last three years and many households are going through difficulties.

afr: die trae groei is gedeeltelik deur die wêreldwye ekonomiese insinking veroorsaak maar ook deur plaaslike toestande, soos die uitgerekte en by tye gewelddadige stakings, asook energietekorte.
eng: the slow growth has been caused in part by the global economic slowdown and secondly by domestic conditions, such as the prolonged and at times violent strikes, and also the shortage of energy.

afr: gegewe die effek van die onhoudbare omgewing van arbeidsverhoudinge op die ekonomie is dit noodsaaklik dat maatskaplike vennote byeenkom en die gewelddadige aard van stakings oordink.
