eng: given the impact of the untenable labour relations environment on the economy, it is critical for social partners to meet and deliberate on the violent nature and duration of the strikes.

afr: maatskaplike vennote sal ook oor die ongelykheid in lone moet beraadslaag.
eng: the social partners will also need to deliberate on wage inequality.

afr: aan die kant van die regering sal ons gedurende hierdie termyn die moontlikheid van ’n nasionale minimum loon ondersoek om die ongelykheid in inkomste die hoof te bied.
eng: on our side as government we will during this term investigate the possibility of a national minimum wage as one of the key mechanisms to reduce the income inequality.

afr: adjunk-president cyril ramaphosa sal binne die bestek van nedlac met maatskaplike vennote beraadslaag.
eng: deputy president cyril ramaphosa will convene the social partners dialogue, within the ambit of nedlac.

afr: tweedens sal die regering help met die implementering van die deurslaggewende raamwerkooreenkoms vir ’n volhoubare mynboubedryf wat verlede jaar deur die arbeid- en die sakesektor en die regering aangegaan is, onder leiding van die voormalige adjunkpresident kgalema motlanthe.
eng: secondly, government will play its part in the implementation of the landmark framework agreement for a sustainable mining industry entered into by labour, business and government last year, under the leadership of former deputy president kgalema motlanthe.

afr: die proses sal nou deur die president gelei word.
eng: the process will now be led by the president.

afr: ons sal ons onderneming om behuising en ander dienste te lewer om myndorpe te vernuwe, nakom, ingevolge die oktober 2012-ooreenkoms tussen die sakesektor, die regering en georganiseerde arbeid.
eng: we will implement the undertaking to build housing and other services to revitalize mining towns, as part of the october 2012 agreement between business, government and labour.

afr: die ooreenkoms sal fokus op die myngebiede van matlosana, emalahleni, sekhukhune, lephalale, wes-rand en matjhabeng.’n interministeriële komitee oor die heropbou in myngemeenskappe in nood is gestig onder die leierskap van die minister in die presidensie verantwoordelik vir beplanning, prestasiemonitering en -evaluering, mnr jeff radebe.
eng: the focus is the mining areas of motlosana, emalahleni, sekhukhune, lephalale, west rand and matjhabeng.

afr: die lede van die komitee sluit in die ministers van minerale hulpbronne, water en sanitasie, handel en nywerheid, maatskaplike ontwikkeling, arbeid, menslike nedersettings, gesondheid, ekonomiese ontwikkeling en finansies.
eng: an inter-ministerial committee on the revitalisation of distressed mining communities has been established under the leadership of the minister in the presidency responsible for planning, performance monitoring and evaluation, mr jeff radebe.

afr: om die lewensomstandighede vir mynwerkers verder te verbeter, monitor die regering tans mynmaatskappye se nakoming van mynbouhandves-teikens, met betrekking tot die verbetering van die lewensomstandighede van werkers.
eng: the members of the committee include the ministers of mineral resources, water and sanitation, trade and industry, social development, labour, human settlements, health, economic development and finance.

afr: van maatskappye word verwag om hostelle in familie-eenhede te omskep, ’n besettingskoers van slegs een persoon per kamer toe te laat en opsies vir huiseienaarskap vir mynwerkers te fasiliteer.
eng: to further promote improved living conditions for mine workers, government is monitoring the compliance of mining companies with mining charter targets, relating to improving the living conditions of workers.

afr: ons vra maatskappye om die 2014-sperdatum vir die teikens na te kom en gehoor te gee mynwerkers se reg tot waardigheid.
eng: companies are expected to convert or upgrade hostels into family units, attain the occupancy rate of one person per room and also facilitate home ownership options for mine workers.

afr: agbare lede,vooraanstaande gaste,die lae vlak van beleggings is ’n belangrike beperking op ekonomiese groei.
eng: honourable membersdistinguished guests,the low level of investments is a key constraint to economic growth.

afr: ons is vasbeslote om met die private sektor saam te werk om struikelblokke tot belegging uit die weg te ruim.
eng: we are determined to work with the private sector to remove obstacles to investment.

afr: ons wil graag sien dat die private sektor net soveel vertroue as die staatsdiens in die ekonomie toon.
eng: we would like to see the private sector showing as much confidence in the economy as the public sector.

afr: ons sal die sakesektor bly betrek by die bevordering van inklusiewe groei om ’n meer welvarende samelewing te bou.
eng: we will continue to engage business in promoting inclusive growth and to build a more prosperous society.

afr: in hierdie verband sal ek binnekort ’n vergadering met die presidensiële sakewerkgroep belê.
eng: in this regard, i will soon convene a meeting of the presidential business working group.

afr: ná die laaste vergadering van die werkgroep verlede jaar is ses werkbane geskep wat oplossings bespreek het vir die struikelblokke om sake in suid-afrika te doen.
eng: after the last meeting of the working group last year, six work streams were established and these have been discussing solutions to various obstacles to doing business in south africa.

afr: eienaars en uitvoerende hoofde van groot maatskappye het ook hierdie kwessies geopper tydens drie aparte, intensiewe werksessies by die mahlamba ndlopfu-landgoed in november en desember verlede jaar.
eng: these issues were also raised by owners and ceos of major companies that i hosted in three separate, intensive working sessions at the mahlamba ndlopfu residence in november and december last year.

afr: die volgende vergadering van die werkgroep sal die vennootskap vir inklusiewe groei en volhoubare ontwikkeling bevorder.
eng: the next meeting of the working group will take forward the partnership for inclusive growth and sustainable development.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,ons moet daadwerklik optree om die land se energiebeperkings die hoof te bied om ’n bevorderlike omgewing vir groei te skep.
eng: fellow south africans,we need to respond decisively to the country’s energy constraints in order to create a conducive environment for growth.

afr: die suksesvolle elektrifiseringsprogram, wat die lewens van baie huishoudings verander het, is bereik deur kunsmatige elektrisiteitsreserwes te benut, wat nie bedoel is vir massa-energie-verspreiding nie.
eng: the successful electrification programme which has changed the lives of many households was achieved by tapping into artificial electricity reserves, which had not been designed to cater for mass energy distribution.

afr: hierdie situasie noodsaak ’n radikale transformasie van die energie-sektor om ’n volhoubare energievermenging te skep bestaande uit steenkool-, son-, wind-, hidro-, gas- en kernkrag.
eng: this situation calls for a radical transformation of the energy sector, to develop a sustainable energy mix that comprises coal, solar, wind, hydro, gas and nuclear energy.

afr: die transformasie sal strukturele veranderinge vereis in die wyse waarop staatsdepartemente, staatsbeheerde maatskappye en die nywerheid die energie-uitdagings aanpak.
eng: the transformation will require structural changes in the manner in which government departments, affected state owned companies and the industry as a whole address the energy challenges.

afr: die energieplan verg kapitaal en menslike hulpbronne in die energiesektor.
eng: the energy plan also calls for the injection of capital and human resources into the energy sector.

afr: ons sal ook innoverende benaderings moet identifiseer om die regering se verkryging en lewering in die energie-sektor te versnel.
eng: we will also need to identify innovative approaches to fast-track procurement and delivery by government in the energy sector.

afr: om die institusionele kapasiteit voor te berei, omskep ons tans die nasionale kernreguleerder en uitvoerende koördinerende komitee van energie van die kabinet in die kabinetsubkomitee vir energiesekerheid.
eng: to prepare the institutional capacity, we are in the process of converting the national nuclear and energy executive coordinating committee of cabinet, into the energy security cabinet sub-committee.

afr: die subkomitee sal verantwoordelik wees vir die toesig, koördinering en bestuur van aktiwiteite van die energie-sektor.
eng: the sub-committee will be responsible for the oversight, coordination and direction of activities for the energy sector.

afr: die subkomitee sal ook verseker dat eskom die ondersteuning ontvang wat dit benodig om sy mandaat uit te voer en dat dit gefokus bly op die bereiking van sy doelwitte en teikens.
eng: the sub-committee will also ensure that eskom receives the support it requires to fulfil its mandate and that it remains focused on achieving its goals and targets.

afr: om ons doelwitte vir energiesekerheid te bereik, moet staatsbeheerde maatskappye in die energiesektor, soos eskom, die suid-afrikaanse kernenergiekorporasie en die sentrale energiefonds, by die geherdefinieerde rolle aanpas om hierdie doelwitte te bereik.
eng: to achieve our energy security goals, state owned companies involved in the energy sector, such as eskom, south african nuclear energy corporation and the central energy fund will have to adapt to the redefined roles to achieve these objectives.

afr: vir alle energievorme moet werk op tegniese vlak gedoen word, veral vir kernkrag en skaliegas, om befondsing, veiligheid, ontginning en die plaaslike vervaardiging van komponente te verbeter.
eng: work needs to be done at a technical level on all forms of energy especially nuclear energy and shale gas with regards to funding, safety, exploitation and the local manufacture of components.

afr: kernkrag het die vermoë om meer as 9 000 megawatt op te wek, en skaliegas word beskou as ’n klemverskuiwing vir ons ekonomie.
eng: nuclear has the possibility of generating well over 9000 megawatts, while shale gas is recognised as a game changer for our economy.

afr: ons sal skaliegas as opsie binne die raamwerk van ons goeie omgewingswette nastreef.
eng: we will pursue the shale gas option within the framework of our good environmental laws.

afr: daar is ook ’n paar dringende kwessies waarby ons in die kort termyn sal betrokke raak.
eng: there are also some urgent activities that we are engaging in, in the short term.

afr: vordering aan die bou van die medupi-kragstasie sal versnel word.
eng: progress at medupi power station construction site will be accelerated.

afr: planne vir die finansiering van die volgende groot steenkoolkragsentrale, coal 3, sal bespoedig word sodat die verkrygingsproses kan begin.
eng: plans on the financing of the next large coal fired power station, coal 3, will be speeded up so that the procurement process can commence.

afr: ons sal ook voortgaan met die tenderfase van die program vir onafhanklike kragverskaffers van hernubare energie om te baat by wind-, son-, biomassa- en ander tegnologie wat landelike ontwikkeling kan bevorder.
eng: we will also continue the 4th window of the renewable energy independent power producers programme, to take advantage of wind, solar, biomass and other technologies that increase the opportunity for rural development.

afr: agbare speaker en agbare voorsitter,ons soek ook buite ons grense na bronne vir energiesekerheid.
eng: honourable speaker and honourable chairperson,we are also looking beyond our borders for energy security.

afr: in oktober verlede jaar het ons die grand inga-hidrokragprojekverdrag met die regering van die demokratiese republiek van die kongo onderteken.
eng: in october last year we signed the grand inga hydro power project treaty with the government of the democratic republic of congo.

afr: hierdie reuse- strategiese projek het die potensiaal om 40 000 megawatt hidro-elektrisiteit op te wek.
eng: this massive and strategic project has the potential to generate 40 000 megawatts of hydro-electricity.

afr: ons land sal geweldig by hierdie mylpaalprojek baat.
eng: our country will benefit enormously from this milestone project.

afr: om gereed te wees vir die implementering van die energieplan, moet ons wetgewing finaliseer wat verband hou met die herstrukturering van die energiebedryf soos bepaal deur die wetsontwerp op onafhanklike stelsel- en markoperateurs, die geïntegreerde hulpbronplan en ander beleid rakende die energiesektor.
eng: to prepare for the implementation of the energy plan, we need to finalise the legislation that relates to the restructuring of the energy industry as envisaged by the independent system market operator bill, the integrated resource plan and other policies affecting the energy sector.

afr: agbare lede,vooraanstaande gaste,ons is ’n nasie aan die werk.
eng: honourable members,distinguished guests,we are a nation at work.

afr: bykomend tot die groot energiesekerheidsingrypings gaan ons voort om die nasionale infrastruktuurplan landwyd, onder toesig van die presidensiële infrastruktuur-koördineringskommissie, te implementeer.
eng: in addition to our major energy security interventions, we will continue to implement the successful national infrastructure plan, under the supervision of the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission, throughout the country.

afr: die afgelope vyf jaar het ons meer as r1 biljoen rand (miljoen-miljoen) in nuwe infrastruktuur belê vir die voorsiening van water, energie, vervoer, sanitasie, skole en klinieke asook internetverbindings.
eng: during the past five years, we invested about one trillion rand in new infrastructure to provide water, energy, transport, sanitation, schools and clinics and internet connections to our people.

afr: oor die volgende drie jaar sal ons r847 miljard aan infrastruktuur bestee en verskeie projekte begin of voltooi.
eng: over the next three years, we will spend 847 billion rand on the infrastructure and several projects are to be started or completed.

afr: bouwerk aan die mzimvubudam in die oos-kaap en die verhoging van die muur van clanwilliamdam in die wes-kaap sal voortgaan.
eng: the construction of mzimvubu dam in the eastern cape will continue, and also the raising of the wall of clanwilliam dam in the western cape.

afr: gedurende die volgende vyf jaar sal die grootste deel van die bouwerk aan fase 2 van die lesotho-hoogland-waterprojek voltooi wees.
eng: during the next five years the bulk of the construction work on phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project will be completed.

afr: binne die volgende vyf jaar sal bouwerk aan die meer as 60 meerkat-skottels voltooi wees en sal ons begin met die bou van die eerste 100 ska-antennes.
eng: in the next five years, we will finish building more than 60 meerkat dishes and start building the first 100 square kilometre array dish antennas.

afr: ons sal die bekostigbaarheid van inligting- en kommunikasie-infrastruktuur en elektroniese kommunikasiedienste, insluitend breëband- en digitale uitsaainetwerke, moderniseer en uitbrei.
eng: we will expand, modernise and increase the affordability of information and communications infrastructure and electronic communication services, including broadband and digital broadcasting.

afr: die kabinet het in desember verlede jaar ‘south africa connect’, ons breëband-beleid-en-strategie, aanvaar om hierdie missie te uit te bou.
eng: cabinet adopted “south africa connect”, our broadband policy and strategy, in december last year to take this mission forward.

afr: ons sal met verskeie ander infrastruktuurprojekte voortgaan wat die lewensomstandighede van ons mense sal verander en ekonomiese groei sal bevorder.
eng: we will continue with various other infrastructure projects that will change the living conditions of our people and boost economic growth.

afr: landgenote,ons gaan voortbou op ons radikale sosio-ekonomiese transformasieprogram met die implementering van die nywerheidsbeleidaksieplan.
eng: compatriotsour radical socio-economic transformation programme will be taken further with the implementation of the industrial policy action plan.

afr: ons gaan plaaslike aankope bevorder en binnelandse produksie verhoog deur te verseker dat die staat 75% van goedere en dienste van suid-afrikaanse vervaardigers koop.
eng: we will promote local procurement and increase domestic production by having the state buy 75% of goods and services from south african producers.

afr: ons gaan onder andere die hernubare-energiesektor, die vervaardiging van busse, transnet se r50 miljard-lokomotiefkontrakte en prasa se passasierspoorprojekte gebruik om plaaslike inhoud te bevorder en groei te stimuleer.
eng: we will utilise the renewable energy sector, the manufacturing of buses, transnet’s r50 billion locomotive contracts and prasa’s passenger rail projects among others, to promote local content and boost growth.

afr: oor die volgende vyf jaar gaan ons ook plaaslike ekonomiese ontwikkeling en industrialisering bevorder deur die skepping van spesiale ekonomiese sones in die land.
eng: we will also over the next five years promote regional economic development and industrialisation, through the creation of special economic zones around the country.

afr: ons gaan die mededingendheid van die arbeidsintensiewe motor-, klere-, leer-, skoeisel- en tekstielbedrywe deur middel van aansporings bly ondersteun.
eng: we will continue to support through incentives, the competitiveness of the auto, clothing, leather, footwear and textile industries, which are labour intensive.

afr: agbare lede,ondanks moeilike wêreldhandelstoestande in ons tradisionele markte, het suid-afrika se toerismesektor in 2013 positiewe groei getoon en ’n rekordhoogtepunt van 9,6 miljoen internasionale toeriste bereik.
eng: honourable membersdespite tough global trading conditions in its traditional markets, south africa’s tourism sector continued to show positive growth in 2013, reaching a record high of 9.6 million international tourist arrivals.

afr: oorsese toeriste is baie lief vir suid-afrika en hou aan om die land te besoek.
eng: people love our country and continue to visit south africa.

afr: ons het ’n teiken gestel om die getal jaarlikse buitelandse besoekers teen 2017 op meer as 15 miljoen te staan te bring.
eng: we have set a target to increase the number of foreign visitor arrivals to more than 15 million annually by 2017. we are also looking at increasing the contribution of tourism to the country’s revenue to more than 125 billion rand by 2017. over the next five years, we will prioritise support to small business, as well as township and informal sector businesses in particular, thus using the smme development programme to boost broad-based black economic empowerment.

afr: oor die volgende vyf jaar gaan ons daarop fokus om kleinsake, township-ondernemings en veral die informele sakesektor te ondersteun en sodoende die kmmo-ontwikkelingsprogram gebruik om breëbasis- swart ekonomiese bemagtiging te bevorder.
eng: we will sharpen the implementation of the amended broad-based black economic empowerment act and the employment equity act, in order to transform the ownership, management and control of the economy.

afr: ons gaan die implementering van die gewysigde wet op breëbasis- swart ekonomiese bemagtiging en die wet op billike indiensneming verskerp om eienaarskap, bestuur en beheer van die ekonomie te transformeer.
eng: we will promote more employee and community share ownership schemes and boost the participation of black entrepreneurs in the re-industrialisation of the economy.

afr: landgenote,die totale bates van ons finansiële instellings vir ontwikkeling beloop sowat r230 miljard.
eng: compatriots,the total assets of our development finance institutions amount to some r230 billion.

afr: die invloed op ontwikkeling is egter nie breed genoeg nie en die beleggingsprogramme is nie goed gekoördineer nie.
eng: however, their impact on development is not sufficiently broad-based and their investment programmes are not well coordinated.

afr: die instellings sal binne die volgende vyf jaar herposisioneer word om instrumente van maatskaplike ontwikkeling te word.
eng: the institutions will be repositioned in the next five years to become real engines of socio-economic development.

afr: in dieselfde trant sal die regering postbank ondersteun sodat dit ’n leidende rol kan speel in die uitbreiding van bankdienste aan die armes en die werkersklas.
eng: in the same vein, postbank will be supported so that it can play a leading role in the expansion of banking services to the poor and the working class.

afr: agbare lede,vooraanstaande gaste,jeugbemagtiging sal die fokus wees in ons program van ekonomiese transformasie.
eng: honourable members,distinguished guests,youth empowerment will be prioritised in our economic transformation programme.

afr: die regering gaan verdere stappe doen om die indiensneming van jong mense te bespoedig in ooreenstemming met die jeugindiensnemingsakkoord.
eng: government will introduce further measures to speed up the employment of young people, consistent with the youth employment accord.

afr: ons gaan die aantal internskapposte in die staatsdiens verhoog, en elke staatsdepartement en openbare entiteit sal verplig word om indiensopleiding te verskaf.
eng: we will expand the number of internship positions in the public sector, with every government department and public entity being required to take on interns for experiential training.

afr: die private sektor het positief op die bekendstelling van die indiensnemingsbelasting-aansporing gereageer.
eng: the private sector has responded positively to the introduction of the employment tax incentive.

afr: binne slegs vyf maande het sowat 133 000 werknemers hierby gebaat en 11 000 werkgewers het aan die aansporingskema deelgeneem.
eng: in only five months, there are 133 000 employees who have benefited and 11 000 employers who have participated in the incentive scheme.

afr: die meerderheid is in die groot- en kleinhandel, vervaardiging- en die finansiële sektor in diens geneem.
eng: the majority has been employed in wholesale and retail trade, manufacturing and finance sectors.

afr: agbare speaker,geagte voorsitter,sedert 2004 het die regering die uitgebreide openbarewerkeprogram (uowp), wat werk en opleiding vir werkloses bied, suksesvol geïmplementeer.
eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson,government has since 2004 run the successful expanded public works programme which provides work opportunities and training for the unemployed.

afr: die nuwe fase sal teen 2019 ses miljoen werkgeleenthede skep.
eng: the new phase will provide six million work opportunities by 2019. we are building on the success of the past few years.

afr: ons het die afgelope vyf jaar ongeveer vier miljoen werksgeleenthede geskep.
eng: we created around four million work opportunities in the past five years.

afr: die omgewingsinisiatiewe van die uowp soos werk op afval, werk in vleilande, werk vir water, werk aan brande en die omgewingsjeugdiensteprogram sal ook tot 2019 uitgebrei word ter ondersteuning van jeugontwikkeling.
eng: the expanded public works programme environmental initiatives such as working on waste, working on wetlands, working for water, working on fire and the environmental youth services programme will also be upscaled up to 2019, in support of youth development.

afr: daarbenewens sal die plaaslike regeringsgebaseerde gemeenskapwerke-rogram uitgebrei word om ’n miljoen werkgeleenthede teen die einde van 2019 te skep.
eng: in addition, the local government- based community work programme will be expanded to provide a million work opportunities by the end of 2019. compatriotswe have identified agriculture as a key job driver.

afr: landgenote,ons het die landbou as ’n belangrike dryfveer vir die taak geïdentifiseer.
eng: our target is for the agricultural sector to create a million jobs by 2030. government will provide comprehensive support to smallholder farmers by speeding up land reform and providing technical, infrastructural and financial support.

afr: die regering sal omvattende ondersteuning aan kleinboere bied deur grondhervorming te bespoedig en tegniese, infrastrukturele en finansiële ondersteuning te bied.
eng: support will be provided to communities as well to engage in food production and subsistence farming to promote food security, in line with the fetsa tlala food production programme.

afr: ons gaan ook ondersteuning bied aan gemeenskappe en betrokke raak by voedselproduksie en bestaansboerdery om voedselsekerheid te bevorder, in ooreenstemming met die fetsa tlala-voedselproduksieprogram.
eng: we will accelerate the settlement of remaining land claims submitted before the cut-off date of 1998. we will also re-open the period for the lodgement of claims for the restitution of land for a period of five years, and codify the exceptions to the 1913 cut-off date for the descendants of the khoi and san.

afr: agbare speaker,geagte voorsitter,afrika suid van die sahara raak ’n toenemend belangrike handelsvennoot vir ons land.
eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson,sub-saharan africa is increasingly becoming a more important trade partner for our country.

afr: ons is bemoedig deur die feit dat suid-afrikaanse beleggings in die vasteland van r5,5 miljard in 2002 tot r32,3 miljard in 2013 gegroei het.
eng: we are encouraged that south african investments in the continent increased from 5.5 billion rand in 2002 to 32.3 billion rand in 2013. our exports into the continent are also increasing each year, having been at 28.5 percent up from 22.6 percent in 2002. south africa will continue to champion broader regional integration through the southern african customs union, sadc and the envisaged tripartite free trade area that spans eastern and southern africa.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,ons wil hê dat ons mense ’n aangename ervaring van plaaslike regering beleef.
eng: fellow south africans,we would like our people’s experience of local government to be a pleasant one.

afr: ons het na die klagtes en voorstelle van suid-afrikaners oor die prestasie van munisipaliteite oor die afgelope vyf jaar geluister.
eng: we have listened to the complaints and proposals of south africans over the past five years, relating to the performance of municipalities.

afr: ek wil nou graag ons plan van aksie om plaaslike regering te verbeter met u deel.
eng: i would like to share with you now, our plan of action to revitalise local government.

afr: ons munisipaliteite is oor die afgelope 20 jaar van demokrasie op ’n stewige grondslag gebou.
eng: our municipalities are built on a firm foundation, built over the last 20 years of democracy.

afr: ons het al ons munisipaliteite geëvalueer.
eng: we have evaluated all our municipalities.

afr: ons het gekyk na hul finansiële bestuur, hoe hulle binne die wetgewende prosesse werk asook hul vermoë om projekte te implementeer en kapasiteitbeperkings aan te pak.
eng: we have inspected their financial management, how they work within legislative processes as well as their ability to roll out projects and to address capacity constraints.

afr: ons het ook gekyk na hoe hulle op betogings oor dienslewering reageer.
eng: we have also looked at how they respond to service delivery protests.

afr: daar was baie suksesse in verskeie munisipaliteite.
eng: there have been many successes in many municipalities.

afr: maar ons het ook met ’n hele paar uitdagings te kampe.
eng: however we face a number of challenges in others.

afr: ons is in ons skik dat 11 munisipaliteite uitstaan wat betref volgehoue goeie prestasie in oudits, besteding van toelaes vir munisipale infrastruktuur en dienslewering.
eng: we are pleased that eleven municipalities stand out for consistent good performance in audits, expenditure on municipal infrastructure grants and service delivery.

afr: die 11 munisipaliteite is die volgende:1. nkangala distriksmunisipaliteit2.
eng: nkangala district municipality.2.

afr: cacadu distriksmunisipaliteit3.
eng: cacadu district municipality.3.

afr: zoeloeland distriksmunisipaliteit4.
eng: zululand district municipality.4.

afr: umzinyathi distriksmunisipaliteit5.
eng: umzinyathi district municipality.5.

afr: ilembe distriksmunisipaliteit6.
eng: ilembe district municipality.6.

afr: die weskus distriksmunisipaliteit8.
eng: the west coast district municipality.8.

afr: matzikama plaaslike munisipaliteit9.
eng: matzikama local municipality.9.

afr: mosselbaai plaaslike munisipaliteit10.
eng: mossel bay local municipality.10.

afr: breedevallei plaaslike munisipaliteit, en11.
eng: breede valley local municipality and11.

afr: ons sal bystand aan onder andere die volgende munisipaliteite bied:in die amathole distriksmunisipaliteit in die oos-kaap het die ontwikkelingsbank van suider-afrika befondsing vir die ontwikkeling van infrastruktuur goedgekeur.
eng: we will provide assistance to the following municipalities amongst others:in amathole district municipality in the eastern cape, our development bank of southern africa has approved funding to develop infrastructure.

afr: eenhonderd projekte, veral in water en sanitasie, sal van stapel gestuur word en binne die volgende 12 maande voltooi wees.
eng: one hundred numerous projects, mainly in water and sanitation, will be started and the objective is to complete them over the next 12 months.

afr: in die umzinyathi distriksmunisipaliteit, kwazulu-natal, sal befondsing beskikbaar gestel word vir infrastruktuurprojekte, hoofsaaklik die elektrifisering van huishoudings.
eng: in umzinyathi district municipality, kwazulu-natal, funding will be provided to develop infrastructure projects covering mainly the electrification of households.

afr: plaaslike munisipaliteite waaraan hulp verleen sal word sluit in msinga, umvoti en nquthu.
eng: the local municipalities to be serviced include msinga, umvoti and nqutu.

afr: in die alfred nzo distriksmunisipaliteit in die oos-kaap sal befondsing beskikbaar gestel word vir die ontwikkeling van infrastruktuur-projekte wat insluit watervoorsiening, sanitasie, en elektrifisering.
eng: in alfred nzo district municipality in the eastern cape, funding will be provided for infrastructure development projects covering water provision, sanitation, and electrification.

afr: plaaslike munisipaliteite wat hierby betrokke is, sluit in mbizana en ntabankulu, waar sowat eenmiljoen mense woon.
eng: local municipalities involved include mbizana and ntabankulu, catering for a population of about one million people.

afr: ons sal die lukhanji plaaslike munisipaliteit help om sy administrasie in orde te kry en ondersteuningsplanne vir die voorsiening van water en elektrisiteit implementeer.
eng: we will support lukhanji local municipality to reorganize its administration and implement support plans for the provision of water and electricity.

afr: ons gaan die or tambo-distriksmunisipaliteit help om sy administrasie en organisatoriese struktuur te stabiliseer en die implementering van die presidensiële ingrypingsplanne versnel.
eng: we will assist or tambo district municipality to stabilise the administration and organizational structure and fast-track the implementation of the presidential intervention plans.

afr: in die mbhashe plaaslike munisipaliteit gaan ons afvalbestuurplanne implementeer en kwessies rakende grondwaterbesoedeling uitstryk.
eng: in mbashe local municipality we will implement waste management plans and address ground water contamination issues.

afr: by die ngaka modiri molema-distriksmunisipaliteit in noordwes gaan die nasionale regering ondersteuning bied en met die ontwikkelingsbank van suider-afrika saamwerk om finansiering vir water-en-sanitasie-infrastruktuur op te los.
eng: at ngaka modiri molema district municipality in the north west, national government will provide support and work with the development bank of southern africa to resolve financing for water and sanitation infrastructure.

afr: ons sal die stad van johannesburg in gauteng help om probleme met die betalingstelsel op te los.
eng: we will support the city of joburg in gauteng to resolve problems with the billing system.

afr: ons gaan die moqhaka plaaslike munisipaliteit in die vrystaat help met die uitwissing van die emmerstelsel en ooptoilet-uitdagings.
eng: we will support moqhaka local municipality in the free state with the eradication of the bucket system and open toilet challenges.

afr: intussen is werk aan die gang om die emmerstelsel in die hele land uit te roei.
eng: meanwhile work is underway to eradicate the bucket system throughout the country.

afr: dit is ook die prioriteit van die interministeriële taakspan oor dienslewering wat ek in die lewe geroep het.
eng: this will also be the priority of the inter-ministerial task team on service delivery that i have established.

afr: die span word gelei deur minister pravin gordhan.
eng: the team is led by minister pravin gordhan.

afr: die span bestaan uit die ministers van beplanning, prestasiemonitering en evaluering in die presidensie, menslike nedersettings, water en sanitasie, vervoer, binnelandse sake, openbare ondernemings, energie, landelike ontwikkeling en grondhervorming, gesondheid en basiese onderwys.
eng: the team comprises the ministers of planning, performance monitoring and evaluation in the presidency, human settlements, water and sanitation, transport, home affairs, public enterprises, energy, rural development and land reform, health and basic education.

afr: agbare speaker en agbare voorsitter,’n belangrike fokusarea in plaaslike regering oor die volgende vyf jaar gaan wees hoe ons reageer op die realiteit van snelle verstedeliking.
eng: honourable speaker and honourable chairperson,a key focus area in local government in the next five years will be how we respond to the reality of rapid urbanisation.

afr: suid-afrika is steeds ’n verstedelikte land.
eng: south africa is becoming an urban country.

afr: teen 2011 sal byna 63% van die bevolking in dorpe en stede woon en daar word verwag dat hierdie tendens in die komende dekade sal voortduur.
eng: by 2011 almost 63% of our population were residing in towns and cities and this trend is expected to continue over the coming decade.

afr: die regering se geïntegreerde stedelike ontwikkelingsraamwerk sal teen 30 julie 2014 afgehandel wees.
eng: our government’s integrated urban development framework will be finalised by 30 july 2014. it will provide a new deal for south african cities and towns.

afr: dit ’n beleidsraamwerk wat uiteensit hoe die stedelike stelsel in suid-afrika oor die volgende 20 tot 30 jaar herorganiseer kan word sodat stede en dorpe inklusiewe, hulpbrondoeltreffende en goeie plekke kan word om in te woon.
eng: it will set out a policy framework on how the urban system in south africa can be reorganised so that cities and towns can become inclusive, resource efficient and good places to live in over the next 20 to 30 years.

afr: laat ons ’n sukses maak van plaaslike regering!
eng: together let us move local government forward!

afr: landgenote,oor die afgelope 20 jaar het ons ons ondersteuning vir gemarginaliseerde en kwesbare huishoudings uitgebrei deur beleggings in behuising, uitbreidings aan ons maatskapliketoelae-program en verbeterde toegang tot onderwys en primêre gesondheidsorg.
eng: compatriotsover the past twenty years, we have steadily expanded support for marginalised and vulnerable households through investments in housing, extensions to our social grants programmes and improved access to education and primary health care.

afr: in die toekoms sal ons ons fokus op die vermindering van armoede verskerp.
eng: over the period ahead, poverty reduction will continue to be reinforced.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om in onderwys en vaardigheidsontwikkeling te belê, aangesien dit die sleutel tot ekonomiese groei en ontwikkeling is.
eng: we will continue to invest in education and skills development as that is the key to economic growth and development.

afr: ons moet ingenieurs, elektrisiëns, loodgieters, dokters, onderwysers en baie ander beroepslui in ons land se ekonomie behou.
eng: we need engineers, electricians, plumbers, doctors, teachers and many other professionals to build our country’s economy.

afr: onderwys bly dus ’n top-prioriteit vir die regering.
eng: education therefore remains an apex priority for this government.

afr: ons sal voortgaan om universele toegang tot onderwys te bevorder deur te verseker dat alle kinders tussen die ouderdomme van sewe en 15 skoolgaan.
eng: we will continue to promote universal access to education by ensuring that all children between ages 7 and 15 are in school.

afr: ons sal die getal graad 12-leerders wat toegang tot universiteit kan kry van 172 000 in 2013 tot 250 000 in 2019 vermeerder.
eng: we will increase the number of grade 12 learners who can gain entrance to university, moving from 172 000 in 2013 to 250 000 in 2019. we opened at least one new school a week in the eastern cape last year and will continue to eradicate mud schools and other inappropriate structures.

afr: die aantal jong mense in universiteite en kolleges het oor die jare toegeneem.
eng: the number of young people in universities and colleges has increased over the years.

afr: kontrakteurs sal in september begin bou aan universiteite in die noord-kaap en mpumalanga.
eng: contractors will move on site in september to build new universities in the northern cape and mpumalanga.

afr: teen januarie volgende jaar sal die eerste mediese studente by die nuwe mediese universiteit in limpopo kan inskryf.
eng: by january next year, the first intake of medical students will be enrolled at the new medical university in limpopo.

afr: daarbenewens sal 12 opleidings- en professionele onderwyskolleges gebou word om tegniese vaardighede in die land uit te brei.
eng: in addition, 12 training and vocational education colleges will be built to expand the technical skills mix in the country.

afr: landgenote,ons moet saamwerk om dwelms en dwelmmisbruik in ons skole en gemeenskappe te beveg.
eng: compatriotstogether we must continue to fight drugs and substance abuse in our schools and communities.

afr: ons sal ook veiligheid in skole, die vervoer van skoliere en kindergesondheid prioritiseer.
eng: we will also prioritise safety in schools, scholar transport and child health.

afr: op die gebied van gesondheid sal ons harder werk om die lewensverwagting by die geboorte van 60 jaar in 2012 na 63 jaar in 2019 te verhoog.
eng: in the area of health, we will work harder to increase life expectancy at birth from 60 years in 2012 to 63 years in 2019. the campaign to reduce child and maternal mortality ratios will continue.

afr: die veldtog om die verhouding van kind- en moedersterftes te verminder, sal voortgaan.
eng: this will require the implementation of the national health insurance and the improvement of the quality of care in the public sector.

afr: dit sal die implementering van die nasionale gesondheidsversekering vereis en die verbetering van die gehalte van gesondheidsorg in die staatsdiens.
eng: we will build on the success of our hiv and aids treatment and support programme by expanding our mass hiv prevention communication campaigns.

afr: ons sal voortbou op die suksesse van ons miv- en vigs-behandeling en ondersteuningsprogram deur ons massa miv-voorkomingskommunikasieveldtogte uit te brei.
eng: compatriotswe will take forward the advances we have made in promoting women’s empowerment and development.

afr: die minister in die presidensie verantwoordelik vir vroueontwikkeling, me susan shabangu, sal saam met ander staatsdepartemente, agentskappe, die private sektor en nie-regeringsorganisasies vroue se sosio-ekonomiese bemagtiging, ontwikkeling en menseregte bevorder.
eng: the minister in the presidency responsible for women’s development, ms susan shabangu, will work with other government departments, agencies, the private sector and non-governmental organisations, to promote women’s socio-economic empowerment, development and human rights.

afr: om ons demokratiese winste verder te konsolideer, sal ons voortgaan om die lewens van mense met gestremdhede oor die volgende vyf jaar te bevorder en te verbeter.
eng: to further consolidate our democratic gains, we will continue to advance and improve the lives of people with disabilities over the next five years.

afr: ons sal met die gestremdheidsektor saamwerk om sleutelareas te identifiseer waarin ons suid-afrika se rol as ondertekenaar van die vn se konvensie oor die regte van persone met gestremdhede en die opsionele protokol moet vervul.
eng: we will work with the disability sector to identify key areas in which we should fulfil south africa’s role as signatory to the un convention on the rights of persons with disabilities and its optional protocols.

afr: nog ’n belangrike ingryping in hierdie termyn is om die beleid oor nasionale regte van gestremdes, wat insluit die nasionale raamwerk oor die regte van gestremdes te finaliseer.
eng: another key intervention this term will be to finalise the national disability rights policy which includes the national disability rights framework.

afr: die beleid en raamwerk sal regeringsoptrede rig om ’n meer inklusiewe gemeenskap te bevorder en om die betrokkenheid van mense met gestremdhede in besluitnemingsprosesse uit te brei.
eng: the policy and the framework will guide government action to promote a more inclusive society and to promote the involvement of people with disabilities in decision-making processes.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,ons het die afgelope vyf jaar vordering gemaak in die vermindering van die vlakke van ernstige misdaad soos moord, ernstige rooftogte, misdaad teen vroue, kinders en ander kwesbare groepe, maar dit bly onaanvaarbaar hoog.
eng: fellow south africanssome progress has been made over the past five years in reducing the levels of serious crime such as murders, aggravated robberies, crimes against women, children and other vulnerable groups, but they remain unacceptably high.

afr: ons sal werk om vlakke van misdaad verder te verminder.
eng: we will work to further reduce levels of crime.

afr: die spesiale ondersoekeenheid, die teenkorrupsie-taakspan, die batebeslagleggingseenheid en die valke het merkbare vordering gemaak in hul strewe om korrupsie in die samelewing en in die openbare sektor te bestry.
eng: the special investigating unit, the anti-corruption task team the asset forfeiture unit and the hawks, have made notable progress in our quest to combat corruption in society broadly and in the public sector.

afr: hierdie werk sal oor die volgende vyf jaar voortduur.
eng: this work will continue in the next five years.

afr: ons sal aandag gee aan swak plekke wat betref verkryging, bestuur en operasionele stelsels wat die doeltreffendheid van die regering ondermyn.
eng: weaknesses in procurement, management and operations systems that undermine the efficiency and effectiveness of government will be addressed.

afr: een van die belangrikste stappe waarmee ons reeds besig is, is om verkryging te sentraliseer deur die kantoor van die hoofaankopebeampte in die nasionale tesourie.
eng: one of the key steps, which is already underway, is to centralise procurement under the office of the chief procurement officer in the national treasury.

afr: ons het begin om hierdie nuwe benadering op die proef te stel met die sentralisering van die verkryging van skoolmeubels in die oos-kaap.
eng: we have begun piloting this new approach with the centralised procurement of school furniture in the eastern cape.

afr: die meubels sal teen die middel van augustus 2014 in alle oos-kaapse skole gelewer word.
eng: the furniture will be delivered in all eastern cape schools by the middle of august 2014. measures will be introduced to prevent public servants and public representatives from doing business with the state.

afr: ons gaan maatreëls instel om te keer dat staatsamptenare en staatsdiensverteenwoordigers met die regering sake doen.
eng: these will be supported by improved implementation of the financial disclosure framework, strengthened protection of whistle-blowers, and the provision of technical assistance to departments for the effective management of discipline.

afr: landgenote,oor die volgende vyf jaar sal ons aanhou bou aan ’n beter afrika en ’n meer regverdige wêreld.
eng: compatriotsover the next five years we will continue to promote the building of a better africa and a more just world.

afr: suid-afrika sal voortgaan om streeks- en kontinentale prosesse te ondersteun, om krisisse te reageer en op te los, om vrede en veiligheid te bevorder, om plaaslike integrasie te versterk, om intra-afrika-handel aansienlik te verhoog en volhoubare ontwikkeling in afrika aansienlik te bevorder.
eng: south africa will continue to support regional and continental processes to respond to and resolve crises, promote peace and security, strengthen regional integration, significantly increase intra-african trade and champion sustainable development in africa.

afr: dit sal ondersteuning en uitvoering van besluite van die afrika-unie behels, asook die bevordering van die werk van die strukture van die au.
eng: this will entail supporting and executing decisions of the african union as well as the promotion of the work of its structures.

afr: ons sal ook voortgaan om suid-suid-samewerking te bevorder deur middel van lidmaatskap en betrokkenheid by formasies en groeperings van die suide.
eng: we will also continue to promote south-south cooperation by utilising membership and engagements with formations and groupings of the south.

afr: net so sal ons aanhou om wedersyds voordelige verhoudings met die lande in die noorde te bevorder.
eng: similarly we will continue to promote mutually beneficial relations with countries of the north.

afr: ons sal aanhou om ekonomiese ontwikkeling, handel en beleggingsvennootskappe met die brics-lande te verskerp deur middel van die brics-kontakgroep vir ekonomiese en handelskwessies.
eng: we will continue to deepen economic development, trade, and investment partnerships with the brics through the work of the brics contact group for economic and trade issues.

afr: agbare lede,vooraanstaande gastedie suid-afrikaanse nasionale weermag is ’n instelling wat nasionale trots kweek as dit aan vredesendings op die vasteland deelneem.
eng: honourable members,distinguished gueststhe south african national defence force (sandf) has been a source of national pride as it participated in peacekeeping missions in the continent.

afr: hierdie rol sal voortgaan en die regering ondersoek tans maniere om die mandaat van die sanwm uit te voer in ooreenstemming met die onlangs voltooide verdedigingsoorsig.
eng: this role will continue and government is looking into the resourcing of the sandf mandate in line with recently concluded defence review.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,om hierdie program van aksie te bevorder, sal ek en die adjunkpresident met ministers en adjunkministers vergader om die besonderhede van die implementeringsplanne van elke departement te bespreek.
eng: fellow south africans,to take this programme of action forward, the deputy president and i will be meeting with ministers and deputy ministers to discuss the detailed implementation plans for each department.

afr: elke minister sal ’n prestasie-ooreenkoms met die president onderteken wat elke departement sal doen om die program van aksie uit te voer, uiteen sal sit.
eng: each minister will sign a performance agreement with the president outlining what each department will do to deliver on the programme of action.

afr: landgenote, 17 junie is die 22ste herdenking van die verskriklike boipatong-slagting in gauteng.
eng: compatriotsthe 17th of june marks the 22nd anniversary of the horrific boipatong massacre in gauteng.

afr: as ons terugkyk na een van die ergste gruverhale in ons onlangse verlede, is dit ’n herinnering dat ons genesing en nasiebou meer as ooit sal moet bevorder.
eng: looking back at one of the worst horror stories in recent history, we are reminded of the fact that we need to prioritise healing and nation building more than ever before.

afr: ons moet begrip, verdraagsaamheid en versoening bou, en saam rassisme, vreemdelingehaat, homofobie en alle vorme van onverdraagsaamheid beveg.
eng: we must continue to build understanding, tolerance and reconciliation, and together fight racism, xenophobia, homophobia and all related intolerances.

afr: die gebruik van sport en kultuur as ’n samebindende middel sal in hierdie termyn voortduur.
eng: the use of sports and culture as a unifying factor in our country will continue during this term.

afr: ons sal ook voortgaan om die grondwet in skole te bevorder en verseker dat ons kinders grootword met positiewe waardes en liefde vir hul land en sy mense.
eng: we will also continue to promote the constitution in schools and ensure that our children grow up with positive values and love for their country and its people.

afr: ons sal oor die volgende vyf jaar voortbou op inklusiewe erfenis met die bou van monumente en ander simbole om die gevalle helde van die gewapende stryd te vereer wat gehelp het om die vryheid en demokrasie mee te bring wat ons vandag geniet.
eng: we will continue to build inclusive heritage over the next five years through building monuments and other symbols that honour the heroes of the struggle that delivered the freedom and democracy we enjoy today.

afr: as deel van ons viering van 20 jaar van vryheid en demokrasie sal rekords wat vanjaar ook 20 jaar oud is, soos dié van voormalige president nelson mandela se eerste dae in sy amp, na die nasionale argief oorgeplaas word.
eng: as part of our 20 years of freedom and democracy celebrations, records turning 20 years this year, such as those of the late former president nelson mandela’s first days in office will be transferred to the national archives.

afr: vanjaar word die rekords van die kodesa-veelparty-onderhandelingsforum in die internasionale wêreldregister van herinnering opgeneem.
eng: this year will also see the listing of the codesa multi-party negotiating forum records in the international memory of the world register.

afr: volgende maand herdenk die land en die wêreld internasionale mandeladag.
eng: next month the country and the world will mark international mandela day.

afr: alle suid-afrikaners behoort minstens 67 minute op 18 julie af te staan om suid-afrika skoon te maak, wat ook vanjaar se tema is.
eng: all south africans should dedicate at least 67 minutes on the 18th of july, to clean south africa, which is our theme for this year.

afr: speaker van die nasionale vergadering (nv),voorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies (nrp),adjunkspeaker van die nasionale vergadering en adjunkvoorsitter van die nrp,adjunkpresident cyril ramaphosa,voormalige president thabo mbeki,voormalige president fw de klerk,hoofregter mogoeng mogoeng en al die gewaardeerde lede van die regbank,visepresident van die pan-afrikaanse parlement, sy eksellensie mnr roger nkondo dang,speaker van die nv van die verenigde republiek van tanzanië en voorsitter van die saog se parlementêre forum, die agbare anne makinda,ministers en adjunkministers,premiers en speakers van provinsiale wetgewers,voorsitter van salga,hoofde van die hoofstuk 9-instellings,voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers,voormalige speaker van die nv, dr frene ginwala,hul majesteite koning keru molotlegi, koning toni peter mphephu (ramabulana).
eng: the speaker of the national assembly (na),the chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop),deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president cyril ramaphosa,former president thabo mbeki,former president fw de klerk,chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,the vice president of the pan african parliament, his excellency mr roger nkondo dang,the speaker of the national assembly of the united republic of tanzania and chairperson of the southern african development community (sadc) parliamentary forum, the hon anne makinda,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of the south african local government association (salga),the heads of chapter 9 institutions,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the former speaker of the na, dr frene ginwala,their majesties king keru molotlegi, king toni peter mphephu (ramabulana),king mpendulo zwelonke sigcawu,invited guests,members of the diplomatic corps,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, riperile, dumelang, lotjhani, goeienaand, ndi madekwana, !

afr: die jaar 2015 is die 60ste herdenking van 'n historiese oomblik in ons geskiedenis, toe suid-afrikaners uit alle vlakke van die samelewing die vryheidsmanifes in 1955 te kliptown, soweto, aanvaar het.
eng: the release of madiba marked a giant leap in the long walk to freedom for the people of south africa as a whole and dealt a fatal blow to apartheid colonialism.

afr: die konstruksie van die drie nuwe kragstasies by kusile, medupi en ingula, sal 10 000 megawatt kapasiteit tot die nasionale netwerk toevoeg.
eng: with regards to hydro power, the grand inga hydro-electrical project partnership with the democratic republic of congo will generate over 48 000 megawatts of clean hydro-electricity.

afr: dit is ’n plesier om vandag die wenner van die 2014 landbou top vroulike entrepreneur-toekenning, me nokwanele mzamo, van kirkwood in die oos-kaap, in ons midde te hê.
eng: a total of r2.1 billion has been ring-fenced for this purpose with r290 million approved for informal settlement upgrading in mpumalanga, north west, gauteng, northern cape, limpopo and the free state.

afr: wat belangrik is, is dat die regering, die mynbousektor en die bankvereniging van suid-afrika 'n sosiale kontrak vir die ontwikkeling van volhoubare menslike nedersettings geteken het.
eng: the agency has also partnered with the industrial development corporation (idc) and the small enterprise finance agency in a three-way partnership that has resulted in a r2,7 billion rand fund for young people.

afr: die departement van arbeid sal die sektorale vasstellings van landbou, bosbou, private sekuriteit, asook die groot- en kleinhandelsektore hersien.
eng: major projects include umzimvubu water project in the eastern cape, jozini dam in umkhanyakude in kwazulu-natal and projects in bushbuckridge in mpumalanga and phase one of the mokolo crocodile water augmentation in limpopo.

afr: ons verwag dat die wet op werkverskaffingsdienste van 2014, wat formeel 'n openbare werkverskaffingsdiens vestig, gefinaliseer sal word.. die wetgewing reguleer ook formeel die praktyke van private werkverskaffingsburo’s en tydelike werkverskaffingsdienste om die misbruik van niksvermoedende werksoekers te voorkom.
eng: progress is being made to improve the water supply to areas that had been affected by shortages, such as makana district municipality in the eastern cape, ngaka modiri molema district municipality in north west and giyani in limpopo where we celebrated the delivery of water to 55 villages in october last year.

afr: die nasionale jeugontwikkelingsagentskap het in die vorige finansiële jaar r25 miljoen aan 765 mikro-ondernemings wat in jongmense se besit is, landwyd uitbetaal.
eng: the department of transport will spend about r9 billion on the provincial roads maintenance grant or the sihamba sonke programme and r11 billion on upgrading and maintaining roads which are not tolled.

afr: die agentskap het ook 'n vennootskap gesluit met die nywerheidsontwikkelingskorporasie en die finansiële agentskap vir klein ondernemings in 'n drieledige vennootskap wat tot 'n fonds van r2,7 miljard vir jong mense gelei het.
eng: over r6 billion will be spent in 13 cities on planning, building and operating integrated public transport networks during this financial year.

afr: groot projekte sluit in die umzimvubu-waterprojek in die oos-kaap en jozini-dam in umkhanyakude in kwazulu-natal, asook projekte in bosbokrand in mpumalanga en fase een van die mokolo krokodil-waterversterkingsprojek in limpopo.
eng: work is also continuing to establish the three brand new universities, sol plaatjie in the northern cape, the university of mpumalanga and the sefako makgatho allied and health sciences university.

afr: die departement van vervoer sal sowat r9 miljard aan die onderhoudstoelae vir provinsiale paaie of die sihamba sonke-program bestee en r11 miljard aan die opgradering en instandhouding van paaie wat nie aan tolgeld onderhewig is nie.
eng: we have committed r9.2 billion investment in gas and oil exploration in the port of saldanha as part of the operation phakisa initiative.

afr: meer as r6 miljard sal in hierdie finansiële jaar in 13 stede bestee word om geïntegreerde openbare vervoernetwerke te beplan, te bou en te bedryf.
eng: operation phakisa on scaling up the ideal clinic initiative is aimed at promoting efficiency, effectiveness and professionalism in clinics.

afr: werk gaan ook voort om die drie splinternuwe universiteite, sol plaatjie in die noord-kaap, die universiteit van mpumalanga en die sefako makgatho gesondheids- en verwante wetenskappe universiteit, te vestig.
eng: in fighting the scourge of hiv and aids, the state-owned pharmaceutical company, ketlaphela, has been established and will participate in the supply of anti-retrovirals to the department of health.

afr: ons gaan vanjaar 'n massiewe program van stapel stuur om tuberkulose (tb) hok te slaan, wat veral op drie groepe sal fokus, naamlik oortreders in korrektiewe dienste-fasiliteite, mynwerkers, en gemeenskappe in myndorpe.
eng: the interventions include continuous joint operations with key neighbouring countries, improved intelligence gathering as well as enhancing protection in parks and provincial reserves where rhino are present.

afr: as deel van die stryd teen miv en vigs, is die staatsbeheerde farmaseutiese maatskappy, ketlaphela, gestig wat sal help om anti-retrovirale middels aan die departement van gesondheid te verskaf.
eng: government has also made substantial progress in establishing a border management agency, to manage all ports of entry and improve security.

afr: mevrou die speaker en mevrou die voorsitter,ons moet steeds harder saamwerk om misdaad te beveg en veiliger gemeenskappe te verseker.
eng: madam speaker and madam chairperson,building a caring, effective and responsive state will continue to be prioritised.

afr: adjunkspeaker van die nasionale vergadering en adjunkvoorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies (nrp),adjunk-president cyril ramaphosa,voormalige president thabo mbeki,hoofregter mogoeng mogoeng en al die gewaardeerde lede van die regbank,die president van die pan-afrikaanse parlement, mnr roger nkodo dang,ministers en adjunkministers,premiers en speakers van provinsiale wetgewersvoorsitter van salga en alle uitvoerende burgemeesters teenwoordig,die hoofde van hoofstuk 9-instellings,voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers,leiers van geloofsgebaseerde organisasies,die voormalige speaker van die nasionale vergadering, dr frene ginwala,genooide gaste,veterane van die vryheidstryd,lede van die diplomatieke korps,mede-suid-afrikaners,goeienaand, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, good evening, lotjhani, riperile, ndimadekwana,dankie vir die geleentheid om die parlement en die land toe te spreek.
eng: the speaker of the national assembly (na),the chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop),deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president cyril ramaphosa,former president thabo mbeki,chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,the president of the pan african parliament, mr roger nkodo dang,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of the south african local government association and all executive mayors present,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,leaders of faith-based organisations,the former speaker of the na, dr frene ginwala,invited guests,veterans of the struggle for liberation,members of the diplomatic corps,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeienaand, lotjhani, ri perile, ndi madekwana.

afr: vandag is die 26ste herdenking van president nelson mandela se vrylating uit die gevangenis.
eng: today marks the 26th anniversary of the release of president nelson mandela from prison, which was one of the most remarkable episodes in the history of our country.

afr: dit is ook die 50ste herdenking van die nasionale party-regering se verklaring van distrik ses tot 'n gebied waar slegs witmense mag woon, wat tot die gedwonge verskuiwing van meer as 60 000 inwoners gelei het.
eng: it is also the 50th anniversary of the declaration by the national party regime that district six would be a whites only area, leading to the forced removals of more than 60 000 residents.

afr: die jaar 2016 is ook die 20ste herdenking van die grondwet van die republiek, wat op 10 desember 1996 in sharpeville deur madiba as wet onderteken is.
eng: the year 2016 also marks the 20th anniversary of the signing into law by madiba, of the constitution of the republic.

afr: ons is trots op ons demokrasie en wat ons in 'n kort tydjie bereik het.
eng: the signing took place in sharpeville on 10 december 1996. we are proud of our democracy and what we have achieved in a short space of time.

afr: ons demokrasie is funksioneel, solied en stabiel.
eng: our democracy is functional, solid and stable.

afr: landgenote,die grondwet, met die vryheidsmanifes as grondslag, verkondig dat suid-afrika aan almal wat daarin woon behoort.
eng: compatriots, the constitution, which has its foundation in the freedom charter, proclaims that south africa belongs to all who live in it.

afr: heelwat is gedoen om insluiting en 'n nie-rassige samelewing te bevorder.
eng: a lot has been done to promote inclusion and a non-racial society.

afr: maar die reis na 'n nie-rassige samelewing is nog nie voltooi is.
eng: however, the journey to a non-racial society has not yet been completed.

afr: die nasie is verlede maand geruk toe die euwel van rassisme op sosiale en elektroniese media sy kop uitgesteek het en ongekende pyn en woede veroorsaak het.
eng: the nation was shaken last month when racism reared its ugly head on social and electronic media, causing untold pain and anger.

afr: daar is 'n behoefte om die demoon van rassisme te konfronteer.
eng: there is a need to confront the demon of racism.

afr: menseregtedag op 21 maart sal vanjaar as die nasionale dag teen rassisme gevier word.
eng: human rights day, 21 march, will be commemorated as the national day against racism this year.

afr: dit sal gebruik word om die grondslag van 'n langtermynprogram vir die bou van 'n nie-rassige samelewing te lê.
eng: it will be used to lay the foundation for a long-term programme of building a non-racial society.

afr: landgenote, ek wil julle herinner aan 'n paar ander belangrike herdenkings.
eng: compatriots, i would like to remind you of a few other important anniversaries.

afr: die jaar 2016 herdenk ook 60 jaar sedert die vroue-optog na die uniegebou om te eis dat die paswette opgehef word.
eng: the year 2016 marks 60 years since the women’s march to the union buildings to demand an end to pass laws.

afr: ons is verheug dat me sophie de bruyn, wat onder die heldhaftige leiers van daardie historiese optog was, vandag in ons midde kan wees.
eng: we are happy to have in our midst ms sophie de bruyn, who was among the heroic leaders of that historic march.

afr: ons gee ook erekenning aan die voormalige president van die black sash, mev mary burton en aan die organisasie se rekord in die stryd vir menseregte, geregtigheid en gelykheid.
eng: we also acknowledge the former president of the black sash, ms mary burton.

afr: vanjaar herdenk ons ook 40 jaar sedert die bekende studente-opstand in soweto op 16 junie.
eng: this year also marks 40 years since the landmark 16 june student uprising in soweto.

afr: ons verwelkom die fotograaf, mnr sam nzima, wat die beroemde foto van hector pieterson geneem het, wat deur mbuyisa makhubu gedra word met sy suster antoinette langs hom.
eng: we welcome the photographer who shot the famous photograph of hector pieterson carried by mbuyisa makhubu with his sister antoinette, mr sam nzima.

afr: ons gee ook erkenning aan die klas van 1976 vir hul dapperheid in die opstand ​​teen die wrede apartheidsregering.
eng: we also salute the class of 1976 for their bravery in standing up against the brutal apartheid regime.

afr: ons erken die teenwoordigheid van een van die aktiviste van daardie era, die adjunk-sekretaris van die parlement, me baby tyawa, in ons midde.
eng: we acknowledge one of the activists of that era, the deputy secretary of parliament, ms baby tyawa, who is in our midst.

afr: vanjaar herdenk ons ook 30 jaar sedert die hinderlaag en wrede moord op die gugulethu sewe deur die apartheidspolisie in maart 1986. die universiteit van fort hare vier sy eeufees, wat 'n deurslaggewende mylpaal in die bevrydingsgeskiedenis van nie net ons land nie, maar die vasteland is.
eng: this year we also mark 30 years since the ambush and brutal killing of the gugulethu seven by the apartheid police in march 1986. the university of fort hare celebrates its centenary, which is a critical milestone in the liberation history of not only our country but the continent.

afr: die nasionale vieringe vind op 20 mei plaas.
eng: the national celebrations will take place on 20 may.

afr: ek gee graag erkenning aan die leier van die ivp, prins mangosuthu buthelezi, wat 'n oudstudent van die universiteit is.
eng: let me recognise umntwana wakwaphindangene, the leader of the inkatha freedom party who is a former student of the university.

afr: die jaar 2016 is ook die eeufees van die slag van deville wood in frankryk tydens die eerste wêreldoorlog.
eng: the year 2016 also marks the centenary of the battle of delville wood in france, which took place during the first world war.

afr: tientalle swart soldate het in dié oorlog geveg, maar is sleg behandel weens hul velkleur.
eng: scores of black soldiers fought in the war but were treated badly due to the colour of their skin.

afr: 'n gedenkteken wat hul menswaardigheid sal herstel, word in julie vanjaar in frankryk onthul.
eng: a memorial that will restore their dignity and humanity is scheduled to be unveiled in july this year in france.

afr: mevrou die speaker en mevrou die voorsitter,'n sterk en vinnig groeiende ekonomie is die middelpunt van ons radikale ekonomiese transformasie-agenda en ons nasionale ontwikkelingsplan (ndp).
eng: compatriots, allow me as well to recognise three special guests who are also with us today:madam speaker and madam chairperson,a resilient and fast growing economy is at the heart of our radical economic transformation agenda and our national development plan (ndp).

afr: wanneer die ekonomie vinnig groei, word werkgeleenthede geskep.
eng: when the economy grows fast it delivers jobs.

afr: werkers verdien lone en besighede wins maak wins.
eng: workers earn wages and businesses make profits.

afr: die belastingbasis brei uit en stel die regering in staat om die maatskaplike loon te verhoog en om onderwys, gesondheid, maatskaplike toelaes, behuising en gratis basiese dienste te verbeter - vinniger en op 'n meer volhoubare manier.
eng: the tax base expands and allows government to increase the social wage and provide education, health, social grants, housing and free basic services ¬– faster and in a more sustainable manner.

afr: ons ekonomie het sedert die finansiële krisis in 2008 verskeie uitdagings in die gesig gestaar.
eng: our economy has been facing difficulties since the financial crisis in 2008. we embarked on an aggressive infrastructure development programme to stimulate growth.

afr: ons realiteit is tans dat wêredlwye groei steeds gedemp is.
eng: our reality right now is that global growth still remains muted.

afr: finansiële markte het wisselvallig geword.
eng: financial markets have become volatile.

afr: geldeenhede van ontluikende markte het verswak en fluktueer baie.
eng: currencies of emerging markets have become weak and they fluctuate widely.

afr: die pryse van goud, platinum, steenkool en ander minerale wat ons aan die res van die wêreld verkoop, het aansienlik gedaal en bly steeds laag.
eng: the prices of gold, platinum, coal and other minerals that we sell to the rest of the world have dropped significantly and continue to be low.

afr: die ekonomieë van twee van ons brics-vennote, naamlik brasilië en rusland, sal na verwagting vanjaar krimp.
eng: the economies of two of our partners in brics, brazil and russia, are expected to contract this year.

afr: die derde, china, sal nie die sterk groei waarvoor dit bekend is, toon nie.
eng: the third, china, will not register the kind of robust growth that it is known for.

afr: omdat ons ekonomie betreklik klein en oop is, word dit deur al hierdie verwikkelings geraak.
eng: because our economy is relatively small and open, it is affected by all of these developments.

afr: ons ekonomie word ook beïnvloed deur plaaslike faktore soos die elektrisiteitsbeperkings en nywerheidsverhoudinge wat soms onstabiel is.
eng: our economy is also affected by domestic factors such as the electricity constraints and industrial relations which are sometimes unstable.

afr: die imf en die wêreldbank voorspel dat die suid-afrikaanse ekonomie vanjaar met minder as een persent sal groei.
eng: the international monetary fund and the world bank predict that the south african economy will grow by less than 1% this year.

afr: die laer ekonomiese groei-uitkomste en-vooruitsigte dui daarop dat die invordering van belasting laer is as wat voorheen verwag is.
eng: the lower economic growth outcomes and outlook suggest that revenue collection will be lower than previously expected.

afr: wat kommerwekkend is, is dat dit lyk of ons ​​land die risiko loop om sy beleggingstatus van graderingsagentskappe te verloor.
eng: importantly, our country seems to be at risk of losing its investment grade status from ratings agencies.

afr: as dit gebeur, sal dit duurder word vir die land om geld van die buiteland te leen om ons programme te finansier vir die bou van 'n beter lewe vir almal, veral die armes.
eng: if that happens, it will become more expensive for us to borrow money from abroad to finance our programmes of building a better life for all, especially the poor.

afr: die situasie vereis dat ons 'n doeltreffende regrukplan in werking moet stel.
eng: the situation requires an effective turnaround plan from us.

afr: dit beteken dat ons dinge anders moet doen en sal moet reageer op dinge waarop ons nie voorheen vinnig genoeg gereageer het nie.
eng: it is about doing things differently and also acting on what may not have been acted upon quickly before.

afr: ek noem 'n paar punte wat ons glo 'n verskil sal maak.
eng: i will share a few points that we believe would make a difference.

afr: eerstens, bly ons land steeds 'n aantreklike beleggingsbestemming.
eng: first, our country remains an attractive investment destination.

afr: ons staar uitdagings in die gesig, maar die positiewe eienskappe weeg veel swaarder as dié uitdagings.
eng: it may face challenges, but its positive attributes far outweigh those challenges.

afr: ons moet voortgaan om die land as 'n voorkeurbestemming vir beleggers te bemark.
eng: we must continue to market the country as a preferred destination for investments.

afr: dit vereis 'n gesamentlike poging van almal in die sake- en arbeidsektor, asook die regering.
eng: this requires a common narrative from all of us as business, labour and government.

afr: wanneer daar enige verskille of probleme tussen ons ontstaan, moet ons dit oplos voordat dit eskaleer.
eng: if there are any disagreements or problems between us, we should solve them before they escalate.

afr: dit is wat nodig is vir die algemene welsyn van ons land.
eng: this is necessary for the common good of our country.

afr: ons het hierdie week dinsdag, vrugbare vergaderings met besighede, insluitende ’n hoëvlakvergadering met uitvoerende hoofde, gehad.
eng: we have had fruitful meetings with business, including the high level meeting with chief executive officers on tuesday (9 february) this week.

afr: ons het kennis geneem van voorstelle deur die sakegemeenskap oor hoe ons die situasie kan omkeer en die ekonomie weer kan laat groei.
eng: we have heard the suggestions from the business community on how we can turn the situation around and put the economy back on a growth path.

afr: ons het kennis geneem van die noodsaaklikheid om die korrekte ondersteuningsinfrastruktuur vir beleggings te skep.
eng: we have heard the points about the need to create the correct investment support infrastructure.

afr: die regering ontwikkel tans die eenstop-belê-sa-inisiatief om die boodskap uit te stuur dat suid-afrika werklik oop is vir besigheid.
eng: government is developing a one stop shop/invest sa initiative to signal that south africa is truly open for business.

afr: ons sal die implementering van hierdie diens in vennootskap met die private sektor versnel.
eng: we will fast-track the implementation of this service, in partnership with the private sector.

afr: so 'n inisiatief vereis dat die regering die rompslomp verwyder en enige wetgewende en regulerende blokkasies hersien.
eng: such an initiative requires that government removes the red tape and reviews any legislative and regulatory blockages.

afr: ons het 'n inter-ministeriële komitee vir die bevordering van beleggings saamgestel om die sukses van die inisiatiewe vir beleggingsbevordering te verseker.
eng: we have established an inter-ministerial committee on investment promotion which will ensure the success of investment promotion initiatives.

afr: landgenote, ons het kennis geneem van mense se besorgdheid oor die prestasie van ondernemings en maatskappye in staatsbesit.
eng: compatriots, we have heard the concerns raised about the performance of state owned enterprises and companies.

afr: baie van hierdie maatskappye presteer goed.
eng: many of our state-owned companies (socs) are performing well.

afr: sanral het van die beste paaie in gauteng en in verskeie ander dele van die land gebou, waarvoor ons in baie dele van die wêreld beny word.
eng: the south african national roads agency limited has built some of the best roads in gauteng and in many parts of the country.

afr: die trans-caledon tonnelowerheid het damme met wisselende kapasateit gebou, wat toegang tot veilige drinkwater verseker.
eng: the trans caledon tunnel authority has constructed dams of varied capacities, thus making it possible for our people to have access to safe drinking water.

afr: transnet het spoorinfrastruktuur gebou wat ons land se myne in staat stel om massiewe hoeveelhede kommoditeite in grootmaat deur ons hawens na markte regoor die wêreld te vervoer.
eng: transnet has built rail infrastructure which has enabled our country’s mines to move massive bulk of commodities through our ports to markets around the globe.

afr: ondanks die uitdagings, slaag eskom steeds daarin slaag om die ekonomie aan die gang te hou, teen alle verwagtinge in.
eng: eskom, in spite of the challenges, still manages to keep the economy going, against all odds.

afr: ons ontwikkelingsfinansieringsinstellings soos die nywerheidsontwikkelingskorporasie (nok) of die ontwikkelingsbank van suider-afrika en ander, verskaf deurlopend finansiering vir infrastruktuur, verskeie nywerhede en landbou-ondernemings, selfs in die nadraai van die wêreldwye finansiële krisis.
eng: our development finance institutions such as the industrial development corporation or development bank of southern africa and others have provided finance for infrastructure, various industries and agricultural businesses without fail, even in the aftermath of the global financial crisis.

afr: vir die maatskappye in staatsbesit om tot die suksesvolle implementering van die ndp te kan bydra, moet hulle finansieel gesond wees.
eng: for the socs to contribute to the successful implementation of the ndp, they must be financially sound.

afr: hulle moet behoorlik beheer en bestuur word.
eng: they must be properly governed and managed.

afr: ons sal verseker dat die aanbevelings van die presidensiële hersieningskommissie op ondernemings in staatsbesit, wat 'n uiteensetting gee van hoe die instellings bestuur moet word, geïmplementeer word.
eng: we will ensure the implementation of the recommendations of the presidential review commission on state-owned enterprises, which outlines how the institutions should be managed.

afr: die adjunk-president is die voorsitter van die interministeriële komitee wat verantwoordelik is om te verseker dat hierdie aanbevelings geïmplementeer word.
eng: the deputy president chairs the inter-ministerial committee which is tasked with ensuring the implementation of these recommendations.

afr: ons moet die mandate van die maatskappye meer vaartbelyn maak en opskerp, en ons moet verseker dat waar daar oorvleueling in die mandate is onmiddellike rasionalisering plaasvind.
eng: we have to streamline and sharpen the mandates of the companies and ensure that where there are overlaps in the mandates, there is immediate rationalisation.

afr: die maatskappye wat nie meer van toepasing op ons ontwikkelingsagenda is nie, sal uitgefaseer word.
eng: those companies that are no longer relevant to our development agenda will be phased out.

afr: die staatsdepartemente aan wie hulle verantwoording doen sal die agenda uiteensit en die belangrikste projekte wat deur die staatsbeheerde maatskappye oor 'n bepaalde tydperk uitgevoer moet word, identifiseer.
eng: government departments to which they report, will set the agenda and identify key projects for the socs to implement, over a defined period.

afr: behoorlike monitering en evaluering sal gedoen word.
eng: proper monitoring and evaluation will be done.

afr: hierdie ingrypings is noodsaaklik vir groei, asook om die nasionale skuldvlakke te verminder.
eng: these interventions are essential for growth and also for the reduction of national debt levels.

afr: landgenote,ons moet gebruik maak van die wisselkoers, asook die onlangse veranderinge in die visumregulasies, om inkomende toerisme te bevorder.
eng: compatriots, we must take advantage of the exchange rate as well as the recent changes of visa regulations, to boost inbound tourism.

afr: sa toerisme sal r100 miljoen per jaar belê om binnelandse toerisme te bevorder en suid-afrikaners aan te moedig om hul eie land te verken.
eng: sa tourism will invest r100 million a year to promote domestic tourism, encouraging south africans to tour their country.

afr: ons het kennis geneem van maatskappye se kommer oor vertragings in die verkryging van visums vir opgeleide personeel uit die buiteland.
eng: we have heard concerns from companies about delays in obtaining visas for skilled personnel from abroad.

afr: hoewel ons verkies dat werkgewers voorkeur gee aan plaaslike werkers, moet ons migrasiebeleid dit ook moontlik maak om skaars vaardighede in te voer.
