eng: while we prefer that employers prioritise local workers, our migration policy must also make it possible to import scarce skills.

afr: die konsepmigrasiebeleid sal deur die loop van 2016 aan die kabinet voorgelê word.
eng: the draft migration policy will be presented to cabinet during the course of 2016. we have heard the appeals for policy certainty in the mining sector, especially with regards to the mineral and petroleum resources development bill.

afr: die wetsontwerp is verlede jaar na die parlement terugverwys.
eng: the bill was referred back to parliament last year.

afr: ons wag vir die parlement om die verwerking daarvan af te handel, wat na verwagting spoedig gedoen sal word.
eng: we await parliament to conclude the processing, which we trust will be done expeditiously.

afr: landgenote,ons moet klein, medium- en mikro-ondernemings (kmmo's) bemagtig om vinniger te kan groei.
eng: compatriots, we need to empower small, medium and micro enterprises (smmes) to accelerate their growth.

afr: toegang tot hoë-gehalte, innoverende sake-ondersteuning kan die suksessyfer van nuwe ondernemings dramaties verbeter.
eng: access to high-quality, innovative business support can dramatically improve the success rate of new ventures.

afr: die departement van kleinsake-ontwikkeling is gestig om sulke geteikende steun aan klein besigheid te voorsienekonomiese transformasie en swart bemagtiging bly 'n belangrike deel van al die regering se ekonomiese programme.
eng: the department of small business development was established to provide such targeted support to small business.

afr: een van ons nuwe ingrypings is die skema vir swart industrialiste wat van stapel gestuur is om die deelname van swart entrepreneurs in die vervaardigingsektor te bevorder.
eng: one of our new interventions is the black industrialists scheme, which has been launched to promote the participation of black entrepreneurs in manufacturing.

afr: ons doen 'n beroep 'n groot ondernemings om vennootskappe aan te gaan met die nuwe vervaardigers, insluitende besighede wat deur vroue en die jeug besit word, as deel van die uitbreiding van eienaarskap en beheer van die ekonomie.
eng: we urge big business to partner with new manufacturers including businesses owned by women and the youth, as part of broadening the ownership and control of the economy.

afr: landgenote,ons is trots op ons top 10-posisie met betrekking tot finansiële dienste in die wêreld ekonomiese forum se mededingendheidsverslag.
eng: compatriots, we are proud of our top 10 ranking in the world economic forum competitiveness report with respect to financial services.

afr: behoud en verbetering van ons posisie is belangrik vir die land se mededingendheid.
eng: maintaining and indeed improving our ranking is important to our competitiveness as a country.

afr: dit is ook deurslaggewend in ons strewe om 'n finansiële sentrum vir afrika geword.
eng: it is also fundamental to our ambition to become a financial centre for africa.

afr: die banke, deur die suid-afrikaanse vereniging van bankwese (banking association of south africa), gaan 'n projek van stapel stuur wat daarop gemik is om 'n sentrum van uitnemendheid vir finansiële dienste en leierskapopleiding te vestig.
eng: the banks, through the banking association of south africa, are to launch a project aimed at establishing a centre of excellence for financial services and leadership training.

afr: dit sal verseker dat ons die beste talent in finansiële dienste na ons land en ons vasteland kan lok, koester, ontwikkel en behou.
eng: this will ensure that as a country we can attract, nurture, develop and retain the best talent in financial services in our country and across our continent.

afr: hulle sal saam met die minister van finansies en die nasionale tesourie werk om dit te bewerkstellig.
eng: they will work with the minister of finance and national treasury to get this done.

afr: ons glo dat dit met verloop van tyd sal verseker dat ons die poel van finansiële vaardighede kan uitbrei en meer werkgeleenthede vir meer jong mense kan skep.
eng: we believe that this will over time ensure that we can expand the pool of financial skills and broaden the job opportunities for many young people.

afr: hierdie strategiese projek deur die banksektor is 'n positiewe en bemoedigende resultaat van ons gesprekvoering met die sakesektor die afgelope week.
eng: this strategic project from the banking sector is a positive and encouraging outcome of our engagement with business this week.

afr: saam beweeg ons suid-afrika vorentoe!
eng: together we move south africa forward!

afr: landgenote,ons het onderneem om openbare fondse oordeelkundig te bestee en om verkwistende uitgawes te besnoei, maar sonder om die regering se kernbesigheid en die verskaffing van dienste aan ons mense te kompromitteer.
eng: compatriots, we have made an undertaking to spend public funds wisely and to cut wasteful expenditure, but without compromising on the core business of government and the provision of services to our people.

afr: in 2013 het die minister van finansies verskeie besparingsmaatreëls aangekondig.
eng: in 2013, the minister of finance announced a number of cost-containment measures.

afr: oormatige en verkwistende uitgawes is verminder, maar daar sal nog meer gedoen moet word om vermorsing te besnoei.
eng: excessive and wasteful expenditure has been reduced, but there is still more to be done to cut wastage.

afr: ek wil graag vanaand 'n paar maatreëls aankondig.
eng: i would like to announce some measures this evening.

afr: oorsese reise sal ingekort word en diegene wat toestemming versoek, sal dit sterk moet motiveer en bewys kan lewer van die voordele wat dit vir die land inhou.
eng: overseas trips will be curtailed and those requesting permission will have to motivate strongly and prove the benefit to the country.

afr: die groottes van afvaardigings sal aansienlik verminder en gestandaardiseer word.
eng: the sizes of delegations will be greatly reduced and standardised.

afr: verdere beperkings op konferensies, spyseniering, vermaak en sosiale funksies sal ingestel word.
eng: further restrictions on conferences, catering, entertainment and social functions will be instituted.

afr: die dinees vir belanghebbendes wat deur staatsdepartemente in die parlement aangebied word ná lewering van begrotingsredes sal nie meer plaasvind nie.
eng: the budget vote dinners for stakeholders hosted by government departments in parliament, after the delivery of budget speeches will no longer take place.

afr: die minister van finansies sal tydens die begrotingsrede op 24 februarie meer maatreëls en verdere besonderhede in dié verband aankondig.
eng: the minister of finance will announce more measures and further details in the budget vote speech on 24 february.

afr: die uitvoerende bestuur en direksies van openbare agentskappe en maatskappye in staatsbesit moet soortgelyke maatreëls onderneem.
eng: the executive management and boards of public agencies and socs must undertake similar measures.

afr: ek nooi premiers van al nege provinsies, asook burgemeesters om by ons aan te sluit in die uitskakeling van verkwistende besteding deur die regering.
eng: i also invite premiers of all nine provinces as well as mayors to join us as we begin eliminating wasteful expenditure within government.

afr: ek vertrou dat die parlement en die regbank ook oortuig sal word om die implementering van soortgelyke maatreëls te oorweeg.
eng: i trust that parliament and the judiciary will also be persuaded to consider the implementation of similar measures.

afr: landgenote'n groot uitgawe, wat ons die parlement graag wil oortuig om te heroorweeg, is die instandhouding van twee hoofstede, pretoria as die administratiewe hoofstad en kaapstad as die wetgewende hoofstad.
eng: compatriots, a big expenditure item, that we would like to persuade parliament to consider, is the maintenance of two capitals, pretoria as the administrative one and cape town as the legislative capital.

afr: ons glo dat die parlement binekort aandag aan hierdie saak sal skenk.
eng: we believe that the matter requires the attention of parliament soon.

afr: landgenoteons het almal 'n belangrike bydrae om te lewer om die ekonomie reg te ruk en om vermorsing te besnoei.
eng: compatriots, we all have a lot to do to turn the economy around and to cut wastage.

afr: ons sal vir ‘n rukkie deur 'n moeilike tyd gaan, maar wanneer die ekonomie herstel, sal ons met reg trots kan wees dat ons die regte ding gedoen het.
eng: we will go through a difficult period for a while, but when the economy recovers, we will be proud of ourselves for having done the right thing.

afr: landgenote,ek wil nou graag terugvoer gee oor die ondernemings wat verlede jaar gemaak is.
eng: compatriots, i would now like to report back on the undertakings made last year.

afr: gedurende die staatsrede in februarie 2015, het ek die negepunt-plan aangekondig om op trae groei te reageer.
eng: during the state of the nation address in february 2015, i announced the nine-point plan to respond to sluggish growth.

afr: die negepunt-plan bestaan ​​uit:ons het beduidende vordering gemaak met die implementering van die plan.
eng: the nine-point plan consists of:a. revitalisation of the agriculture and agro-processing value-chain.

afr: die speaker van die nasionale vergadering,die voorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies (nrp),adjunkspeaker van die nasionale vergadering en adjunkvoorsitter van die ncop, adjunkpresident cyril ramaphosa,voormalige president thabo mbeki, hoofregter mogoeng mogoeng en al die gewaardeerde lede van die regbank,ministers en adjunkministers,premiers en speakers van provinsiale wetgewers, voorsitter van die suid-afrikaanse vereniging vir plaaslike regering, die hoofde van hoofstuk 9-instellings, voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers,die president van die moslem-regsraad en alle leiers van geloofsgebaseerde organisasies,die voormalige speaker van die nasionale vergadering, dr frene ginwala,veterane van die vryheidstryd,lede van die diplomatieke korps,mede-suid-afrikaners,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeie naand, lotjhani, ri perile, ndimadekwana,ek dank u, agbare speaker en agbare voorsitter, vir hierdie geleentheid om die gesamentlike sitting van die parlement toe te spreek.
eng: the speaker of the national assembly,the chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop),deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop, deputy president cyril ramaphosa,former president thabo mbeki, chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures, chairperson of the south african local government association, the heads of chapter 9 institutions, chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the president of the muslim judicial council and all leaders of faith-based organisations,the former speaker of the national assembly, dr frene ginwala,veterans of the struggle for liberation,members of the diplomatic corps,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeie naand, lotjhani, riperile, ndimadekwana,thank you madam speaker and madam chairperson for this opportunity to address the joint sitting of parliament.

afr: 'n uitstaande leier van ons land, president oliver reginald tambo, sou vanjaar 100 jaar oud geword het indien hy nog geleef het.
eng: an illustrious son of our country, president oliver reginald tambo, would have turned 100 years old this year, had he lived.

afr: hierdie onbaatsugtige patriot het sy volwasse lewe gewy aan 'n onvermoeide strewe vir die bevryding van ons land en sy mense.
eng: this selfless patriot dedicated.

afr: hy het 'n blywende nalatenskap vir alle suid-afrikaners gelaat, en nie net vir sy organisasie, die anc, nie.
eng: his adult life to a tireless pursuit of the liberation of our country and its people.

afr: tot sy eer het ons die jaar 2017 as die jaar van oliver reginald tambo verklaar.
eng: in his honour, we have declared the year 2017, the year of oliver reginald tambo.

afr: dit is die jaar van eenheid in aksie deur alle suid-afrikaners terwyl ons saamstaan om suid-afrika vorentoe te beweeg.
eng: it is the year of unity in action by all south africans as we move south africa forward, together.

afr: dit is ons voorreg om vanaand lede van die tambo-familie hier te verwelkom: mnr dali tambo en sy vrou rachel, en hul seun, oliver tambo junior.
eng: we have the pleasure to host members of the tambo family this evening, mr dali tambo and his wife rachel, and their son, oliver tambo junior.

afr: ons onthou ook met deernis mama africa, miriam makeba, wat geskiedenis gemaak het toe sy in 1963 die verenigde nasies toegespreek het en 'n beroep op hulle gedoen het om teen die destydse apartheidsregime op te tree.
eng: we also fondly remember mama africa, miriam makeba, who made history when she addressed the united nations in 1963, appealing for action against the apartheid regime.

afr: ons rig 'n hartlike woord van welkom aan haar kleindogter, zenzile makeba lee, en agterkleinseun, lindelani.
eng: we extend a warm welcome to her granddaughter, zenzile makeba lee, and great-grandson, lindelani.

afr: landgenote,in hierdie 23ste jaar van ons vryheid, bly ons missie steeds die strewe na 'n verenigde, demokratiese, nie-seksistiese, nie-rassige en welvarende suid-afrika.
eng: compatriots, in this 23rd year of our freedom, our mission remains the quest for a united, democratic, non-sexist, non-racial and prosperous south africa.

afr: ooreenkomstig die riglyne van die nasionale ontwikkelingsplan (nop), bou ons 'n suid-afrika wat vry moet wees van armoede, ongelykheid en werkloosheid.
eng: guided by the national development plan (ndp), we are building a south africa that must be free from poverty, inequality and unemployment.

afr: terwyl die internasionale ekonomie steeds onseker lyk, is daar aanduidings dat ons 'n hersteltydperk betree.
eng: while the global economic environment remains uncertain, indications are that we have entered a period of recovery.

afr: ons verwag 'n ekonomiese groeikoers van 1,3% in 2017, ná 'n beraamde 0,5% in 2016. die ekonomie groei egter steeds nie vinnig genoeg om die nodige werksgeleenthede te skep nie.
eng: we anticipate an economic growth rate of 1.3% in 2017 following an estimated 0.5% in 2016. however, the economy is still not growing fast enough to create the jobs that we need.

afr: sommige van ons mense, insluitend jeugdiges, het al jare lank nie werk nie.
eng: there are some of our people, including youth, who have not worked for years.

afr: dit is om hierdie rede dat ons besluit het om op 'n aantal sleutelareas wat as die negepuntplan verpak is, te fokus om groei aan te vuur, sodat die ekonomie die broodnodige werksgeleenthede kan skep.
eng: it is for this reason that we decided to focus on a few key areas packaged as the nine-point plan to reignite growth so that the economy can create the much-needed jobs.

afr: die uitslae in die trends in international mathematics and science study en die suider- en oos-afrika konsortium vir die monitering van onderwysgehalte dui daarop dat die prestasie van suid-afrikaanse leerders besig is om te verbeter.
eng: this has led to job creation in the northern cape and diversification of the economy through the creation of artisan and maintenance jobs, and the promotion of science as a career of choice.

afr: van al die deelnemende lande het suid-afrika die grootste verbetering getoon, naamlik 87 punte in wiskunde en 90 punte in wetenskap.
eng: on road infrastructure, sanral has started with the planning phase of the r4.5 billion project to upgrade the current moloto road.

afr: sedert suid-afrika met die ondersteuning van sy agt afrika-vennote die bod as gasheer van die square kilometre array-teleskoop (ska) gewen het, is aansienlike vordering gemaak met die bou van hierdie mega-wetenskapprojek, met die gepaardgaande voordele.
eng: sakha umgwaqo kanye nololiwe ku moloto road ukuze kuphephe izimpilo zabantu ngoba izingozi sezithathe imiphefumulo eminingi kuleyandawo.

afr: saam met sy voorganger, die meerkat-teleskoop, lewer die ska-projek steeds belangrike bydraes tot sosio-ekonomiese ontwikkeling in suid-afrika.
eng: (the moloto road and a railway line are currently under construction with the purpose of ensuring the safety of road users and also bring to an end, the accidents that claim many lives.

afr: die departement van wetenskap en tegnologie werk ten nouste saam met die bedryf om 'n tegnologie-lokaliseringstrategie te implementeer.
eng: )during 2016, south africa also signed a cooperation agreement with the people’s republic of china (prc) to build the moloto rail development corridor.

afr: hierdie samewerking het gelei tot werkskepping in die noord-kaap en diversifisering van die ekonomie deur werksgeleenthede te skep vir ambagsmanne en instandhoudingswerkers, asook die bevordering van wetenskap as 'n voorkeurloopbaan.
eng: the south african navy also participates in the operation phakisa project and is preparing to host the government garage concept for all state-owned vessels in simon’s town, including the maintenance and repair of government-owned vessels, through the newly established south african navy/armscor/denel partnership.

afr: die verslag meld verder dat blanke suid-afrikaners, veral mans, hoër vlakke van werwing, bevordering en opleidingsgeleenthede geniet vergeleke metaangewese groepe.
eng: this includes legislation, regulations, licensing, budget and procurement as well as broad-based black economic empowerment charters to influence the behaviour of the private sector and drive transformation.

afr: hierdie sektor in ons land word op ongeveer r7 triljoen beraam, en die gesubsidieerde sektor op r1,5 triljoen.
eng: the department will invest approximately r100 million this year on critical capital and maintenance programmes to modernise harbours.

afr: minder as 5% van die sektor word egter deur swart mense, en afrikane in die besonder, besit of bestuur.
eng: they will also continue generating revenue from letting state-owned harbours and coastline properties, which will benefit black-owned smmes.

afr: 'n konsepwetsontwerp op eiendomspraktisyns sal deur die departement van menslike nedersettings vir openbare kommentaar gepubliseer word met die oog op die daarstelling van 'n meer inklusiewe, verteenwoordigende sektor en radikale ekonomiese transformasie.
eng: government will also continue to pursue policies that seek to broaden the participation of black people and smmes, including those owned by women and the youth, in the information and communications technology sector.

afr: sleutelprioriteite vir vanjaar sluit onder meer in dat die regering ook aandag sal gee aan die toenemende vertragings en agterstande in die registrasie en uitreiking van titelaktes aan begunstigdes van behuisingsprojekte wat deur die kapitaalsubsidie befonds word.
eng: we assure the youth that the lowering of the cost of data is uppermost in our policies and plans.

afr: landgenote,ons herbeklemtoon dat radikale ekonomiese transformasie baie meer moet behels as blote skemas om aandele te besit.
eng: compatriots,mining has always been the backbone of our economy and an important foreign exchange earner.

afr: ons vertrou dat dit sonder verdere vertraging verwerk en vir finalisering teruggestuur sal word, sodat die knelpunte rakende onsekerheid wat deur die sakesektor geopper is uit die weg geruim kan word.
eng: we trust that parliament will be able to move with speed in meeting the requirements so that the law can be finalised to effect transformation.

afr: die regering gaan voort om met ander belanghebbers saam te werk om onwettige mynbouaktiwiteite teen te werk ten einde lewens te red en die onwettige handel in edelmetale en diamante te voorkom.
eng: the reopening of land claims is also still on hold because the restitution of land rights amendment act, 2014 (act 15 of 2014) was declared invalid by the constitutional court.

afr: daarbenewens het die nywerheidsontwikkelingskorporasie en die landbank ongeveer r500 miljoen aan droogtegeteisterde boere beskikbaar gestel om hulle te help om hul kredietfasiliteite te bestuur en hulle met sagte lenings te ondersteun.
eng: government has provided funds to ensure that no student whose combined family income is up to r600 000 per annum will face fee increases at universities and technical vocational education and training (tvet) colleges for 2017. all students who qualify for nsfas and whom have been accepted by universities and tvet colleges, will be funded.

afr: alle studente wat vir nsfas kwalifiseer en wat deur universiteite en tvet-kolleges aanvaar is, sal befonds word.
eng: as the processes that we have set in motion draw to a close, such as the heher commission, the ministerial task team, broader engagements with students, university and tvet leadership and civil society, we will find resources to give expression to our policies.

afr: agbare lede en mede-suid-afrikaners, studente en hul ouers moet verstaan dat die behoefte aan dienste soos water, sanitasie, vroeë kinderontwikkeling en goeie openbare vervoer, saam met toegang tot gehalte hoër onderwys en opleiding, ook aandag moet geniet.
eng: other measures to fight crime nationally will include the establishment of specialised units, focusing on drug-related crime, taxi violence and firearms and the enhanced utilisation of investigative aids such as forensic leads.

afr: speaker van die nasionale vergadering (na), me baleka mbete,voorsitter van die nasionale raad van provinsies (nrp), me thandi modise,adjunkpresident van die na en adjunkvoorsitter van die nrp,voormalige president thabo mbeki,voormalige adjunkpresident fw de klerk,hoofregter mogoeng mogoeng en alle gewaardeerde lede van die regbank,ministers en adjunkministers,premiers en speakers van provinsiale wetgewers,voorsitter van die suid-afrikaanse plaaslike regeringsvereniging en alle uitvoerende burgemeesters teenwoordig,die hoofde van hoofstuk 9-instellings,voorsitter van die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers,leiers van geloofsgebaseerde organisasies,voormalige speaker dr frene ginwala,voormalige speaker mnr max sisulu,genooide gaste,veterane van die bevrydingstryd,lede van die diplomatieke korps,geagte raadslede,mede-suid-afrikaners.
eng: speaker of the national assembly (na), ms baleka mbete,chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop), ms thandi modise,deputy speaker of the na and deputy chairperson of the ncop,former president thabo mbeki,former deputy president fw de klerk,chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of south african local government association and all executive mayors present,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,leaders of faith-based organisations,former speaker dr frene ginwala,former speaker mr max sisulu,invited guests,veterans of the struggle for liberation,members of the diplomatic corps,honourable members,fellow south africans.

afr: die geleentheid om hierdie staatsrede te lewer is vir my 'n groot eer en 'n voorreg.
eng: it is for me a great honour and privilege to have the opportunity to deliver this state of the nation address (sona).

afr: hierdie staatsrede moes verlede week gelewer word, maar was vertraag sodat ons die politieke oorgang behoorlik en met omsigtigheid kon bestuur.
eng: this address should have been delivered last week, but was delayed so that we could properly and carefully manage issues of political transition.

afr: ek wil graag alle agbare raadslede en die mense van suid-afrika bedank vir hul geduld en verdraagsaamheid.
eng: i wish to thank honourable members and the people of south africa for their patience and forbearance.

afr: ek wil ook graag oudpresident jacob zuma bedank vir die manier waarop hy hierdie moeilike en sensitiewe proses benader het.
eng: i also wish to extend a word of gratitude to former president jacob zuma for the manner in which he approached this difficult and sensitive process.

afr: ek wil hom bedank vir sy diens aan die nasie tydens sy twee termyne as president van die republiek, waartydens die land aansienlike vordering gemaak het op verskeie gebiede van ontwikkeling.
eng: i wish to thank him for his service to the nation during his two terms as president of the republic, during which the country made significant progress in several areas of development.

afr: ek het gister met president zuma gepraat en hy het ons alles van die beste toegewens vir die staatsrede.
eng: i have spoken to president zuma yesterday and he wished us well for the holding of this sona.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,oor net meer as 150 dae van nou af sal mense regoor die wêreld verenig om die 100ste herdenking van die geboorte van nelson rolihlahla mandela te vier.
eng: fellow south africans,in just over 150 days from now, the peoples of the world will unite in celebrating the 100th anniversary of the birth of nelson rolihlahla mandela.

afr: dit is 'n dag waarop ons, as suid-afrikaners, die lewe van een van die merkwaardigste leiers wat hierdie land en hierdie vasteland - en inderdaad die wêreld – geken het, sal onthou.
eng: it is a day on which we, as south africans, will remember the life of one of the most remarkable leaders this country and this continent – and indeed, the world – has known.

afr: ons sal die geleentheid kry om madiba se lang reis na vryheid, sy wysheid, sy onfeilbare nederigheid, sy blywende deernis en sy wesenlike integriteit in herinnering te roep.
eng: we will have an opportunity to recount madiba’s long walk to freedom, his wisdom, his unfailing humility, his abiding compassion and his essential integrity.

afr: ons dra die jaar 2018 aan sy nagedagtenis op en ons sal al ons dade, al ons pogings en al ons uitsprake aan die verwesenliking van sy visie van 'n demokratiese, regverdige en gelyke samelewing toewy.
eng: we have dedicated this year 2018 to his memory and we will devote our every action, every effort, and every utterance to the realisation of his vision of a democratic, just and equitable society.

afr: gelei deur sy voorbeeld, sal ons hierdie jaar gebruik om ons verbintenis tot etiese gedrag en etiese leierskap te versterk.
eng: guided by his example, we will use this year to reinforce our commitment to ethical behaviour and ethical leadership.

afr: ter viering van nelson mandela se eeufees onthou ons nie net die verlede nie, maar bou ons die toekoms en veral die toekoms wat mandela in die vooruitsig gestel het.
eng: in celebrating the centenary of nelson mandela we are not merely honouring the past, we are building the future and particularly the future that mandela envisaged.

afr: as ’n voortsetting van die lang reis wat hy begin het, bou ons ’n gemeenskap waarin almal vry kan wees, waarin almal gelyk is voor die reg en waarin almal kan deel in die rykdom van ons land en ’n beter lewe kan ly.
eng: we are continuing the long walk he began, to build a society in which all may be free, in which all may be equal before the law and in which all may share in the wealth of our land and have a better life.

afr: ons bou ’n land waarin ’n persoon se vooruitsigte bepaal word deur sy eie inisiatief en harde werk, en nie deur sy velkleur, geboorteplek, geslag, taal of sy ouers se inkomste nie.
eng: we are building a country where a person’s prospects are determined by their own initiative and hard work, and not by the colour of their skin, place of birth, gender, language or income of their parents.

afr: vanjaar vier ons ook die eeufees van ’n ander groot gees van ons vryheidstryd, naamlik albertina nontsikelelo sisulu.
eng: this year, we also celebrate the centenary of another giant of our struggle, albertina nontsikelelo sisulu.

afr: deur haar merkwaardige lewe en uitstaande bydrae het sy gedefinieer wat dit beteken om 'n vryheidsvegter, 'n leier en 'n ywerige en gedissiplineerde dienaar van die volk te wees.
eng: through her remarkable life and outstanding contribution, she defined what it means to be a freedom fighter, a leader and a diligent and disciplined servant of the people.

afr: deur haar leierskap het sy die fundamentele verband tussen nasionale bevryding en geslagsemansipasie vergestalt.
eng: through her leadership, she embodied the fundamental link between national liberation and gender emancipation.

afr: terwyl ons haar eeufees vier, herbevestig ons dat geen bevryding volkome kan wees en geen nasie vry kan wees nie, tensy sy vroue vry is nie.
eng: as we mark her centenary, we reaffirm that no liberation can be complete and no nation can be free until its women are free.

afr: ons eer hierdie seun van afrika, nelson rolihlahla mandela en hierdie dogter van afrika, albertina sisulu, in 'n jaar van verandering, in 'n jaar van hernuwing, in 'n jaar van hoop.
eng: we honour this son, nelson rolihlahla mandela and this daughter of the african soil, albertina sisulu, in a year of change, in a year of renewal, in a year of hope.

afr: ons eer hulle nie net met woorde nie, maar meer belangrik, eer ons hulle met daadwerklike optrede om hul gedeelde visie van 'n beter samelewing te verwesenlik.
eng: we honour them not only in word, but, more importantly, in direct action towards the achievement of their shared vision of a better society.

afr: ons moet madiba eerbiedig deur die era van onenigheid, verdeeldheid en ontnugtering agter ons te laat.
eng: we should honour madiba by putting behind us the era of discord, disunity and disillusionment.

afr: ons moet die era van kwynende vertroue in openbare instellings en verswakte vertroue in ons land se leiers agterlaat.
eng: we should put behind us the era of diminishing trust in public institutions and weakened confidence in our country’s leaders.

afr: ons moet al die negatiwiteit wat ons land geteister het agterlaat, want 'n nuwe dag breek aan en 'n wonderlike dag is met ons.
eng: we should put all the negativity that has dogged our country behind us because a new dawn is upon us and a wonderful dawn has arrived.

afr: dit is 'n nuwe dagbreek wat geïnspireer word deur ons gesamentlike herinneringe aan nelson mandela en die veranderinge wat besig is om te ontvou.
eng: it is a new dawn that is inspired by our collective memory of nelson mandela and the changes that are unfolding.

afr: terwyl ons ons gedagtes van alle negatiwiteit vry maak, moet ons ons oortuiging dat suid-afrika aan almal wat daarin woon behoort, herbevestig.
eng: as we rid our minds of all negativity, we should reaffirm our belief that south africa belongs to all who live in it.

afr: want hoewel ons verskillende mense is, is ons een nasie.
eng: for though we are a diverse people, we are one nation.

afr: daar is 57 miljoen van ons, elk met ‘n ander geskiedenis, taal en kultuur, sowel as verskillende ervarings, sienings en belange.
eng: there are 57 million of us, each with different histories, languages, cultures, experiences, views and interests.

afr: tog word ons verbind deur die gemeenskaplike lot dat ons almal suid-afrikaners is.
eng: yet we are bound together by a common destiny that we are south africans.

afr: hiervoor is ons dank verskuldig aan ons voorvaders – mense soos pixley ka seme, charlotte maxeke en hoofman albert luthuli – wat die noodsaaklikheid van eenheid en harmonie tussen al die mense van hierdie wonderlike land verstaan het.
eng: for this, we owe much to our forebearers – people like pixley ka seme, charlotte maxeke and chief albert luthuli – who understood the necessity of the unity and harmony of all the people of this great land.

afr: ons is een nasie.
eng: we are a nation at one.

afr: ons is een volk, ons is daartoe verbind om saam te werk in pogings om werk te skep vir ons jeug.
eng: we are one people, committed to work together to find jobs for our youth.

afr: om fabrieke en paaie, huise en klinieke te bou.
eng: to build factories and roads, houses, and clinics.

afr: om ons kinders voor te berei vir 'n wêreld van verandering en vooruitgang.
eng: to prepare our children for a world of change and progress.

afr: om stede en dorpe te bou waar gesinne veilig, produktief en tevrede kan wees.
eng: to build cities and towns where families may be safe, productive, and content.

afr: ons is vasbeslote om 'n samelewing te skep wat gedefinieer word deur ordentlikheid en integriteit, wat nie die plundering van openbare hulpbronne verdra nie, en ook nie die diefstal van gewone mense se swaarverdiende spaargeld deur korporatiewe misdadigers nie.
eng: we are determined to build a society defined by decency and integrity that does not tolerate the plunder of public resources, nor the theft by corporate criminals of the hard-earned savings of ordinary people.

afr: hoewel daar baie kwessies is waaroor ons kan verskil, stem ons saam oor hierdie fundamentele sake.
eng: while there are many issues on which we may differ, on these fundamental matters, we are at one.

afr: ons weet dat daar nog baie dinge is wat ons verdeel.
eng: we know that there is still a lot that divides us.

afr: ons is steeds 'n hoogs ongelyke samelewing, waarin armoede en welvaart steeds deur ras en geslag gedefinieer word.
eng: we remain a highly unequal society, in which poverty and prosperity are still defined by race and gender.

afr: as suid-afrikaners het ons almal die verantwoordelikheid om 'n nuwe nasie te bou, om die ongeregtighede van die verlede en die ongelykhede van die hede te konfronteer.
eng: we have been given the responsibility as south africans to build a new nation, to confront the injustices of the past and the inequalities of the present.

afr: ons word genoop om dit onder moeilike omstandighede te doen.
eng: we are called upon to do so under difficult conditions.

afr: die stand van ons nasie is dat, hoewel armoede aansienlik gedaal het ná die demokratiese deurbraak van 1994, het ons die afgelope jare agteruitgang ervaar.
eng: the state we are in as a nation is that while poverty declined significantly following the democratic breakthrough of 1994, we have seen reverses in recent years.

afr: armoedevlakke het in 2015 gestyg, werkloosheid het gestyg en ongelykheid het bly voortbestaan.
eng: poverty levels rose in 2015, unemployment has gone up and inequality has persisted.

afr: ons ekonomie het al jare lank nie teen ’n tempo gegroei om genoeg werk te skep sodat ons ons mense uit armoede kan ophef nie.
eng: for several years, our economy has not grown at the pace needed to create enough jobs so that we can lift our people out of poverty.

afr: openbare finansies is beperk en dit het die regering se vermoë om sy belegging in ekonomiese en sosiale ontwikkeling uit te brei beperk.
eng: public finances have been constrained, limiting the ability of government to expand its investment in economic and social development.

afr: ondanks hierdie uitdagende omstandighede het ons, deur saam te werk, daarin geslaag om vordering te maak met pogings om ons mense se lewens te verbeter.
eng: despite these challenging conditions, we have managed – working together – to achieve progress in improving the lives of our people.

afr: selfs onder toestande van swak groei, het ons ekonomie werk geskep, maar nie teen die tempo wat nodig is om nuwe toetreders tot die arbeidsmark te absorbeer nie.
eng: even under conditions of weak growth, our economy has created jobs, but not at the pace required to absorb new entrants into the labour market.

afr: dit beteken dat terwyl ons hoër vlakke van ekonomiese groei en belegging nastreef, moet ons ook bykomende maatreëls tref om armoede te verminder en aan die behoeftes van werkloses in ons land te voldoen.
eng: this means that as we pursue higher levels of economic growth and investment, we need to take additional measures to reduce poverty and meet the needs of the unemployed in our country.

afr: sedert die begin van die huidige parlement het ons openbare werkprogramme meer as 3,2 miljoen werksgeleenthede geskep.
eng: since the start of the current parliament, our public employment programmes have created more than 3,2 million work opportunities.

afr: in die konteks van wydverspreide werkloosheid bly hierdie geleenthede steeds broodnodige inkomste, werkervaring en opleiding.
eng: in the context of widespread unemployment, these opportunities continue to provide much needed income, work experience and training.

afr: ons het maatreëls getref om die lewenskoste vir ons mense te verminder, veral vir die armes.
eng: we have taken measures to reduce the cost of living for our people, especially for the poor.

afr: die lewenskoste het aanhou styg.
eng: the cost of living has kept on rising.

afr: die regering se gratis basiese diensteprogram ondersteun tans meer as 3,5 miljoen behoeftige huishoudings.
eng: government’s free basic services programme currently supports more than 3,5 million indigent households.

afr: meer as 17 miljoen maatskaplike toelaes word maandeliks betaal, wat byna 'n derde van die bevolking bevoordeel.
eng: more than 17 million social grants are paid each month, benefiting nearly a third of the population.

afr: hierdie maatskaplike toelaes het die lewens van ons mense verhef en word deur hulle waardeer.
eng: these social grants have elevated the lives of our people and are valued by our people.

afr: ons weet egter dat as ons die siklus van armoede wil breek, moet ons die kinders van die armes onderrig.
eng: we know, however, that if we are to break the cycle of poverty, we need to educate the children of the poor.

afr: ons het daarop aangedring dat onderrig reeds in die vroeë kinderjare moet begin.
eng: we have insisted that this should start in early childhood.

afr: vandag het ons byna 'n miljoen kinders in vroeë kinderontwikkelingsfasiliteite.
eng: today we have nearly a million children in early childhood development facilities.

afr: daar is verbeteringe in die uitkomste van ons basiese onderwysstelsel.
eng: we are seeing improvements in the outcomes of our basic education system.

afr: die matriekslaagsyfer het van 60,6% in 2009, gestyg tot 75,1% verlede jaar.
eng: the matric pass rate increased from 60,6% in 2009 to 75,1% last year.

afr: daar is tans amper 'n miljoen studente wat by hoëronderwysinstansies ingeskryf is vergeleke met net meer as 500 000 in 1994. dit verteenwoordig vordering.
eng: there are currently almost a million students enrolled in higher education, up from just over 500 000 in 1994. that represents progress.

afr: namate ons 'n nuwe era betree, is ons vasbeslote om op hierdie prestasies voort te bou, die uitdagings wat ons in die gesig staar te konfronteer, en vooruitgang te versnel om 'n meer welvarende en regverdige samelewing te bou.
eng: as we enter a new era, we are determined to build on these achievements, confront the challenges we face and accelerate progress in building a more prosperous and equitable society.

afr: ons het 'n matige herstel in ons ekonomie en 'n breër volgehoue herstel in die wêreldwye ekonomie ervaar.
eng: we have seen a moderate recovery in our economy and a broader, sustained recovery in the global economy.

afr: kommoditeitspryse het verbeter en dit verbeter steeds, terwyl fabrieke heelwat bestellings kry, die aandelemark gestyg het, die rand versterk het en daar vroeë aanduidings is dat beleggersvertroue aan die toeneem is.
eng: commodity prices have improved, and keep on improving and factories receiving many orders, the stock market has risen, the rand has strengthened and there are early indications that investor confidence is on the rise.

afr: ons het beslissende maatreëls geneem om kommer oor politieke onstabiliteit die hoof te bied en ons is daartoe verbind om beleidsekerheid en konsekwentheid te verseker.
eng: we have taken decisive measures to address concerns about political instability and we are committed to ensure policy certainty and consistency.

afr: daar is 'n groter gevoel van optimisme onder ons mense.
eng: there is a greater sense of optimism among our people.

afr: ons mense is hoopvol oor die toekoms.
eng: our people are hopeful about the future.

afr: ondernemingsvertroue onder suid-afrikaanse maatskappye het verbeter en buitelandse beleggers kyk weer na geleenthede in ons land.
eng: business confidence among south african companies has improved and foreign investors are looking anew at opportunities in our country.

afr: sommige finansiële instellings het suid-afrika geïdentifiseer as een van die belowende ontluikende markte vir 2018. ons taak as suid-afrikaners, is om hierdie oomblik van hoop en vernuwing aan te gryp en om saam te werk om te verseker dat dit 'n betekenisvolle verskil in die lewens van ons mense sal maak.
eng: some financial institutions have identified south africa as one of the hot emerging markets for 2018. our task, as south africans, is to seize this moment of hope and renewal, and to work together to ensure that it makes a meaningful difference in the lives of our people.

afr: ons sal hierdie jaar maatreëls instel wat die weg sal baan vir nuwe groei, werkskepping en transformasie.
eng: this year, we will be initiating measures to set the country on a new path of growth, employment and transformation.

afr: ons sal dit doen deur sosiale vennote in ons land te kry om saam te werk met die bou van 'n sosiale verbintenisse waarvolgens ons ekonomiese herstel kan aandryf.
eng: we will do this by getting social partners in our country to collaborate in building a social compact on which we will create drivers of economic recovery.

afr: ons moet verder bou op gevestigde samewerking met die sake- en arbeidsektore om vertroue te herstel en om 'n verdere beleggingsafgradering te verhoed.
eng: we have to build further on the collaboration with business and labour to restore confidence and prevent an investment downgrade once more.

afr: daadwerklike besluite sal geneem moet word om ons fiskale leemte te vul, ons skuld te stabiliseer en ons ondernemings in staatsbesit te herstel.
eng: tough decisions have to be made to close our fiscal gap, stabilise our debt and restore our state-owned enterprises to health.

afr: die kern van ons nasionale agenda in 2018 is die skep van werksgeleenthede, veral vir die jeug.
eng: at the centre of our national agenda in 2018 is the creation of jobs, especially for the youth.

afr: ons beplan om 'n aantal maatreëls in werking stel om die werkloosheidsvraagstuk aan te pak.
eng: we are going to embark on a number of measures to address the unemployment challenge.

afr: een van die inisiatiewe sal wees om binne die volgende paar maande 'n beraad vir werksgeleenthede te belê om alle sektore en alle belanghebbendes wat noodsaaklike werksgeleenthede kan skep te belyn.
eng: one of the initiatives will be to convene a jobs summit within the next few months to align the efforts of every sector and every stakeholder behind the imperative of job creation.

afr: die beraad sal kyk na wat gedoen kan word om te verseker dat ons ekonomie groei en meer produktief word, dat maatskappye op 'n veel groter skaal belê, dat werkers beter toegerus is en dat ons ekonomiese infrastruktuur verder uitgebrei word.
eng: the summit will look at what we need to do to ensure our economy grows and becomes more productive, that companies invest on a far greater scale, that workers are better equipped, and that our economic infrastructure is also expanded.

afr: ons sal van hierdie beraad verwag om met praktiese oplossings en inisiatiewe vorendag te kom, wat onmiddellik geïmplementeer kan word.
eng: we will expect this summit to come up with practical solutions and initiatives that will be implemented immediately.

afr: ons sal vanjaar ook 'n daadwerklike poging aanwend om beduidende nuwe beleggings in ons ekonomie aan te moedig.
eng: we will make a major push this year to encourage significant new investment in our economy.

afr: om dié rede sal ons in die volgende drie maande 'n beleggingskonferensie organiseer, wat op binnelandse sowel as internasionale beleggers gerig sal wees, om die gebiedende beleggingsgeleenthede in ons land te bemark, en daar is baie sulke geleenthede.
eng: to this end, we will organise an investment conference in the next three months, targeting both domestic and international investors, to market the compelling investment opportunities to be found in our country and there are many such opportunities.

afr: ons gaan ook aandag gee aan die jarelange afname in ons vervaardigingskapasiteit, wat werk en uitvoere erg beïnvloed het.
eng: we are going to address the decline over many years of our manufacturing capacity, which has deeply affected employment and exports.

afr: ons sal poog om te herindustrialiseer op 'n skaal en teen 'n tempo wat miljoene werksoekers by die ekonomie sal betrek.
eng: we will seek to reindustrialise on a scale and at a pace that draws millions of job seekers into the economy.

afr: ons gaan groter belegging in belangrike vervaardigingsektore bevorder deur die strategiese gebruik van aansporings en deur verskeie ander maatreëls wat die regering tot sy beskikking het.
eng: we are going to promote greater investment in key manufacturing sectors through the strategic use of incentives and the number of other measures that government has at its disposal.

afr: om vervaardiging verder te stimuleer, sal ons die lokaliseringsprogram voortsit, waarvolgens produkte soos tekstiele, klere, meubels, spoorweg rollende materiaal en watermeters vir plaaslike verkryging toegewys sal word.
eng: to further stimulate manufacturing, we will forge ahead with the localisation programme, through which products like textile, clothing, furniture, rail rolling stock and water meters are designated for local procurement.

afr: ons het reeds meer as r57 miljard aan plaaslik vervaardigde goedere bestee, wat van ander lande af ingevoer kon word.
eng: we have already spent more than r57 billion on locally produced goods that may have been imported from other countries.

afr: dit is werkskepping deur invoere en uitvoere.
eng: that is job creation through imports and exports.

afr: spesiale ekonomiese sones is steeds belangrike hulpmiddels wat ons sal gebruik om strategiese buitelandse en plaaslike regstreekse beleggings te lok, geteikende nywerheidsvermoëns te bou en nuwe nywerheidspilpunte in ons land te vestig.
eng: special economic zones remain important instruments we will use to attract strategic foreign and domestic direct investment, and build targeted industrial capabilities and establish new industrial hubs throughout our country.

afr: die proses van industrialisering moet deur transformasie ondersteun word.
eng: the process of industrialisation must be underpinned by transformation.

afr: deur maatreëls soos voorkeurverkryging en die swart nywerheidsprogram, ontwikkel ons 'n nuwe geslag swart mans- en vroueprodusente wat ondernemings van beduidende skaal en vermoë kan opbou.
eng: through measures like preferential procurement and the black industrialists programme, we are developing a new generation of black men and women producers that are able to build enterprises of significant scale and capability.

afr: ons sal ons vermoë om swart professionele mense te ondersteun verbeter, beslissend optree teenoor maatskappye wat transformasie weerstaan, mededingingsbeleid gebruik om markte toeganklik te maak vir nuwe swart deelnemers en deur in die ontwikkeling van ondernemings in townships en landelike gebiede te belê.
eng: we will improve our capacity to support black professionals, deal decisively with companies that resist transformation, use competition policy to open markets up to new black entrants, and invest in the development of businesses in townships and rural areas.

afr: radikale ekonomiese transformasie vereis dat ons die posisie van swart vroue en gemeenskappe in die ekonomie fundamenteel verbeter, en verseker dat hulle eienaars, bestuurders en produsente word, en dat sommige van hulle uiteindelik selfs finansiers word.
eng: radical economic transformation requires that we fundamentally improve the position of black women and communities in the economy, ensuring that they are owners, managers, producers and in the end, some of them could even become financiers.

afr: ons grootste en dringendste uitdaging is jeugwerkloosheid.
eng: our most grave and most pressing challenge is youth unemployment.

afr: dit is dus baie dringend dat ons die jeug in veel groter getalle by produktiewe ekonomiese aktiwiteit in ons land betrek.
eng: it is therefore a matter of great urgency that we draw young people in far greater numbers into productive economic activity of our country.

afr: jong suid-afrikaners sal verplaas word na die middelpunt van ons ekonomiese agenda.
eng: young south africans will be moved to the centre of our economic agenda.

afr: hulle maak reeds 'n groter deel van die arbeidsmag in ons infrastruktuurprojekte uit en is die primêre begunstigdes van programme soos die installering van sonkragwaterverwarmers en die veldtog teen waterlekkasies.
eng: they are already forming a greater proportion of the labour force on our infrastructure projects and are the primary beneficiaries of programmes such as the installation of solar water heaters and the war on leaks.

afr: ons tree reeds daadwerklik op om ons jeug by die aanpak van hierdie uitdagings te betrek.
eng: we are taking steps in involving our youth in tackling these challenges.

afr: ons betrek ook steeds die jeug in veel groter getalle by produktiewe ekonomiese bedrywighede deur middel van programme soos die belastingaansporing vir indiensnemingprogram.
eng: we continue to draw young people in far greater numbers into productive economic activity through programmes such as the employment tax incentive.

afr: deur in vennootskap met sake-, georganiseerde arbeids- en gemeenskapsverteenwoordigers te werk, skep ons geleenthede vir jongmense om deur middel van internskappe, vakleerlingskappe, mentorskap en entrepreneurskap aan die werksomgewing blootgestel te word.
eng: working in partnership with business, organised labour and community representatives, we are creating opportunities for young people to be exposed to the world of work through internships, apprenticeships, mentorship and entrepreneurship.

afr: aanstaande maand begin ons die jeugdiensinisiatief wat werklose jongmense in betaalde internskappe in maatskappye in die ekonomie plaas.
eng: next month, we will launch the youth employment service initiative, which will place unemployed youth in paid internships in companies across the economy.

afr: saam met ons vennote in die sakesektor het ons ingestem om binne die volgende drie jaar 'n miljoen sulke internskappe te skep.
eng: together with our partners in business, we have agreed to create a million such internships in the next three years.

afr: om doeltreffend op die behoeftes van die jeug te reageer, is dit noodsaaklik dat jongmense hul standpunte artikuleer en met die regering op die hoogste vlak kan kommunikeer.
eng: if we are to respond effectively to the needs of youth, it is essential that young people articulate their views and are able to engage with government at the highest level.

afr: daarom sal ek 'n jeugwerkgroep stig wat verteenwoordigend sal wees van alle jong suid-afrikaners om te verseker dat ons beleide en programme hul belange bevorder.
eng: to this end, i will therefore be establishing a youth working group that is representative of all young south africans to ensure that our policies and programmes advance their interests.

afr: infrastruktuurbelegging is die sleutel tot ons pogings om die ekonomie te laat groei, werk te skep, klein sakeondernemings te bemagtig, en dienste aan ons mense te lewer.
eng: infrastructure investment is key to our efforts to grow the economy, create jobs, empower small businesses and provide services to our people.

afr: ons het swaar belê in nuwe paaie, kragstasies, skole en ander infrastruktuur.
eng: we have invested heavily in new roads, power stations, schools and other infrastructure.

afr: aangesien sommige van ons projekte tyd neem om op dreef te kom en om ons pogings te verbeter, sal ek 'n span op die been bring om die implementering van nuwe projekte te bespoedig, veral waterprojekte, gesondheidsfasiliteite en padonderhoud.
eng: as some of our projects are taking time to get off the ground and to enhance our efforts, i will assemble a team to speed up implementation of new projects, particularly water projects, health facilities and road maintenance.

afr: die span wat saamgestel word, sal die meeste van die werk doen.
eng: the team will be set up and will be doing most of the work.

afr: ons het 'n paar waardevolle lesse geleer uit ons ervarings met die bou van nuwe infrastruktuur, en dit sal vir ons ’n rigtingwyser wees vir die pad vorentoe.
eng: we have learnt some valuable lessons from our experience in building all the new infrastructure, which will inform our way ahead.

afr: ons sal op verbeterings in ons begroting en moniteringstelsels fokus, ons sal die integrasie van projekte verbeter en 'n sterk infrastruktuurbasis met die sakesektor en georganiseerde arbeid bou.
eng: we will focus on improvements in our budget and monitoring systems, improve the integration of projects and build a broad compact on infrastructure with business and organised labour.

afr: mynbou is nog 'n gebied met beduidende ongerealiseerde potensiaal vir groei en werkskepping.
eng: mining is another area that has massive unrealised potential for growth and job creation.

afr: ons moet mynbou as 'n sonsopkomsbedryf beskou, eerder as 'n sonsondergangbedryf.
eng: we need to see mining as a sunrise industry rather than a sunset industry.

afr: met die herlewing in kommoditeitspryse is ons vasbeslote om met mynmaatskappye, vakbonde en gemeenskappe saam te werk om die sektor te laat groei, nuwe beleggingsgeleenthede te skep, werksgeleenthede te skep en die bedryf op 'n nuwe pad van transformasie en volhoubaarheid te plaas.
eng: with the revival in commodity prices, we are determined to work with mining companies, unions and communities to grow the sector, attract new investment, create jobs and set the industry on a new path of transformation and sustainability.

afr: vanjaar sal ons gesprekvoering met alle belanghebbendes op die mynbouhandves versterk om te verseker dat dit werklik 'n doeltreffende instrumentword, wat die beeld van mynbou in suid-afrika volhoubaar sal verander.
eng: this year, we will intensify engagements with all stakeholders on the mining charter to ensure that it is truly an effective instrument to sustainably transform the face of mining in south africa.

afr: deur saam te werk in 'n opregte vennootskap wat onderstreep word deur vertroue en 'n gedeelde visie, is ek seker dat ons die huidige impasse kan oplos en ooreen kan kom oor 'n handves wat transformasie versnel, sowel as om hierdie belangrike sektor van ons ekonomie te laat groei.
eng: by working together, in a genuine partnership, underscored by trust and a shared vision, i am certain we will be able to resolve the current impasse and agree on a charter that both accelerates transformation and grows this vital sector of our economy.

afr: die hersiening van die wysigingswetsontwerp op die ontwikkeling van minerale en petroleumhulpbronne deur albei huise van die parlement is in 'n gevorderde stadium, met 'n aanduiding deur die parlement dat die wetsontwerp redelikerwys in die eerste kwartaal van 2018 afgehandel sal word.
eng: processing of the mineral and petroleum resources development amendment bill through both houses of parliament is at an advanced stage, with an indication by parliament that the bill will reasonably be finalised during the first quarter of 2018. the bill, once enacted into law, will entrench existing regulatory certainty, provide for security of tenure and advance the socio-economic interests of all south africans.

afr: ons is uiters bekommerd oor die toename in mynsterftes, veral verlede jaar.
eng: we are extremely concerned about the rise in mining fatalities, particularly last year.

afr: ons doen 'n beroep op mynmaatskappye om saam met alle belanghebbendes te werk om te verseker dat mynongelukke dramaties verminder word.
eng: we call on mining companies to work together with all stakeholders to ensure that mine accidents are dramatically reduced.

afr: een mynsterfte is een te veel.
eng: one mining fatality is one too many.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,ons ekonomiese groei sal uiteindelik deur klein ondernemings volhou word, soos in baie ander lande.
eng: fellow south africans,ultimately, the growth of our economy will be sustained by small businesses, as is the case in many countries.

afr: dit is ons gesamentlike verantwoordelikheid om hierdie belangrike sektor van die ekonomie te laat groei.
eng: it is our shared responsibility to grow this vital sector of the economy.

afr: ons sal met ons maatskaplike vennote saamwerk om 'n ondersteuningstelsel vir klein ondernemings te vestig wat entrepreneurs sal bystaan, aanmoedig en bevorder.
eng: we will work with our social partners to build a small business support ecosystem that assists, nourishes and promotes entrepreneurs.

afr: die regering sal sy verbintenis nakom om minstens 30% van die openbare verkrygings aan klein, medium en mikro-ondernemings, koöperasies, en township- en landelike ondernemings opsy te sit.
eng: government will honour its undertaking to set aside at least 30% of public procurement to small, medium and micro enterprises, cooperatives, and township and rural enterprises.

afr: ons sal ook voortgaan om in die ontwikkeling van klein ondernemings te belêons moedig groot ondernemings aan om dieselfde te doen en maniere te vind om klein ondernemings te help ontwikkel.
eng: we will also continue to invest in small business incubation.

afr: ons sal die regulerende struikelblokke vir klein ondernemings verminder.
eng: finding a way of incubating small businesses.

afr: ek gaan seker maak dat regulerende struikelblokke verminder word.
eng: we will reduce the regulatory barriers for small businesses.

afr: ons is ook besig om ekonomiese geleenthede vir mense met gestremdhede uit te brei.
eng: we are also working to expand economic opportunities for people with disabilities.

afr: die small enterprise finance agency het, onder meer, 'n skema wat die amavulandlela-befondsingskema genoem het, van stapel gestuur om entrepreneurs met gestremdhede te help ontwikkel en te befonds,landbou bied een van die grootste geleenthede om ons ekonomie aansienlik te laat groei en werk te skep.
eng: among other things, the small enterprise finance agency has launched a scheme to develop and fund entrepreneurs with disabilities called the amavulandlela funding scheme.

afr: tsena tsa temo ke tsona tse bohlokwa le ho feta, ka hobane ke moo batho ba rona ba tla fumanang menyetla e metle ya hore ba kene kgwebong ena ya tsa ho lema.
eng: tsena tsa temo ke tsona tse bohlokwa le ho feta, ka hobane ke moo batho ba rona ba tla fumanang menyetla e metle ya hore ba kene kgwebong ena ya tsa ho lema.

afr: ke moo re shebileng hore re ka kgona ho aha mesebetsi.
eng: ke moo re shebileng hore re ka kgona ho aha mesebetsi.

afr: bane ba national planning commission ba ile ba re ho rona re ka kgona ho aha mesebetsi e lekanang milione ha re tla ho ena ya agriculture.. die landbou-sektor is die belangrikste, want dit is waar ons mense toegang kry tot beter geleenthede om kommersiële boerdery te betree.
eng: bane ba national planning commission ba ile ba re ho rona re ka kgona ho aha mesebetsi e lekanang milione ha re tla ho ena ya agriculture.

afr: dit is waar ons fokus op die skep van werksgeleenthede lê.
eng: that is where our focus of creating jobs lies.

afr: die nasionale beplanningskommissie het ons laat weet dat ons in die landbousektor ongeveer een miljoen werksgeleenthede kan skep.. landbou het die grootste bydrae, met 'n beduidende marge, tot die verbeterde groei van ons ekonomie in die tweede en derde kwartaal van 2017 gelei.
eng: the national planning commission informed us that, when it comes to agricultural sector, we can be able to create about one million jobs).

afr: vanjaar sal ons daadwerklike stappe doen om die enorme ekonomiese potensiaal van die landbou te verwesenlik.
eng: agriculture has made the largest contribution, by a significant margin, to the improved growth of our economy in the second and third quarters of 2017. this year, we will take decisive action to realise the enormous economic potential of agriculture.

afr: ons sal ons grondherverdelingsprogram versnel, nie net om 'n ernstige historiese onreg te herstel nie, maar ook om meer produsente na die landbousektor te bring en meer grond beskikbaar te stel vir verbouing.
eng: we will accelerate our land redistribution programme not only to redress a grave historical injustice, but also to bring more producers into the agricultural sector and to make more land available for cultivation.

afr: ons sal 'n omvattende benadering volg wat doeltreffend gebruik sal maak van al die meganismes tot ons beskikking.
eng: we will pursue a comprehensive approach that makes effective use of all the mechanisms at our disposal.

afr: hierdie benadering, gelei deur die besluite van die regerende party se 54ste nasionale konferensie, sal die onteiening van grond sonder vergoeding insluit.
eng: guided by the resolutions of the 54th national conference of the governing party, this approach will include the expropriation of land without compensation.

afr: ons is vasbeslote dat onteiening sonder vergoeding geïmplementeer moet word op 'n manier wat landbouproduksie verhoog, voedselveiligheid verbeter en verseker dat die grond terugbesorg word aan diegene van wie dit onder kolonialisme en apartheid weggeneem is.
eng: we are determined that expropriation without compensation should be implemented in a way that increases agricultural production, improves food security and ensure that the land is returned to those from whom it was taken under colonialism and apartheid.

afr: die regering sal 'n oorlegplegingsproses onderneem om die modaliteite van die implementering van hierdie besluit te bepaal.
eng: government will undertake a process of consultation to determine the modalities of the implementation of this resolution.

afr: ons doen 'n spesiale beroep op finansiële instellings in ons land om ons vennote te wees in die mobilisering van hulpbronne om die land se herverdelingsprogram te versnel, aangesien meer belegging in hierdie sektor nodig sal wees, sodat ons landbou as 'n sonsopkoms in ons land se ekonomie hanteer.
eng: we make a special call to financial institutions in our country to be our partners in mobilising resources to accelerate the land redistribution programme as increased investment will be needed in this sector.

afr: toerisme is 'n ander gebied wat ongelooflike geleenthede aan ons land bied om letterlik uit te blink.
eng: so that we treat agriculture as a sunrise in the economy of our country.

afr: toerisme verskaf tans 700 000 regstreekse werksgeleenthede en presteer beter as die meeste ander groeisektore.
eng: tourism currently sustains 700 000 direct jobs and is performing better than most other growth sectors.

afr: daar is geen rede waarom dit nie in grootte kan verdubbel nie.
eng: there is no reason why it can’t double in size.

afr: ons het die mooiste land in die wêreld en ons is die mees gasvrye mense ter wêreld.
eng: we have the most beautiful country in the world and we are the most hospitable people.

afr: suid-afrikaners moet hul harte, hutte en rondawels oopmaak vir ons toeriste.
eng: south africans should open their hearts, huts and rondavels to our tourists.

afr: ons sal vanjaar ons ondersteuning vir bestemmingsbemarking in sleutel toerisme-markte verbeter en verdere maatreëls tref om regulerende hindernisse te verminder en ontluikende toerisme-ondernemings te ontwikkel.
eng: this year, we will enhance support for destination marketing in key tourism markets and take further measures to reduce regulatory barriers and develop emerging tourism businesses.

afr: ons doen 'n beroep op alle suid-afrikaners om hul huise en hul harte na die wêreld oop te maak.
eng: we call on all south africans to open their homes and their hearts to the world.

afr: ons voorspoed as ’n nasie hang af van ons vermoë om vinnige tegnologiese verandering ten volle te benut.
eng: our prosperity as a nation depends on our ability to take full advantage of rapid technological change.

afr: dit beteken dat ons dringend ons vermoëns op die gebied van wetenskap, tegnologie en innovasie moet ontwikkel.
eng: this means that we urgently need to develop our capabilities in the areas of science, technology and innovation.

afr: ons sal binnekort 'n kommissie vir ’n digitale industriële rewolusie op die been bring, wat die private sektor en die burgerlike samelewing sal insluit, om te verseker dat ons land in staat is om die geleenthede te benut en die uitdagings van vinnige vooruitgang in inligting- en kommunikasietegnologie te bestuur.
eng: we will soon establish a digital industrial revolution commission, which will include the private sector and civil society, to ensure that our country is in a position to seize the opportunities and manage the challenges of rapid advances in information and communications technology.

afr: die aandrywing van die digitale industriële rewolusie sal ondersteun word deur die beskikbaarheid van doeltreffende netwerke.
eng: the drive towards the digital industrial revolution will be underpinned by the availability of efficient networks.

afr: ons sal ons gesprekvoering met die telekommunikasiebedryf en ander belanghebbers finaliseer om te verseker dat die toekenning van spektrum die versperrings tot toegang verminder, mededinging bevorder en die koste vir verbruikers verminder.
eng: we will finalise our engagements with the telecommunications industry and other stakeholders to ensure that the allocation of spectrum reduces barriers to entry, promotes competition and reduces the cost to consumers.

afr: suid-afrika het die drieparty-vryhandelsgebiedooreenkoms aanvaar, wat die suider-afrikaanse ontwikkelingsgemeenskap, die gemeenskaplike mark vir oos- en suider-afrika en die oos-afrikaanse gemeenskap bymekaarbring.
eng: south africa has acceded to the tripartite free trade area agreement, which brings together the southern african development community, common market for eastern and southern africa and the east african community.

afr: die vryhandelsgebied sal markte van 26 lande met 'n bevolking van bykans 625 miljoen, kombineer.
eng: the free trade area will combine markets of 26 countries with a population of nearly 625 million.

afr: dit sal geleenthede vir toegang tot nuwe markte vir suid-afrikaanse uitvoerprodukte open en ’n bydrae maak tot werkskepping en die groei van suid-afrika se nywerheidsektor.
eng: it will open market access opportunities for south african export products, and contribute to job creation and the growth of south africa’s industrial sector.

afr: onderhandelinge oor die kontinentale vryhandelsooreenkoms vorder vinnig, en na verwagting sal die raamwerkooreenkoms binnekort afgesluit kan word.
eng: negotiations towards the continental free trade agreement are progressing at a brisk pace, and it is expected that the framework agreement could be concluded soon.

afr: suid-afrika neem vanjaar die voorsitterskap van die groep brasilië, rusland, indië, china en suid-afrika (brics) oor en sal voorkeur gee aan die bevordering van toegevoegde waarde-handel en intra-brics-belegging in produktiewe sektore.
eng: south africa will this year take over the chair of the brazil, russia, india, china and south africa (brics) group of countries, and will give priority to the promotion of value-added trade and intra-brics investment into productive sectors.

afr: mede-suid-afrikaners,op 1 mei vanjaar sal ons die eerste nasionale minimumloon in suid-afrika bekendstel.
eng: fellow south africans,on the 1st of may this year, we will introduce the first national minimum wage in south africa.

afr: hierdie historiese prestasie – 'n verwesenliking van een van die vryheidshandves se vereistes – sal na verwagting meer as ses miljoen werkende suid-afrikaners se inkomste verhoog en die lewensomstandighede van huishoudings regoor die land verbeter.
eng: this historic achievement – a realisation of one of the demands of the freedom charter – is expected to increase the earnings of more than six million working south africans and improve the living conditions of households across the country.

afr: die instelling van 'n nasionale minimumloon is moontlik gemaak deur die vasberadenheid van alle maatskaplike vennote om loonongelykheid te verminder terwyl ekonomiese groei en werkskepping behou word.
eng: the introduction of a national minimum wage was made possible by the determination of all social partners to reduce wage inequality while maintaining economic growth and employment creation.

afr: dit dien as nog 'n voorbeeld van wat moontlik is wanneer suid-afrikaners sinvol kommunikeer om verskille, wanbegrippe en probleme uit die weg te ruim en uitdagings te konfronteer.
eng: it stands as another example of what is possible when south africans engage in meaningful dialogue to resolve differences, difficulties and problems, and confront challenges.

afr: om groter samehang en konsekwentheid in die implementering van ekonomiese beleid te verseker – en om te verseker dat ons beter toegerus is om te reageer op voortdurend veranderende ekonomiese omstandighede – sal ek 'n presidensiële ekonomiese adviesraad aanstel.
eng: to ensure greater coherence and consistency in the implementation of economic policy – and to ensure that we are better equipped to respond to continuously changing economic circumstances – i will be appointing a presidential economic advisory council.

afr: die raad sal gebruik maak van die kundigheid en vermoëns wat in die arbeid- en sakesektor, die burgerlike samelewing en die akademiese omgewing gesetel is.
eng: it will draw on the expertise and capabilities that reside in labour, business, civil society and academia.

afr: die land is steeds vasgevang in een van die ernstigste droogtes van die afgelope eeu, wat ’n verwoestende invloed op ons ekonomie het en ook maatskaplike dienste en landbouproduksie negatief raak.
eng: the country remains gripped by one of the most devastating droughts in a century, which has severely impacted our economy, which also negatively affected social services and agricultural production.

afr: die droogte in die wes-, oos- en noord-kaap is verhef tot 'n nasionale ramptoestand.
eng: the drought situation in the western cape, eastern cape and northern cape has been elevated to a national state of disaster.

afr: dit gee die nasionale regering die gesag om die land se reaksie op die droogte nasionaal te bestuur en te koördineer in samewerking met al die provinsies.
eng: this gives national government the authority to manage and coordinate our response nationally with the support from all provinces.

afr: dit sal verseker dat ons ook geïntegreerde maatreëls versterk om die provinsies wat die swaarste getref word, te ondersteun.
eng: this will ensure that we also heighten integrated measures to support the provinces that are hardest hit.

afr: ons is besig om die nodige buitengewone maatreëls wat ingevolge die wetgewing toegelaat word, te aktiveer.
eng: we are looking at activating the necessary extraordinary measures permitted under the legislation.

afr: ek prys die mense van kaapstad en die res van die wes-kaap vir hul ywerige pogings om waterbesparende maatreëls toe te pas.
eng: i commend the people of cape town and the rest of the western cape for diligently observing water saving measures.

afr: ons doen 'n ernstige beroep op almal in die land om water spaarsamig te gebruik, want ons is in wese 'n waterskaars land wat staatmaak op hierdie belangrike hulpbron om ons ontwikkelingsoogmerke te verwesenlik.
eng: we call on everyone in the country to use water sparingly as we are essentially a water-scarce country that relies on this vital resource to realise our development aspirations.

afr: eerbare raadslede,op 16 desember verlede jaar het voormalige president jacob zuma aangekondig dat die regering oor 'n tydperk van vyf jaar ten volle gesubsidieerde hoër onderwys en opleiding vir arm en werkersklas suid-afrikaners sal infaseer.
eng: honourable members,on 16 december last year, former president jacob zuma announced that government would be phasing in fully subsidised free higher education and training for poor and working class south africans over a five-year period.

afr: vanaf hierdie jaar sal gratis hoër onderwys en opleiding beskikbaar wees vir eerstejaarstudente van huishoudings met 'n bruto gekombineerde jaarlikse inkomste van tot r350 000. die minister van hoër onderwys en opleiding sal die implementering van hierdie beleid lei, terwyl die minister van finansies alle aspekte van die finansiering van die skema tydens sy begrotingsrede volgende week sal verduidelik.
eng: starting this year, free higher education and training will be available to first year students from households with a gross combined annual income of up to r350 000. the minister of higher education and training will lead the implementation of this policy, while the minister of finance will clarify all aspects of the financing of the scheme during his budget speech next week.

afr: benewens die bevordering van maatskaplike geregtigheid, sal 'n belegging van hierdie skaal in hoër onderwys na verwagting bydra tot groter ekonomiese groei, wat sal help om armoede hok te slaan, ongelykheid te verminder, inkomste te verhoog en die mededingendheid van ons ekonomie te versterk.
eng: in addition to promoting social justice, an investment of this scale in higher education is expected to contribute to greater economic growth to also help in reducing poverty, reduce inequality, enhance earnings and increase the competitiveness of our economy.

afr: die regering sal voortgaan om in die uitbreiding van toegang tot gehalte basiese onderwys te belê, sowel as in die verbetering van ons openbare skole se uitslae.
eng: government will continue to invest in expanding access to quality basic education and improving the outcomes of our public schools.

afr: die funza lushaka beursprogram beplan om die volgende drie jaar 39 500 beurse vir aanvanklike onderwysersopleiding beskikbaar te stel.
eng: the funza lushaka bursary programme plans to award 39 500 bursaries for initial teacher education over the next three years.

afr: in 'n historiese eerste, het alle openbare skole vanaf die begin van hierdie jaar af, begin om 'n afrikataal aan te bied.
eng: in an historic first, from the beginning of this year, all public schools have begun offering an african language.

afr: dit is ook belangrik dat die eerste nasionale senior sertifikaat-eksamen in suid-afrikaanse gebaretaal aan die einde van 2018 vir dowe leerders aangebied sal word.
eng: also significant is the implementation of the first national senior certificate examination on south african sign language, which will be offered to deaf learners at the end of 2018. the accelerated schools infrastructure delivery initiative programme continues to deliver modern facilities to schools in rural and underprivileged urban areas across the country, with at least 187 schools being complete to date.

afr: die program sal alle uitstaande projekte teen die einde van die volgende finansiële jaar voltooi.
eng: the programme will complete all outstanding projects by the end of the next financial year.

afr: maatskaplike toelaes bly 'n belangrike lewenslyn vir miljoene van ons mense wat in armoede leef.
eng: social grants remain a vital lifeline for millions of our people living in poverty.

afr: ons sal dringend stappe neem om te voldoen aan al die riglyne van die konstitusionele hof.
eng: we will urgently take decisive steps to comply with all the directives of the constitutional court.

afr: ek wil graag die vrese oor enige ontwrigting van die doeltreffende lewering van hierdie kritieke diens persoonlik uit die weg ruim, en ek sal streng optree om te verseker dat niemand in die regering die implementeringstermyne wat deur die hof gestel word, ondermyn nie.
eng: i want to personally allay fears of any disruption to the efficient delivery of this critical service, and will take action to ensure no person in government is undermining implementation deadlines set by the court.

afr: ons sal 'n permanente openbare sektor-geleide hibriede model finaliseer, waarvolgens 'n stel openbare en privaat sektor diensverskaffers aan die begunstigdes maksimum keuse, toegang en gerief sal bied.
eng: we will finalise work on a permanent public sector-led hybrid model, which will allow a set of public and private sector service providers to offer beneficiaries maximum choice, access and convenience.

afr: hierdie jaar sal ons die volgende kritiese stappe doen om miv uit ons midde uit te skakel.
eng: this year, we will take the next critical steps to eliminate hiv from our midst.

afr: deur ons toets- en behandelingsveldtog op te gradeer, sal nog twee miljoen mense teen desember 2020 met antiretrovirale behandeling kan begin.
eng: by scaling up our testing and treating campaign, we will initiate an additional two million people on antiretroviral treatment by december 2020. we will also need to confront lifestyles diseases such as high blood pressure, diabetes, cancers and cardiovascular diseases.

afr: ons sal ook lewenstylsiektes soos hoë bloeddruk, diabetes, kanker en kardiovaskulêre siektes moet konfronteer.
eng: in the next three months, we will launch a huge cancer campaign similar to the hiv counselling and testing campaign that we launched.

afr: dit sal ook die private sektor betrek, aangesien ons alle hulpbronne moet mobiliseer om hierdie siekte te beveg.
eng: this will also involve the private sector, as we need to mobilise all resources to fight this disease.

afr: die tyd het aangebreek om uiteindelik universele gesondheidsdekking deur die nasionale gesondheidsversekering (nhi) te implementeer.
eng: the time has now arrived to finally implement universal health coverage through the national health insurance (nhi).

afr: die nhi-wetsontwerp is nou gereed om deur die regering verwerk te word en sal binne die volgende paar weke aan die parlement voorgelê word.
eng: the nhi bill is now ready to be processed through government and will be submitted to parliament in the next few weeks.

afr: sekere nhi-projekte wat op die mees kwesbare mense in die samelewing fokus, sal in april vanjaar begin.
eng: certain nhi projects targeting the most vulnerable people in society will commence in april this year.

afr: om die lewensgehalte van alle suid-afrikaners te verbeter, moet ons ons pogings om misdaad te bestry, versterk en veiliger gemeenskappe bou.
eng: in improving the quality of life of all south africans, we must intensify our efforts to tackle crime and build safer communities.

afr: in die loop van die jaar sal die gemeenskapspolisiëringstrategie in werking gestel word, met die doel om die gemeenskap se vertroue te wen en almal se volle betrokkenheid en samewerking in die stryd teen misdaad te verseker.
eng: during the course of this year, the community policing strategy will be implemented, with the aim of gaining the trust of the community and to secure their full involvement and cooperation in the fight against crime.
